original: @22b * // rnam grangs bsdu ba bzhugs /
analyzed: @22b * // rnam grangs bsdu ba bzhugs /
translated: The Compendium of Ascertainments

original: * // rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las rnam grangs bsdu ba /
analyzed: * // rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las rnam grangs bsdu ba /
translated: The Compendium of Ascertainments from the Levels of Yogic Practice

original: spyi sdom ni /
analyzed: spyi sdom ni /
translated: The general summary:

original: dkar po'i phyogs dang nag po'i phyogs //
analyzed: dkar po'i phyogs dang nag po'i phyogs //
translated: The bright side and the dark side

original: rnam grangs dag ni yang dag bshad //üîΩdon gyis blo rab rtogs bya'i phyir //
analyzed: rnam grangs dag ni yang dag bshad // don gyis blo rab rtogs bya'i phyir //
translated: Are explained in terms of their enumeration.

original: spyi yi sdom ni bsdus pa yin //
analyzed: spyi yi sdom ni bsdus pa yin //
translated: The general summary is a summaryüîΩFor the sake of understanding the meaning with the highest mind.

original: sdom ni / ston dang mchog nyid shes rab bzhi //
analyzed: sdom ni / ston dang mchog nyid shes rab bzhi //
translated: The summary: The Teacher, the supreme, wisdom,üîΩThe four, likewise, the well-spoken,üîΩThe setting, generosity,

original: de bzhin legs par gsungs pa dang // gleng gzhi yod dang sbyin pa dang // tshul khrims lam rab rgyas pa yin //
analyzed: de bzhin legs par gsungs pa dang // gleng gzhi yod dang sbyin pa dang // tshul khrims lam rab rgyas pa yin //
translated: The path of ethics, and the extensive.

original: de la ston pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
analyzed: de la ston pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
translated: The Teacher is the TathƒÅgata.

original: rab tu ston pa ni de'i slob ma'i mchog rnams te gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu ston pa ni de'i slob ma'i mchog rnams te gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bu la sogs pa'o //
translated: The supreme teachers are his supreme disciples, such as the elder ≈öƒÅriputra.

original: rjes su ston pa ni slob dpon dang / mkhan po dang / chos mthun pa ba rnams dang / skul bar byed pa rnams dang / dran par byed pa rnams so //
analyzed: rjes su ston pa ni slob dpon dang / mkhan po dang / chos mthun pa ba rnams dang / skul bar byed pa rnams dang / dran par byed pa rnams so //
translated: The instructors are the masters, preceptors, and Dharma friends, those who exhort and remind.

original: de la ston pa ni ston par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de la ston pa ni ston par byed pa'o //
translated: The Teacher is the one who teaches.

original: rab tu ston pa ni rab tu ston par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu ston pa ni rab tu ston par byed pa'o //
translated: The one who teaches well is the one who teaches well.

original: rjes su ston pa ni rjes su ston par byed pa'o //üîΩbya ba rjes su gnang ba dang / bya ba ma yin pa 'gog pa dang / dus dus su gdams ngag dang / rjes su bstan pa la rab tu 'jug par byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rjes su ston pa ni rjes su ston par byed pa'o // bya ba rjes su gnang ba dang / bya ba ma yin pa 'gog pa dang / dus dus su gdams ngag dang / rjes su bstan pa la rab tu 'jug par byed pa'i phyir /
translated: The one who instructs is the one who instructs.

original: de dag nyid gsung ba dang / rab tu gsung pa dang / rjes su gsung ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag nyid gsung ba dang / rab tu gsung pa dang / rjes su gsung ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The one who speaks, the one who speaks well, and the one who instructs should be understood as the one who permits what should be done, the one who prohibits what should not be done, and the one who engages in timely advice and instruction.

original: 'dren pa ni bya ba ma yin ba la brtson pa rnams tshar gcod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'dren pa ni bya ba ma yin ba la brtson pa rnams tshar gcod par byed pa'o //
translated: The Leader is the one who subdues those who are engaged in what should not be done.

original: rnam par 'dren pa ni bya ba la brtson pa rnams yang dag par mgu bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par 'dren pa ni bya ba la brtson pa rnams yang dag par mgu bar byed pa'o //
translated: The Guide is the one who delights those who are engaged in what should be done.

original: rab tu 'dren pa ni de gnyi ga yang dag par skul bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu 'dren pa ni de gnyi ga yang dag par skul bar byed pa'o //
translated: The one who leads well is the one who encourages both of those.

original: 'dren par byed pa ni the tshom skyes shing byung ba yang dang yang du rnam par sel bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'dren par byed pa ni the tshom skyes shing byung ba yang dang yang du rnam par sel bar byed pa'o //
translated: The one who guides is the one who repeatedly dispels doubt that has arisen.

original: rnam par 'dren par byed pa ni 'gyod pa rnams yang dang yang du rnam par sel bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par 'dren par byed pa ni 'gyod pa rnams yang dang yang du rnam par sel bar byed pa'o //
translated: The guide is the one who repeatedly removes regrets.

original: rab tu 'dren par byed pa ni nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams yang dang yang du rnam par sel bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu 'dren par byed pa ni nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams yang dang yang du rnam par sel bar byed pa'o //
translated: The leader is the one who repeatedly removes the afflictions and the secondary afflictions.

original: yang the tshom rnams gcod par byed pa dang / don dam par ma phye ba rnams rnam par 'byed par byed pa dang / don rnam par phye ba rnams gsal bar byed pa dang / don dang tshig zab mo shes rab kyis yang dang yang du rtogs par byas te /
analyzed: yang the tshom rnams gcod par byed pa dang / don dam par ma phye ba rnams rnam par 'byed par byed pa dang / don rnam par phye ba rnams gsal bar byed pa dang / don dang tshig zab mo shes rab kyis yang dang yang du rtogs par byas te /
translated: Moreover, the one who cuts through doubts, who analyzes what has not been analyzed in the ultimate sense, who clarifies what has been analyzed, and who repeatedly realizes with wisdom the profound meaning and the profound words,

original: rgya cher yang dag par rab tu ston pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgya cher yang dag par rab tu ston pa'i phyir /
translated: teaches them extensively and correctly.

original: 'dren par byed pa la sogs pa dang go rims @23a * //
analyzed: 'dren par byed pa la sogs pa dang go rims @23a * //
translated: Thus, he is the guide and so forth, respectively.

original: bzhin no // slob dpon ni bla ma'i gnas su khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: bzhin no // slob dpon ni bla ma'i gnas su khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: The master is the one who is accepted as the highest guru.

original: gnyis pa ni grogs byed pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni grogs byed pa ste /
translated: The second is the one who helps.

original: de dang mthun par rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang mthun par rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is the one who engages in the practice in accordance with that.

original: mdza' bshes ni khyim pa'i tshe'i grogs po rnying pa'o //
analyzed: mdza' bshes ni khyim pa'i tshe'i grogs po rnying pa'o //
translated: Friends are those who were friends in the householder's life.

original: snying du sdug pa ni pha dang ma dang de dang 'brel ba'o //
analyzed: snying du sdug pa ni pha dang ma dang de dang 'brel ba'o //
translated: Those dear are parents and those related to them.

original: snying brtse ba ni 'brel ba med par phan 'dogs pa'o //
analyzed: snying brtse ba ni 'brel ba med par phan 'dogs pa'o //
translated: Those compassionate are those who help without any relationship.

original: don zhes bya ba ni don du gnyer ba dang don dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: don zhes bya ba ni don du gnyer ba dang don dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The word purpose means that which is desired and that which is purposeful.

original: de 'dod pa ni don 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: de 'dod pa ni don 'dod pa'o //
translated: The word desire means the desire for that purpose.

original: phan pa zhes bya ba ni dge ba spyod pa'o //
analyzed: phan pa zhes bya ba ni dge ba spyod pa'o //
translated: The word benefit means virtuous practice.

original: de 'dod pa ni phan pa 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: de 'dod pa ni phan pa 'dod pa'o //
translated: The word desire means the desire for that benefit.

original: reg par gnas pa ni lus dang sems la phan 'dogs pa'i don gyis bde ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: reg par gnas pa ni lus dang sems la phan 'dogs pa'i don gyis bde ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The word happiness means that which is desired for the benefit of body and mind.

original: de 'dod pa ni bde ba 'dod pa'o //üîΩreg par 'dod pa ni mthong ba'i chos kyi bde ba las brtsams pa'o //
analyzed: de 'dod pa ni bde ba 'dod pa'o // reg par 'dod pa ni mthong ba'i chos kyi bde ba las brtsams pa'o //
translated: The word desire means the desire for that happiness.üîΩThe word touch means the desire for happiness in this life.

original: grub pa dang bde bar 'dod pa ni tshe phyi ma'i bde ba las brtsams pa'o //
analyzed: grub pa dang bde bar 'dod pa ni tshe phyi ma'i bde ba las brtsams pa'o //
translated: The word accomplishment means the desire for happiness in future lives.

original: mngon par yid ches pa ni thams cad la mngon par yid ches pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par yid ches pa ni thams cad la mngon par yid ches pa'o //
translated: The word faith means faith in all.

original: de nyid des yon tan dang mthu dang shes rab mchog tu 'byung ba thos nas /
analyzed: de nyid des yon tan dang mthu dang shes rab mchog tu 'byung ba thos nas /
translated: Having heard that the latter is the source of the highest virtues, powers, and wisdom,

original: gang zag gi rten gyi sgo nas dang po'o //
analyzed: gang zag gi rten gyi sgo nas dang po'o //
translated: the first is from the point of view of the individual as basis.

original: de nyid chos kyi gzhi dang rig pa'i sgo dang mthun pa ni dang pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid chos kyi gzhi dang rig pa'i sgo dang mthun pa ni dang pa ste /
translated: The second is from the point of view of the basis of the Dharma and the door of knowledge.

original: gang gi dbang du byas te spu zing zhes byed pa dang / mchi ma dkrug ces byed pa la sogs pa dang ba'i rtags 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: gang gi dbang du byas te spu zing zhes byed pa dang / mchi ma dkrug ces byed pa la sogs pa dang ba'i rtags 'byung ba yin no //
translated: The signs of faith are the horripilation, tears, etc. which occur when one is in the presence of the latter.

original: nges par rtogs pas ni yon tan la sogs pa ma thos pa spyod lam dang / spyod pa dang / gnas pa dag las de la yon tan yod par yid ches pa'o //
analyzed: nges par rtogs pas ni yon tan la sogs pa ma thos pa spyod lam dang / spyod pa dang / gnas pa dag las de la yon tan yod par yid ches pa'o //
translated: By means of ascertainment, one has confidence in the existence of the virtues, etc. of the latter, from the point of view of his behavior, conduct, and attitude, even though one has not heard of them.

original: 'dun pa ni de byed 'dod pa dang / thob par 'dod pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'dun pa ni de byed 'dod pa dang / thob par 'dod pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Aspiration is the desire to do that and the desire to attain that.

original: brtson 'grus ni brtson 'grus brtsams pa'i sems mngon par spro ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus ni brtson 'grus brtsams pa'i sems mngon par spro ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: Exertion is the mental enthusiasm of one who has begun to make effort.

original: rtsol ba ni spro ba byas pa sbyor ba de la rtsol ba'o //
analyzed: rtsol ba ni spro ba byas pa sbyor ba de la rtsol ba'o //
translated: Striving is the effort in that application which has begun.

original: nges par 'byung ba ni brtson 'grus brtsams pa mi gtong zhing rgyun du byed pa ste phyir mi bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba ni brtson 'grus brtsams pa mi gtong zhing rgyun du byed pa ste phyir mi bzlog pa'o //
translated: Determined effort is the continuous practice of the beginning of effort without abandoning it, without turning back.

original: brtul ba ni brtson 'grus gus par brtson pa'o //
analyzed: brtul ba ni brtson 'grus gus par brtson pa'o //
translated: Exertion is the respectful practice of effort.

original: mthu ni mtshan mo'am thun 'das nas brtson 'grus 'di dang 'di lta bu zhig brtsam mo zhes snga nas sems pa'i go cha gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mthu ni mtshan mo'am thun 'das nas brtson 'grus 'di dang 'di lta bu zhig brtsam mo zhes snga nas sems pa'i go cha gang yin pa'o //
translated: Power is the armoring of the mind beforehand, thinking, I will begin this and that effort whether it is night or day, whether it is the end of the period or not.

original: rtsol ba ni ji ltar go cha bgos pa'am khyad par du 'phags par brtson 'grus rtsom pa'o //
analyzed: rtsol ba ni ji ltar go cha bgos pa'am khyad par du 'phags par brtson 'grus rtsom pa'o //
translated: Exertion is the practice of effort according to the armoring, or the practice of effort with a superior attitude.

original: spro ba ni brtson 'grus brtsams pa de'i 'bras bu'i phan yon mthong ba'o //
analyzed: spro ba ni brtson 'grus brtsams pa de'i 'bras bu'i phan yon mthong ba'o //
translated: Joy is the vision of the benefit of the fruit of the effort that has been begun.

original: bzod spro ni de dang ldan pa grang ba @23b la sogs pa'i gnod pa dang du len pa'o //
analyzed: bzod spro ni de dang ldan pa grang ba @23b la sogs pa'i gnod pa dang du len pa'o //
translated: Willingness is the acceptance of the harm of cold and so on that is possessed by one who has joy.

original: mngon par spro ba ni snga phyi'i khyad par shes nas gong ma'i khyad par thob par bya ba la yid ches pa skyes pa'i brtson 'grus gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par spro ba ni snga phyi'i khyad par shes nas gong ma'i khyad par thob par bya ba la yid ches pa skyes pa'i brtson 'grus gang yin pa'o //
translated: Excitement is the effort that arises from the generation of confidence in the attainment of a superior distinction after knowing the difference between former and later [stages].

original: phyir mi ldog pa ni khyad par du chung zad tsam mam /
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa ni khyad par du chung zad tsam mam /
translated: The irreversible are those who have the slightest distinction.

original: ngan ngon tsam zhig rtogs nas bar ma dor sgyid mi lug pa ste dge ba bsgoms pas chog mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: ngan ngon tsam zhig rtogs nas bar ma dor sgyid mi lug pa ste dge ba bsgoms pas chog mi shes pa'o //
translated: Non-retrogression means that one does not become discouraged in the middle, having understood just a little bit or just a little bit of the special qualities. That is, one is not satisfied with cultivating virtue.

original: sems yang dag par sdud pa ni brtson 'grus kyi gags su gyur pa nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa bdud kyi las rnams las blo sems yang dag par sgom pa'o //
analyzed: sems yang dag par sdud pa ni brtson 'grus kyi gags su gyur pa nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa bdud kyi las rnams las blo sems yang dag par sgom pa'o //
translated: Correct mental orientation means that one's mind is correctly oriented away from the afflictions, secondary afflictions, and the activities of Mara, which are obstacles to striving.

original: rgyun du byed pa ni sbyor ba de nyid la rgyun du byed pa gang yin ba ste brtson pa mi gtong ba'o //
analyzed: rgyun du byed pa ni sbyor ba de nyid la rgyun du byed pa gang yin ba ste brtson pa mi gtong ba'o //
translated: Continuous practice means that one practices continuously in that very striving, that is, one does not abandon one's efforts.

original: dad pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dad pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Faith is as follows:

original: des ston pas chos ston pa'i chos de thos nas dad pa rnyed pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: des ston pas chos ston pa'i chos de thos nas dad pa rnyed pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Having heard the Dharma that is taught by the Teacher, one obtains faith.

original: bag yod pa ni dad pa thob pa nges par 'byung bar 'dod pa'i gags su gyur pa'i chos dag las sems kun du srung ba gang yin pa dang rgyun du dge ba'i chos sgom par brtson pa'o //
analyzed: bag yod pa ni dad pa thob pa nges par 'byung bar 'dod pa'i gags su gyur pa'i chos dag las sems kun du srung ba gang yin pa dang rgyun du dge ba'i chos sgom par brtson pa'o //
translated: Conscientiousness means that one guards one's mind from those things that are obstacles to the attainment of liberation by one who has obtained faith, and one strives to cultivate virtuous qualities continuously.

original: sbyor ba ni lung dang / kha ton dang / yongs su 'dri ba dang / 'brel ba'i gtam rnam par nges pa la yang dag par rab tu sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba ni lung dang / kha ton dang / yongs su 'dri ba dang / 'brel ba'i gtam rnam par nges pa la yang dag par rab tu sbyor ba'o //
translated: Application is the correct application to the scriptures, to recitation, to questioning, and to the ascertainment of connected discourse.

original: sems pa ni ji skad bstan pa dang mnos pa'i chos dang don la yongs su rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: sems pa ni ji skad bstan pa dang mnos pa'i chos dang don la yongs su rtogs pa'o //
translated: Reflection is the thorough analysis of the teachings and their meanings as they have been learned.

original: dran pa ni yongs su brtags pa'i don mi brjed pa dang / yun ring mo zhig na byas pa dang bshad pa yang rjes su dran pa'o //üîΩrnam par rtog pa ni chos dang don de nyid la brten te /
analyzed: dran pa ni yongs su brtags pa'i don mi brjed pa dang / yun ring mo zhig na byas pa dang bshad pa yang rjes su dran pa'o // rnam par rtog pa ni chos dang don de nyid la brten te /
translated: Recollection is the non-forgetting of the meanings that have been investigated, and the remembrance of what was done and said a long time ago.

original: nges par 'byung ba la sogs pa rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba la sogs pa rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: Discrimination is the discrimination of the Dharma and its meanings, based on those very teachings and their meanings.

original: ye shes ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sbyor ba las byung ba'i shes rab gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sbyor ba las byung ba'i shes rab gang yin pa'o //
translated: Knowledge is the wisdom that arises from the supramundane application.

original: shes rab ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab po //
analyzed: shes rab ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab po //
translated: Wisdom is the supramundane wisdom.

original: shes rab thob pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab kyi rjes su las thob pa 'jig rten pa'i shes pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab thob pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab kyi rjes su las thob pa 'jig rten pa'i shes pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The attainment of wisdom is the mundane knowledge that is attained subsequent to the supramundane wisdom.

original: dpyod pa ni dpyod pa'i yid la byed pas spangs pa dang / ma spangs pa dang / lhag ma dang bcas pa dang / lhag ma ma lus pa la so sor rtog pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: dpyod pa ni dpyod pa'i yid la byed pas spangs pa dang / ma spangs pa dang / lhag ma dang bcas pa dang / lhag ma ma lus pa la so sor rtog pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Investigation is the discernment of what has been abandoned, what has not been abandoned, what remains to be done, and what remains to be done without remainder, by means of the mental activity of investigation.

original: tshangs par spyod pa ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang / tshangs par spyod pa ma yin pa 'khrig pa'i chos spangs pa'o //
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang / tshangs par spyod pa ma yin pa 'khrig pa'i chos spangs pa'o //
translated: Pure conduct is the noble path with its eight members, and the abandonment of impure conduct, i.e., sexual intercourse.

original: lhag ma byang chub kyi phyogs sum cu rtsa bdun ni tshangs par spyod pa kun tu 'dren par byed pa ste /üîΩde dag kyang de'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir @24a * //
analyzed: lhag ma byang chub kyi phyogs sum cu rtsa bdun ni tshangs par spyod pa kun tu 'dren par byed pa ste / de dag kyang de'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir @24a * //
translated: The remaining thirty-seven factors of enlightenment are the guides to pure conduct.

original: dang ; de'i phyogs yin pa'i phyir zhi gnas dang lhag mthong dang / lus su gtogs pa'i dran pa dang / gnas gsum dag gis ci rigs par bsdus so //
analyzed: dang ; de'i phyogs yin pa'i phyir zhi gnas dang lhag mthong dang / lus su gtogs pa'i dran pa dang / gnas gsum dag gis ci rigs par bsdus so //
translated: They are included in the three bases of serenity, insight, and mindfulness related to the body, respectively, because they have the nature of those and because they are their factors.

original: de la dad pa dang dran pa ni gnyis ka'i phyogs yin no //
analyzed: de la dad pa dang dran pa ni gnyis ka'i phyogs yin no //
translated: Among them, faith and mindfulness are on both sides.

original: de la ston pa de nyid rang gi don sgrub pa'i phyir mchog ces bya'o //
analyzed: de la ston pa de nyid rang gi don sgrub pa'i phyir mchog ces bya'o //
translated: Among them, the Teacher is called supreme because he accomplishes his own goal.

original: gzhan gyi don sgrub pa'i phyir gtso bo zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don sgrub pa'i phyir gtso bo zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called ‚Äúchief‚Äù because it accomplishes the aims of others.

original: de gnyi ga sgrub pa'i phyir khyad par du 'phags pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de gnyi ga sgrub pa'i phyir khyad par du 'phags pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called ‚Äúdistinguished‚Äù because it accomplishes both aims.

original: mu stegs can thams cad zil gyis gnon pa'i phyir bla ma zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mu stegs can thams cad zil gyis gnon pa'i phyir bla ma zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called ‚Äúsuperior‚Äù because it surpasses all the non-Buddhist paths.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas zil gyis gnon pa'i phyir bla na med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas zil gyis gnon pa'i phyir bla na med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called ‚Äúunsurpassed‚Äù because it surpasses the disciples and the hermit buddhas.

original: mu stegs can dang thun mong ma yin pa'i chos mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i phyir mi mnyam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mu stegs can dang thun mong ma yin pa'i chos mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i phyir mi mnyam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called ‚Äúunequalled‚Äù because it is fully awakened to the Dharma that is not shared by the non-Buddhists.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang thun mong ma yin pa'i chos mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i phyir mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang thun mong ma yin pa'i chos mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i phyir mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called ‚Äúequal to the unequalled‚Äù because it is fully awakened to the Dharma that is not shared by the disciples and the hermit buddhas.

original: rnam grangs gzhan yang 'jig rten pa'i dge ba'i phun sum tshogs pa thams cad dang thun mong ba'i phyir mchog go //
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan yang 'jig rten pa'i dge ba'i phun sum tshogs pa thams cad dang thun mong ba'i phyir mchog go //
translated: Another explanation is that it is ‚Äúsupreme‚Äù because it is shared with all mundane excellence.

original: nyan thos kyi dge ba phun sum tshogs pa thams cad dang thun mong ba'i phyir gtso bo'o //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi dge ba phun sum tshogs pa thams cad dang thun mong ba'i phyir gtso bo'o //
translated: It is preeminent because it is shared with all the abundant virtues of the disciples.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi dge ba phun sum tshogs pa thams cad dang thun mong ba'i phyir khyad par du 'phags pa'o //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi dge ba phun sum tshogs pa thams cad dang thun mong ba'i phyir khyad par du 'phags pa'o //
translated: It is superior because it is shared with all the abundant virtues of the individual illuminates.

original: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib rnam par dag pa'i phyir bla ma'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib rnam par dag pa'i phyir bla ma'o //
translated: It is unsurpassed because it is purified of the obscurations of the passions.

original: shes bya'i sgrib pa rnam par dag pa'i phyir bla na med pa'o //
analyzed: shes bya'i sgrib pa rnam par dag pa'i phyir bla na med pa'o //
translated: It is unequaled because it is purified of the knowable.

original: rnam grangs gzhan yang 'dod pa na spyod pa'i dge ba phun sum tshogs pa'i phyir mchog go //üîΩgzugs na spyod pa'i dge ba phun sum tshogs pa'i phyir gtso bo'o //
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan yang 'dod pa na spyod pa'i dge ba phun sum tshogs pa'i phyir mchog go // gzugs na spyod pa'i dge ba phun sum tshogs pa'i phyir gtso bo'o //
translated: Another explanation: It is supreme because it is the abundance of virtue in the realm of desire.üîΩIt is preeminent because it is the abundance of virtue in the realm of form.

original: gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i dge ba phun sum tshogs pa'i phyir khyad par du 'phags pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i dge ba phun sum tshogs pa'i phyir khyad par du 'phags pa'o //
translated: It is superior because it is the abundance of virtue in the formless realm.

original: khams gsum pa thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dge ba phun sum tshogs pa'i phyir bla ma'o //
analyzed: khams gsum pa thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dge ba phun sum tshogs pa'i phyir bla ma'o //
translated: It is unsurpassed because it is the abundance of supramundane virtue that transcends the three realms.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa'i dge ba phun sum tshogs pa'i phyir bla na med pa'o //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa'i dge ba phun sum tshogs pa'i phyir bla na med pa'o //
translated: It is unsurpassed because it is the perfect virtue that transcends all the virtues of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: sems can rkang med rnams ni 'di lta ste sbrul la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sems can rkang med rnams ni 'di lta ste sbrul la sogs pa'o //
translated: Beings without legs are, for example, snakes, etc.

original: sems can rkang gnyis rnams ni 'di lta ste mi la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sems can rkang gnyis rnams ni 'di lta ste mi la sogs pa'o //
translated: Beings with two legs are, for example, humans, etc.

original: sems can rkang bzhi rnams ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: sems can rkang bzhi rnams ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Beings with four legs are, for example,

original: glang po che la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: glang po che la sogs pa'o //
translated: elephants, etc.

original: sems can rkang mang rnams ni 'di @24b lta ste srin gyi me la sogs pa'o //üîΩsems can gzugs can rnams ni 'di lta ste 'dod pa'i khams nas bzung ste /
analyzed: sems can rkang mang rnams ni 'di @24b lta ste srin gyi me la sogs pa'o // sems can gzugs can rnams ni 'di lta ste 'dod pa'i khams nas bzung ste /
translated: Beings with many legs are, for example, centipedes, etc.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa'i bar dag go //üîΩsems can gzugs can ma yin pa rnams ni 'di lta ste /üîΩnam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched nas bzung ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa'i bar dag go // sems can gzugs can ma yin pa rnams ni 'di lta ste / nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched nas bzung ste /
translated: Beings with form are, for example, from the desire realm up to the fourth concentration.

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi bar dag go //
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi bar dag go //
translated: Beings without form are, for example, from the sphere of infinite space up to the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: sems can 'du shes can rnams ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: sems can 'du shes can rnams ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Beings with perception are, for example,

original: 'du shes med pa'i sems can ma gtogs pa 'dod pa'i khams nas bzung ste /
analyzed: 'du shes med pa'i sems can ma gtogs pa 'dod pa'i khams nas bzung ste /
translated: Except for beings devoid of discernment, all sentient beings from the desire realmüîΩ

original: ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi bar dag go //üîΩ'du shes med pa'i sems can rnams ni 'di lta ste //
analyzed: ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi bar dag go // 'du shes med pa'i sems can rnams ni 'di lta ste //
translated: Except for the beings in the state of non-perception, they are from the realm of desire up to the sphere of nothingness.

original: 'du shes med pa'i lha rnams so //üîΩ'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi sems can rnams ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'du shes med pa'i lha rnams so // 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi sems can rnams ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The beings in the state of non-perception are the gods of the state of non-perception.

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min du nye bar 'gro ba'i lha rnams so //
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min du nye bar 'gro ba'i lha rnams so //
translated: The beings in the state of neither perception nor non-perception are the gods who have gone to the summit of existence.

original: mdor bsdu na rnam pa de dag gis ni de bzhin gshegs pa yongs su g-yo ba dang / sku dang thugs kyi sgo nas mchog nyid rnam pa gsum yongs su bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: mdor bsdu na rnam pa de dag gis ni de bzhin gshegs pa yongs su g-yo ba dang / sku dang thugs kyi sgo nas mchog nyid rnam pa gsum yongs su bstan pa yin no //
translated: In brief, by these aspects, the three kinds of supremacy of the Tathagata are shown, supremacy of power, supremacy of body, and supremacy of mind.

original: shes rab rnyed pa zhes bya ba ni bye brag med par dge ba dang / don dang ldan pa'i shes rab gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab rnyed pa zhes bya ba ni bye brag med par dge ba dang / don dang ldan pa'i shes rab gang yin pa'o //
translated: The attainment of wisdom is the attainment of any wisdom, whether mundane or transcendent, that is virtuous and meaningful.

original: shes rab rgyas pa dang / 'phel ba dang / yangs pa zhes bya ba ni chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen por khyad par du 'phags pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab rgyas pa dang / 'phel ba dang / yangs pa zhes bya ba ni chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen por khyad par du 'phags pa'o //
translated: The terms ‚Äúexpanded,‚Äù ‚Äúincreased,‚Äù and ‚Äúextensive‚Äù refer to the superiority of the lesser, middling, and great stages.

original: shes rab rnam par byang ba ni sngon goms par byas pa'i shes rab dus gzhan du yongs su smin pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab rnam par byang ba ni sngon goms par byas pa'i shes rab dus gzhan du yongs su smin pa'o //
translated: The purification of wisdom is the full maturation of wisdom that has been cultivated in the past.

original: shes rab 'byor pa ni nyon mongs pa yongs su shes pa dang / spong ba'i shes rab gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab 'byor pa ni nyon mongs pa yongs su shes pa dang / spong ba'i shes rab gang yin pa'o //
translated: The development of wisdom is the wisdom that fully understands and abandons the afflictions.

original: shes rab yongs su skong ba ni de nyid mthar thug par 'gro ba'o ;
analyzed: shes rab yongs su skong ba ni de nyid mthar thug par 'gro ba'o ;
translated: The fulfillment of wisdom is the perfection of that very wisdom.

original: / shes rab yongs su mi nyams pa ni de nyid yongs su mi nyams pa'i chos can te /üîΩshin tu tshar phyin pa'o //
analyzed: / shes rab yongs su mi nyams pa ni de nyid yongs su mi nyams pa'i chos can te / shin tu tshar phyin pa'o //
translated: The non-degeneration of wisdom is the non-degeneration of that very wisdom.üîΩThe thorough completion of wisdom is the thorough completion of that very wisdom.

original: shes rab myur ba nyid ni skyen par rab tu shes pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab myur ba nyid ni skyen par rab tu shes pa'o //
translated: The swiftness of wisdom is the rapid understanding of that very wisdom.

original: shes rab mgyogs pa nyid ni shes rab yongs su mi gtugs pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab mgyogs pa nyid ni shes rab yongs su mi gtugs pa'o //
translated: The speed of wisdom is the non-interruption of that very wisdom.

original: shes rab rno ba nyid ni ji snyed pa dang ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab rno ba nyid ni ji snyed pa dang ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa'o //
translated: The sharpness of wisdom is the understanding of things as they are and as many as there are.

original: nges par 'byung ba'i shes rab nyid ni nges par 'byung par bya ba'i chos rnams dang / 'jig rten pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba yang rab tu shes pa'o //
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba'i shes rab nyid ni nges par 'byung par bya ba'i chos rnams dang / 'jig rten pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba yang rab tu shes pa'o //
translated: The wisdom of renunciation is the knowledge of the dharmas to be renounced and the knowledge of the mundane detachment.

original: nges par 'byed pa'i shes rab nyid ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba rab tu shes pa'o //üîΩshes rab @25a * //
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa'i shes rab nyid ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba rab tu shes pa'o // shes rab @25a * //
translated: The wisdom of the factors conducive to penetration is the knowledge of the supramundane detachment.

original: zab pa ni zab mo stong pa nyid dang ldan pa rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang rjes su mthun pa'i chos rab tu shes pa dang / don dang tshig zab mo yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: zab pa ni zab mo stong pa nyid dang ldan pa rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang rjes su mthun pa'i chos rab tu shes pa dang / don dang tshig zab mo yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu rtogs pa ste /
translated: The profundity of wisdom is the knowledge of the Dharma that is in accord with emptiness and dependent origination, and the correct understanding of the profound meaning and words just as they are.

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa ni de dag gdags pa la shes rab yin no //
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa ni de dag gdags pa la shes rab yin no //
translated: The TathƒÅgata has great wisdom regarding their designation.

original: nyan thos rnams kyi ni gdags pa la shes rab chen po yin te /
analyzed: nyan thos rnams kyi ni gdags pa la shes rab chen po yin te /
translated: The ≈õrƒÅvakas have great wisdom regarding designation.

original: shes rab de nyid dus nyid du yun ring po nas yongs su goms par byas pa yin no //
analyzed: shes rab de nyid dus nyid du yun ring po nas yongs su goms par byas pa yin no //
translated: That wisdom is cultivated for a long time in the present moment.

original: shes rab yang pa ni de nyid tshad med pa dang mtha' yas ba'i spyod yul lo //
analyzed: shes rab yang pa ni de nyid tshad med pa dang mtha' yas ba'i spyod yul lo //
translated: The light of wisdom is the object of immeasurable and infinite wisdom.

original: shes rab mnyam pa med pa ni gzhan dag dang mi mtshungs pa'i shes rab po //
analyzed: shes rab mnyam pa med pa ni gzhan dag dang mi mtshungs pa'i shes rab po //
translated: The incomparable wisdom is the wisdom that is not common to others.

original: shes rab rin po che ni shes rab dbang po thams cad kyi gtso bo yin pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab rin po che ni shes rab dbang po thams cad kyi gtso bo yin pa ste /
translated: The jewel of wisdom is the chief of all the faculties of wisdom,

original: 'khor los sgyur ba'i nor bu rnams kyi nang na bee d'u rya ltar 'od kyis snang bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba'i nor bu rnams kyi nang na bee d'u rya ltar 'od kyis snang bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: like the beryl among the jewels of a universal monarch, because it illuminates with its radiance.

original: de dang ldan pa ni shes rab rin po che dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa ni shes rab rin po che dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Endowed with that is endowed with the jewel of wisdom.

original: shes rab mig ni lhan cig skyes pa'i shes rab po //
analyzed: shes rab mig ni lhan cig skyes pa'i shes rab po //
translated: The eye of wisdom is the innate wisdom.

original: shes rab snang ba ni gzhan las bsgrubs shing gzhan gyis skyed pa sbyor ba las byung ba'i shes rab gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab snang ba ni gzhan las bsgrubs shing gzhan gyis skyed pa sbyor ba las byung ba'i shes rab gang yin pa'o //
translated: The light of wisdom is the wisdom that is accomplished from others, that is produced by others, which is the wisdom that arises from practice.

original: shes rab 'od ni shes rab de nyid sbyor ba las byung ba ste /
analyzed: shes rab 'od ni shes rab de nyid sbyor ba las byung ba ste /
translated: The radiance of wisdom is that very wisdom that arises from practice,

original: thos pa dang bsams pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: thos pa dang bsams pa las byung ba'o //
translated: which is the wisdom that arises from hearing and reflection.

original: shes rab gsal ba ni shes rab de nyid bsgoms pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: shes rab gsal ba ni shes rab de nyid bsgoms pa las byung ba'o //
translated: The light of wisdom is that which arises from the cultivation of that wisdom.

original: shes rab mar me ni de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i mdo sde zab mo rnams rnam par 'jog pa gang yin pa ste rab tu gsal bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab mar me ni de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i mdo sde zab mo rnams rnam par 'jog pa gang yin pa ste rab tu gsal bar byed pa'o //
translated: The lamp of wisdom is that which is established in the profound sutras taught by the Tathagata, which is the illumination.

original: shes rab skar mda' ni chos ston pa'i dus tsam gyi rjes su 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab skar mda' ni chos ston pa'i dus tsam gyi rjes su 'jug pa'o //
translated: The star of wisdom is that which follows the occasion of teaching the Dharma.

original: shes rab sgron ma ni de dang de dag tu shes rab kyis chos rnams la shin tu legs par brtags shing dus phyis kyang rjes su 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab sgron ma ni de dang de dag tu shes rab kyis chos rnams la shin tu legs par brtags shing dus phyis kyang rjes su 'jug pa ste /
translated: The lamp of wisdom is that which, having well examined the dharmas with wisdom in this and that, later follows.

original: lus kyis mngon du byas pas ni ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: lus kyis mngon du byas pas ni ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is not that which is manifested by the body.

original: shes rab mun pa med pa ni lus kyis mngon du byas pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab mun pa med pa ni lus kyis mngon du byas pa'o //
translated: The non-darkness of wisdom is that which is manifested by the body.

original: shes rab dbang po ni gzhan dag gi rtogs pa'i dbang du byas nas shes rab gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab dbang po ni gzhan dag gi rtogs pa'i dbang du byas nas shes rab gang yin pa'o //
translated: The faculty of wisdom is that wisdom which is taken up by others.

original: shes rab stobs ni bdag nyid kyi snga phyi'i khyad par rtogs pa legs par rtogs pa'i dbang du byas te rigs pa dang chos la brdzi ba med pa'i shes rab bo //
analyzed: shes rab stobs ni bdag nyid kyi snga phyi'i khyad par rtogs pa legs par rtogs pa'i dbang du byas te rigs pa dang chos la brdzi ba med pa'i shes rab bo //
translated: The power of wisdom is the wisdom that is not crushed by reasoning or by phenomena, and that is based on the full understanding of the differences between one's former and present states.

original: shes rab nor ni dbang phyug thams kyi na ngan dbang phyug gi mchog rab skyed pa dang / rang gi smes la dbang sgyur ba thob par byed pa dang nor thams cad kyi gtso bo dang / @25b 'jig rten pa'i nor thams cad kyi rtsa ba'i rgyu gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab nor ni dbang phyug thams kyi na ngan dbang phyug gi mchog rab skyed pa dang / rang gi smes la dbang sgyur ba thob par byed pa dang nor thams cad kyi gtso bo dang / @25b 'jig rten pa'i nor thams cad kyi rtsa ba'i rgyu gang yin pa'o //
translated: The wealth of wisdom is the best of all kinds of wealth, the supreme sovereignty, which is the cause of attaining control over one's own mind and the chief of all kinds of wealth, the root cause of all worldly wealth.

original: shes rab rin po che ni ji skad du bshad pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab rin po che ni ji skad du bshad pa'o //
translated: The jewel of wisdom is as has been explained.

original: shes rab ral gri dang shes rab mtshon cha ni kun tu sbyor ba thams cad gcod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab ral gri dang shes rab mtshon cha ni kun tu sbyor ba thams cad gcod par byed pa'o //
translated: The sword of wisdom and the weapon of wisdom are what cut all the fetters.

original: shes rab mtshon cha ni nyon mongs pa dang / lha'i bu'i bdud ring du spong ba'o //
analyzed: shes rab mtshon cha ni nyon mongs pa dang / lha'i bu'i bdud ring du spong ba'o //
translated: The weapon of wisdom is what keeps the defilements and the demon of the sons of the gods at a distance.

original: shes rab 'debs pa ni yid kyi dbang po'i rta dge ba spyod par 'debs pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab 'debs pa ni yid kyi dbang po'i rta dge ba spyod par 'debs pa'o //
translated: The reins of wisdom are what hold the horse of the mental faculty to virtuous actions.

original: shes rab ltung bar byed pa ni lus thams cad dang bral ba dang / rnam par 'jig par byed pa'o //üîΩshes rab rab ni nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi sgo du ma 'gog par zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab ltung bar byed pa ni lus thams cad dang bral ba dang / rnam par 'jig par byed pa'o // shes rab rab ni nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi sgo du ma 'gog par zhugs pa'o //
translated: The moat of wisdom is the separation from the whole body and the destruction of the body.

original: shes rab them skas ni sbyor ba las byung ba'i lam mo //
analyzed: shes rab them skas ni sbyor ba las byung ba'i lam mo //
translated: The ladder of wisdom is the entry into the cessation of the many doors of all the defilements.

original: shes rab khang bzangs ni mthar phyin par song ba'o //
analyzed: shes rab khang bzangs ni mthar phyin par song ba'o //
translated: The palace of wisdom is the arrival at the end.

original: yang ra ba la sogs pa de dag nyid gtan la dbab pa'i phyir 'di gsum brjod par bya ste /üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: yang ra ba la sogs pa de dag nyid gtan la dbab pa'i phyir 'di gsum brjod par bya ste / 'di lta ste /
translated: In order to establish the fortress, etc., these three are mentioned:üîΩthe knowledge of the elements,

original: khams shes pa dang / khams sna tshogs shes pa dang / khams du ma shes pa'o //
analyzed: khams shes pa dang / khams sna tshogs shes pa dang / khams du ma shes pa'o //
translated: the knowledge of the variety of elements, and the knowledge of the multiplicity of elements.

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba ni de kho na nyid rab tu rtogs pa la slob pa'i shes rab gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba ni de kho na nyid rab tu rtogs pa la slob pa'i shes rab gang yin pa'o //
translated: Right view is the wisdom which is trained in the comprehension of reality.

original: tshul bzhin yid la byed pa ni de skyed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: tshul bzhin yid la byed pa ni de skyed par byed pa'o //
translated: Correct reflection is its cause.

original: sems rnam par grol ba dang / shes rab rnam par grol ba ni gong ma ste /
analyzed: sems rnam par grol ba dang / shes rab rnam par grol ba ni gong ma ste /
translated: The liberation of mind and the liberation by wisdom are the results.

original: slob pa rnams kyi ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bus bsdus pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bus bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: slob pa rnams kyi ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bus bsdus pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bus bsdus pa'o //
translated: For those in training, it is included in the fruit of stream-entry, the fruit of oncereturning, and the fruit of non-returning.

original: mi slob pa rnams kyi ni dgra bcom pa nyid kyi 'bras bus bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: mi slob pa rnams kyi ni dgra bcom pa nyid kyi 'bras bus bsdus pa'o //
translated: For those beyond training, it is included in the fruit of arhatship.

original: rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi ni rang sangs rgyas kyis bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi ni rang sangs rgyas kyis bsdus pa'o //
translated: For the pratyekabuddhas, it is included in the pratyekabuddha-enlightenment.

original: sangs rgyas rnams ni byang chub dam pas bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams ni byang chub dam pas bsdus pa'o //
translated: For the Buddhas, it is included in supreme enlightenment.

original: de la ji ltar na khams shes bar bya ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na khams shes bar bya ba yin zhe na /
translated: How should the elements be known?

original: smras pa / khams du ma dang / khams sna tshogs shes par bya ste /
analyzed: smras pa / khams du ma dang / khams sna tshogs shes par bya ste /
translated: It is said: The elements should be known as manifold and various.

original: khams bco brgyad ces bya ba ni khams du ma shes pa'o //
analyzed: khams bco brgyad ces bya ba ni khams du ma shes pa'o //
translated: The eighteen elements are to be known as manifold.

original: de dag gi rnam pa tshogs shes pa ni khams sna tshogs shes pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gi rnam pa tshogs shes pa ni khams sna tshogs shes pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of their various aspects is the knowledge of the various elements.

original: yang de dag gi rab tu dbye ba ni khams dang / 'gro ba dang sa dang gang zag dang rnam pa'i dbye ba shes pa'o //
analyzed: yang de dag gi rab tu dbye ba ni khams dang / 'gro ba dang sa dang gang zag dang rnam pa'i dbye ba shes pa'o //
translated: Moreover, their classification should be known as the classification of elements, destinies, stages, persons, and aspects.

original: zhib mo ni de kho na dang zab mo'i don la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: zhib mo ni de kho na dang zab mo'i don la 'jug pa'o //
translated: Subtlety is the engagement with the meaning of thatness and the profound.

original: brtag pa ni don mtha' dag la 'jug pa'o //üîΩmkhas pa ni skyed pa'i shes rab dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: brtag pa ni don mtha' dag la 'jug pa'o // mkhas pa ni skyed pa'i shes rab dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Investigation is the engagement with all objects.üîΩSkill is the possession of the wisdom that is produced.

original: mdzangs pa ni lhan cig skyes pa'i shes rab dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: mdzangs pa ni lhan cig skyes pa'i shes rab dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Cleverness is the possession of the wisdom that is innate.

original: yang na bzlog @26a * //
analyzed: yang na bzlog @26a * //
translated: Alternatively, the latter is the opposite of the former.

original: pa'o ; / mig ni mngon sum gyi dngos po 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: pa'o ; / mig ni mngon sum gyi dngos po 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The eye is the apprehension of the thing that is directly perceived.

original: shes pa ni lkog tu gyur pa'i rigs 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa ni lkog tu gyur pa'i rigs 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Knowledge is the apprehension of the type that is not directly perceived.

original: rigs pa ni dngos po ji snyed yod pa la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: rigs pa ni dngos po ji snyed yod pa la 'jug pa'o //
translated: Reason is the engagement with all the things that exist.

original: blo ni ji lta ba bzhin du rjes su rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: blo ni ji lta ba bzhin du rjes su rtogs pa'o //
translated: Intelligence is the realization of things as they are.

original: don spyod pa ni bsams pa las byung ba'i dge bas yang dag par bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: don spyod pa ni bsams pa las byung ba'i dge bas yang dag par bsdus pa'o //
translated: The practice of the meaning is the correct collection of virtue that arises from reflection.

original: chos spyod pa ni thos pa las byung ba'i dge bas yang dag par bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: chos spyod pa ni thos pa las byung ba'i dge bas yang dag par bsdus pa'o //
translated: The practice of the Dharma is the correct collection of virtue that arises from listening.

original: dge ba spyod pa ni sbyin pa dang tshul khrims las byung ba'i dge bas yang dag par bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba spyod pa ni sbyin pa dang tshul khrims las byung ba'i dge bas yang dag par bsdus pa'o //
translated: The practice of virtue is the correct collection of virtue that arises from generosity and moral discipline.

original: dge legs spyod pa ni bsgoms pa las byung ba'i dge bas yang dag par bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: dge legs spyod pa ni bsgoms pa las byung ba'i dge bas yang dag par bsdus pa'o //
translated: The practice of virtue is the collection of virtue that arises from meditation.

original: legs par gsungs pa ni tshig dang yi ge phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: legs par gsungs pa ni tshig dang yi ge phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: Well-spoken is the perfection of words and syllables.

original: legs par bstan pa ni don dang shin tu mngon par 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: legs par bstan pa ni don dang shin tu mngon par 'brel pa'o //
translated: Well-taught is the connection with the meaning.

original: nges par 'byung ba ni 'jig rten pa'i lam gyi sdug bsngal spong bas nges par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba ni 'jig rten pa'i lam gyi sdug bsngal spong bas nges par 'byung ba'o //
translated: Liberation is the liberation from the suffering of the mundane path.

original: rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'gro bar byed pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyi sdug bsngal las yang dag par 'da' bar bya ba'i phyir de kho na mngon par byang chub pa'o //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'gro bar byed pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyi sdug bsngal las yang dag par 'da' bar bya ba'i phyir de kho na mngon par byang chub pa'o //
translated: The cause of going to perfect enlightenment is the manifestation of reality in order to transcend the suffering of the supramundane path.

original: mi mthun pa med pa ni ston pa dang nyan thos rnams kyis bshad pa don dang don du tshig dang tshig tu phan tshun mthun pa ste gcig la gcig mi 'gal ba'o //
analyzed: mi mthun pa med pa ni ston pa dang nyan thos rnams kyis bshad pa don dang don du tshig dang tshig tu phan tshun mthun pa ste gcig la gcig mi 'gal ba'o //
translated: Non-contradiction is the mutual agreement of the teacher and the listeners, the meaning with the meaning, and the words with the words, without contradiction.

original: 'dul ba dang ldan pa ni mu stegs can dang bdud dang 'jig rten pa thams cad kyis rnam par mi bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: 'dul ba dang ldan pa ni mu stegs can dang bdud dang 'jig rten pa thams cad kyis rnam par mi bskyod pa'o //
translated: The discipline is unshakable by any non-Buddhist or by Mara or by the world.

original: rten pa yod pa ni ston pa bzhi chud mi gson pa'o //
analyzed: rten pa yod pa ni ston pa bzhi chud mi gson pa'o //
translated: The support is the fourfold teaching which is not lost.

original: 'di ston pa de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya ba ni lung rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ston pa de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya ba ni lung rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: The teacher is the Tathagata, the Arhat, the Fully Enlightened One. This is the purity of the scriptural text.

original: de la mdor bsdu na tshig 'di dag gis ni bcom ldan 'das kyis legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba ni legs par bstan pa zhes bya ba phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa bzhir bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: de la mdor bsdu na tshig 'di dag gis ni bcom ldan 'das kyis legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba ni legs par bstan pa zhes bya ba phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa bzhir bstan pa yin te /
translated: In brief, these words show the four perfections of the well-taught Dharma and Vinaya of the Lord: well-taught, well-expounded, well-proclaimed, and directly visible.

original: tshig gnyis kyis ni yi ge dang don phun sum tshogs par bstan to //
analyzed: tshig gnyis kyis ni yi ge dang don phun sum tshogs par bstan to //
translated: Two of the words show the perfection of the letter and the meaning.

original: gnyis kyis ni 'bras bu phun sum tshogs par bstan to //
analyzed: gnyis kyis ni 'bras bu phun sum tshogs par bstan to //
translated: Two show the perfection of the result.

original: gsum gyis ni sgrub pa phun sum tshogs par bstan to //
analyzed: gsum gyis ni sgrub pa phun sum tshogs par bstan to //
translated: Three show the perfection of practice.

original: gcig gis ni ston pa phun sum tshogs par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gcig gis ni ston pa phun sum tshogs par bstan pa yin no //
translated: One shows the perfection of the teacher.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis chos bstan pa ni gleng gzhi yod pa zhes bya ba ni kun nas slong ba dang bcas par bslab pa'i gzhi bcas @26b pa'o ;
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis chos bstan pa ni gleng gzhi yod pa zhes bya ba ni kun nas slong ba dang bcas par bslab pa'i gzhi bcas @26b pa'o ;
translated: The Bhagavat's teaching of the Dharma is said to have a basis because the bases of training were laid down with a motivation.

original: / nges par 'byung ba yod pa ni rnam par 'das na chos bzhin du phyir bya ba'i phyir bcas pa'o //
analyzed: / nges par 'byung ba yod pa ni rnam par 'das na chos bzhin du phyir bya ba'i phyir bcas pa'o //
translated: It has a definite release because they were laid down for the purpose of later reversing them in accordance with the Dharma.

original: ston pa yod pa ni ston pa bzhis 'chal ba'i tshul khrims thams cad las yang dag par 'da' bar bya ba'i phyir bcas pa'o //
analyzed: ston pa yod pa ni ston pa bzhis 'chal ba'i tshul khrims thams cad las yang dag par 'da' bar bya ba'i phyir bcas pa'o //
translated: It has a teacher because they were laid down for the purpose of completely transcending all immorality through the four teachers.

original: rtsol ba yod pa ni 'dod pa'i bsod nams dang / lus dub pa'i mtha' spong ste skyes bu'i rtsal gyis 'grub pa dang mthun par bya ba'i phyir bcas pa'o //
analyzed: rtsol ba yod pa ni 'dod pa'i bsod nams dang / lus dub pa'i mtha' spong ste skyes bu'i rtsal gyis 'grub pa dang mthun par bya ba'i phyir bcas pa'o //
translated: It has effort because they were laid down for the purpose of abandoning the extremes of desire and merit and physical exhaustion, in accordance with the power of a person.

original: chos 'phrul yod pa ni chos 'phrul gsum gyis mngon par shes pa myur bar bya ba'i phyir gdams ngag gong na med pa bcas pa'o //
analyzed: chos 'phrul yod pa ni chos 'phrul gsum gyis mngon par shes pa myur bar bya ba'i phyir gdams ngag gong na med pa bcas pa'o //
translated: It has a miracle of Dharma because they were laid down for the purpose of quickly attaining higher knowledge through the three miracles of Dharma.

original: lhug par gtong pa ni sbyin pa dang 'bras bur ma 'brel ba ste /
analyzed: lhug par gtong pa ni sbyin pa dang 'bras bur ma 'brel ba ste /
translated: It is relaxed because it is not connected with generosity and its result.

original: mya ngan las 'das par yongs su bsdos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das par yongs su bsdos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is directed toward nirvana.

original: lag brkyang ba ni gus pa dang rgya cher rab tu sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: lag brkyang ba ni gus pa dang rgya cher rab tu sbyin pa'o //
translated: Openhandedness is giving respectfully and on a vast scale.

original: rnam par gtong ba la dga' ba ni sbyin pa'i sngon rol dang / sbyin pa'i tshe dang / byin zin nas yi rangs pa dang / dang ba dang / 'gyod pa med pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par gtong ba la dga' ba ni sbyin pa'i sngon rol dang / sbyin pa'i tshe dang / byin zin nas yi rangs pa dang / dang ba dang / 'gyod pa med pa'o //
translated: Delight in giving is joy in giving before, during, and after giving, with a clear mind and without regret.

original: sbyin pa mi 'chad par byed pa ni gcig tu chos dang bab col ma yin pas longs spyod bsgrubs te dus su yang dang yang du sbyin par bya ba'i dngos po yongs su gtong ba'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa mi 'chad par byed pa ni gcig tu chos dang bab col ma yin pas longs spyod bsgrubs te dus su yang dang yang du sbyin par bya ba'i dngos po yongs su gtong ba'o //
translated: Uninterrupted giving is giving again and again at the appropriate time, having accumulated wealth by means that are in accordance with the Dharma and not heedless.

original: gtong ba phun sum tshogs pa ni sbyin gnas dag la dbul ba'o //
analyzed: gtong ba phun sum tshogs pa ni sbyin gnas dag la dbul ba'o //
translated: Excellent giving is giving to worthy recipients.

original: sbyin pa la 'ged par dga' ba ni dus dus su pha dang ma dang bu dang bran la sogs pa la kun 'ged pa'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa la 'ged par dga' ba ni dus dus su pha dang ma dang bu dang bran la sogs pa la kun 'ged pa'o //
translated: Delight in sharing is sharing with one‚Äôs father, mother, children, servants, and so on, at the appropriate time.

original: yang de dag thams cad mdor bsdu na sbyin pa rnam pa drug yin te /
analyzed: yang de dag thams cad mdor bsdu na sbyin pa rnam pa drug yin te /
translated: Moreover, all of these are included in six types of giving:

original: mi rten pa'i sbyin pa dang / rgya chen po'i sbyin pa dang / dga' ba'i sbyin pa dang / yang dang yang du sbyin pa dang / snod du gyur pa la sbyin pa dang / yongs su sbyin pa dang / 'khor la sbyin pa ste /
analyzed: mi rten pa'i sbyin pa dang / rgya chen po'i sbyin pa dang / dga' ba'i sbyin pa dang / yang dang yang du sbyin pa dang / snod du gyur pa la sbyin pa dang / yongs su sbyin pa dang / 'khor la sbyin pa ste /
translated: generosity that is independent, generosity that is vast, generosity that is joyful, generosity that is repeated, generosity that is timely, generosity that is given with one's own hand, and generosity that is free from discrimination.

original: ji ltar sbyin pa dang / gang la sbyin pa'i dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar sbyin pa dang / gang la sbyin pa'i dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: The verse shows the generosity that is independent and so on, in order to demonstrate the generosity that is the basis of the distinctions of generosity, and the generosity that is the result of the distinctions of generosity.

original: tshul khrims rab tu rgyas pa'i bar gyi sdom ni /
analyzed: tshul khrims rab tu rgyas pa'i bar gyi sdom ni /
translated: The summary for the extensive explanation of morality is:

original: tshul khrims dang chos dang srog gcod pa dang / tshul khrims dang ldan pa zhes bya ba rgyas par ro //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang chos dang srog gcod pa dang / tshul khrims dang ldan pa zhes bya ba rgyas par ro //
translated: morality, Dharma, killing, and the moral person.

original: de tshul khrims ni 'chal ba'i tshul khrims kyi kha na ma tho bas kun du gdungs pa nye bar zhi bar byed pa dang / ngang tshul du bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de tshul khrims ni 'chal ba'i tshul khrims kyi kha na ma tho bas kun du gdungs pa nye bar zhi bar byed pa dang / ngang tshul du bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of morality is the pacification of the burning of the immorality of the hells and so on, and the attainment of the state of a god or human.

original: sdom pa ni spong ba'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: sdom pa ni spong ba'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The meaning of vow is the nature of abandoning.

original: phun sum tshogs pa ni 'gyod pa med pa yongs su 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: phun sum tshogs pa ni 'gyod pa med pa yongs su 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The meaning of perfection is the attainment of non-remorse.

original: kun tu spyod pa yongs su dag pa ni ting nge 'dzin yongs su 'dzin pa'o //üîΩdge ba ni 'bras bu yid @27a * //
analyzed: kun tu spyod pa yongs su dag pa ni ting nge 'dzin yongs su 'dzin pa'o // dge ba ni 'bras bu yid @27a * //
translated: Pure conduct is the embracing of meditative concentration.

original: ngu 'ong ba yongs su 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: ngu 'ong ba yongs su 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Virtuous is the embracing of desirable results.

original: kha na ma tho ba med pa ni bdag dang gzhan la phan pa yongs su 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba med pa ni bdag dang gzhan la phan pa yongs su 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Blameless is the embracing of benefit for oneself and others.

original: gnod pa med pa ni mtshon cha len pa dang / dbyug pa len pa dang / 'thab mo dang / mtshang 'bru ba la sogs pa dang mi mthun par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: gnod pa med pa ni mtshon cha len pa dang / dbyug pa len pa dang / 'thab mo dang / mtshang 'bru ba la sogs pa dang mi mthun par gnas pa'o //
translated: Harmless is the embracing of non-opposition to the taking up of weapons, clubs, quarrels, and disputes.

original: rjes su mthun pa ni dge sbyong gi 'bras bu dang yon tan khyad par can 'thob pa'i rjes su mthun pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su mthun pa ni dge sbyong gi 'bras bu dang yon tan khyad par can 'thob pa'i rjes su mthun pa'o //
translated: Agreeable is the embracing of the attainment of the fruits and special qualities of asceticism.

original: rjes su 'phrod pa ni dge ba mi spyoms pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su 'phrod pa ni dge ba mi spyoms pa'o //
translated: Conducive is the embracing of the non-exaltation of virtue.

original: thabs ni sdig pa 'chags pa'o //
analyzed: thabs ni sdig pa 'chags pa'o //
translated: Skillful is the embracing of the confession of sins.

original: 'tsham pa ni 'dod pa chung ba la sogs pa dge sbyong gi rgyan yongs su 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: 'tsham pa ni 'dod pa chung ba la sogs pa dge sbyong gi rgyan yongs su 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Appropriate is the embracing of the ornaments of asceticism, such as fewness of wishes.

original: mthun pa ni lta ba dang kun tu spyod pa dang 'tsho ba phun sum tshogs pa yongs su 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: mthun pa ni lta ba dang kun tu spyod pa dang 'tsho ba phun sum tshogs pa yongs su 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Agreement is the possession of perfect view, conduct, and livelihood.

original: gdung ba med pa ni lus ngal ba'i mtha' spong ba'o //üîΩnye bar gdung ba med pa ni 'dod pa'i bsod nams lhur len pa'i mtha' spong ba'o //
analyzed: gdung ba med pa ni lus ngal ba'i mtha' spong ba'o // nye bar gdung ba med pa ni 'dod pa'i bsod nams lhur len pa'i mtha' spong ba'o //
translated: Absence of distress is the avoidance of the extreme of physical fatigue.üîΩAbsence of affliction is the avoidance of the extreme of indulgence in the pleasures of desire.

original: 'gyod pa med pa ni nyon mongs pa can la mngon par mi dga' nas sred par gyur pa spong ba'o //
analyzed: 'gyod pa med pa ni nyon mongs pa can la mngon par mi dga' nas sred par gyur pa spong ba'o //
translated: Absence of regret is the avoidance of the extreme of indulgence in self-mortification.

original: chos ni rigs par gtogs pa ste legs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos ni rigs par gtogs pa ste legs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The Dharma is that which is included in the scriptures, because it is well-spoken.

original: gdul ba ni nyon mongs pa 'dul ba dang mthun pa'o //
analyzed: gdul ba ni nyon mongs pa 'dul ba dang mthun pa'o //
translated: Discipline is that which is suitable for subduing the afflictions.

original: 'phags pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos las ring du zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos las ring du zhugs pa'o //
translated: The noble ones are those who have gone far from the dharmas of affliction.

original: dge ba ni kha na ma tho ba med pa dang 'dod pa'i 'bras bu skyed pa'o ;
analyzed: dge ba ni kha na ma tho ba med pa dang 'dod pa'i 'bras bu skyed pa'o ;
translated: The wholesome is that which is free from reproach and produces desired results.

original: / bsten par bya ba ni nges par bsten par bya bar 'os pa'o //
analyzed: / bsten par bya ba ni nges par bsten par bya bar 'os pa'o //
translated: That which is to be relied upon is that which is suitable to be relied upon with certainty.

original: legs pa ni mkhas pa rnams kyis rab tu bsngags pa'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: legs pa ni mkhas pa rnams kyis rab tu bsngags pa'i dngos po'o //
translated: The good is that which is praised by the wise.

original: srog gcod pa ni 'di na la zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: srog gcod pa ni 'di na la zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Killing is called ‚Äúthis‚Äù here.

original: rgyas par ni dkar po'i phyogs dang nag po'i phyogs dang bcas par 'di lta ste rtog pa dang bcas pa dang dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i sa las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyas par ni dkar po'i phyogs dang nag po'i phyogs dang bcas par 'di lta ste rtog pa dang bcas pa dang dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i sa las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The rest should be understood in detail as they occur in the stage of the first absorption, which has both light and darkness.

original: tshul khrims dang ldan par gnas pa dang so sor thar pas bsdams bzhes bya brgyas par 'byung ba dang / dbang po dag gi sgo bsdams te gnas pa dang dran pa kun tu bsrungs pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba dang / zas kyi tshod rig pa so sor brtags shing zas za bar byed kyi rgod pa'i phyir ma yin pa dang /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang ldan par gnas pa dang so sor thar pas bsdams bzhes bya brgyas par 'byung ba dang / dbang po dag gi sgo bsdams te gnas pa dang dran pa kun tu bsrungs pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba dang / zas kyi tshod rig pa so sor brtags shing zas za bar byed kyi rgod pa'i phyir ma yin pa dang /
translated: The passage on ‚Äúabiding with ethical discipline, restrained by the vows of individual liberation‚Äù occurs in detail, and the passage on ‚Äúguarding the doors of the senses and protecting mindfulness‚Äù occurs in detail, and the passage on ‚Äúeating in moderation and examining food before eating it, not for the sake of vanity,

original: rgyags pa'i phyir ma yin pa zhes bya brgyas par 'byung ba dang / 'gro ba dang ldog pa ni shes bzhin du gnas pa yin no zhes bya brgyas par 'byung ba de dag thams cad rgyas ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rgyags pa'i phyir ma yin pa zhes bya brgyas par 'byung ba dang / 'gro ba dang ldog pa ni shes bzhin du gnas pa yin no zhes bya brgyas par 'byung ba de dag thams cad rgyas ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: and ‚Äúnot for the sake of pride‚Äù and so on, and ‚Äúgoing and returning are done with full awareness‚Äù and so on.

original: nyan thos kyi @27b sa las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi @27b sa las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: All of these should be understood as they are explained in the Sravaka Levels.

original: lam rab tu rgyas pa'i bar gyi sdom ni //
analyzed: lam rab tu rgyas pa'i bar gyi sdom ni //
translated: The synopsis for the extensive explanation of the path is:

original: dran dang spong dang rdzu 'phrul dang // dbang po rnams dang stobs rnams dang // byang chub yan lag lam yan lag / tshad med pa ni tha ma yin //
analyzed: dran dang spong dang rdzu 'phrul dang // dbang po rnams dang stobs rnams dang // byang chub yan lag lam yan lag / tshad med pa ni tha ma yin //
translated: The mindfulnesses, the correct exertions, the bases of miracle powers, the faculties, the powers, the branches of enlightenment, and the path‚Äôs branches,

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi bsgom par bya ba'i phyir 'dun pa drag po chen po zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi bsgom par bya ba'i phyir 'dun pa drag po chen po zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The ‚Äúgreat, intense yearning‚Äù is for the purpose of meditating on the four establishments of mindfulness.

original: yid la mi byed pa'i nyes pa spong ba'o //
analyzed: yid la mi byed pa'i nyes pa spong ba'o //
translated: This eliminates the fault of not applying the mind.

original: brtson 'grus ni rtsol ba lhod par gyur pa'i nyes pa spong ba'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus ni rtsol ba lhod par gyur pa'i nyes pa spong ba'o //
translated: Exertion eliminates the fault of lax effort.

original: rtsol ba ni rgod pa dang bying ba'i nyon mongs pa'i skyon spong ba'o //
analyzed: rtsol ba ni rgod pa dang bying ba'i nyon mongs pa'i skyon spong ba'o //
translated: Exertion is the elimination of the faults of the defilements of agitation and depression.

original: spro ba ni bdag nyid la brnyas par mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: spro ba ni bdag nyid la brnyas par mi byed pa'o //
translated: Interest is the lack of contempt for oneself.

original: bzod spro ni brnyas pa la bzod pa'o ;
analyzed: bzod spro ni brnyas pa la bzod pa'o ;
translated: Patience and interest is the patience with contempt.

original: / phyir mi ldog pa ni chung zad dang ngan ngon tsam gyis chog par mi 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: / phyir mi ldog pa ni chung zad dang ngan ngon tsam gyis chog par mi 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Non-retrogression is the lack of satisfaction with a small amount or with a little.

original: dran pa ni gdams ngag mi brjed pa'o //üîΩshes bzhin ni ltung ba mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: dran pa ni gdams ngag mi brjed pa'o // shes bzhin ni ltung ba mi byed pa'o //
translated: Recollection is the non-forgetting of the instructions.üîΩAwareness is the non-transgression of the precepts.

original: bag yod pa ni brtson pa mi gtong ba'o //
analyzed: bag yod pa ni brtson pa mi gtong ba'o //
translated: Conscientiousness is the non-abandonment of striving.

original: brtun pa dang ldan par gnas pa ni le lo'i gnyen po bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: brtun pa dang ldan par gnas pa ni le lo'i gnyen po bsgom pa'o //
translated: Dwelling in a state of effort is the cultivation of the antidote to laziness.

original: shes bzhin dang ldan pa ni ltung ba'i gnyen po bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: shes bzhin dang ldan pa ni ltung ba'i gnyen po bsgom pa'o //
translated: Possessing awareness is the cultivation of the antidote to downfalls.

original: dran pa dang ldan pa ni bsgom pa brjed ngas pa'i gnyen po bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: dran pa dang ldan pa ni bsgom pa brjed ngas pa'i gnyen po bsgom pa'o //
translated: Possessing recollection is the cultivation of the antidote to the forgetting of meditation.

original: 'jig rten la brnab sems dang yid mi bde ba rnam par spong bzhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i chos rjes su chags pa dang khong khro ba'i gnyen po bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten la brnab sems dang yid mi bde ba rnam par spong bzhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i chos rjes su chags pa dang khong khro ba'i gnyen po bsgom pa'o //
translated: The phrase he abandons covetousness and unhappiness with regard to the world refers to the cultivation of the counteragent to the passion and aversion of the world.

original: de bas na 'di ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa la brtson pa'i dge slong gis gnyen po rnam pa bzhi bsgom par bya'o zhes yongs su bstan pa yin no //üîΩyang dag par spong ba dag dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dag gi rnam grangs gang yin pa de dag rgyas par ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de bas na 'di ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa la brtson pa'i dge slong gis gnyen po rnam pa bzhi bsgom par bya'o zhes yongs su bstan pa yin no // yang dag par spong ba dag dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dag gi rnam grangs gang yin pa de dag rgyas par ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Therefore, this passage indicates that a monk who is striving to cultivate the applications of mindfulness should cultivate the four forms of the counteragent.

original: nyan thos kyi sa las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //üîΩde bzhin gshegs pa la dad pa zhen pa yin zhes bya ba ni rgyas par 'di lta ste /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi sa las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o // de bzhin gshegs pa la dad pa zhen pa yin zhes bya ba ni rgyas par 'di lta ste /
translated: The extensive explanation of the synonyms for the correct exertions and the bases of supernatural power should be understood as they are presented in the Sravaka Levels.

original: rnam par gtan la dbab pa bsdu ba las 'byung ba bzhin no //üîΩmthu dang ldan par gnas /
analyzed: rnam par gtan la dbab pa bsdu ba las 'byung ba bzhin no // mthu dang ldan par gnas /
translated: The phrase faith in the Tathagata is adherence is explained extensively in the Compendium of Ascertainments as follows:üîΩHe abides with power.

original: brtson 'grus dang ldan /
analyzed: brtson 'grus dang ldan /
translated: He is endowed with effort.

original: spro ba dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni rgyas par 'di lta ste /
analyzed: spro ba dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni rgyas par 'di lta ste /
translated: Those who are devoted are as follows.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The phrase endowed with delight should be understood in detail as it appears in the Bodhisattvabhumi.

original: chos rnam par 'byed do //üîΩrab tu rnam par 'byed do //
analyzed: chos rnam par 'byed do // rab tu rnam par 'byed do //
translated: He discriminates phenomena,üîΩhe fully discriminates them,üîΩhe fully investigates them,

original: yongs su rnam par rtog par byed do //
analyzed: yongs su rnam par rtog par byed do //
translated: he fully analyzes them.

original: yongs su dpyod par byed do zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste nyan thos kyi sa las 'byung ba bzhin no //üîΩzag pa med pa'i yid la byed @28a * //
analyzed: yongs su dpyod par byed do zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste nyan thos kyi sa las 'byung ba bzhin no // zag pa med pa'i yid la byed @28a * //
translated: This is as it appears in the Sravakabhumi.

original: pa thob pa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: pa thob pa nas bzung ste /
translated: From the time he obtains the uncontaminated mental attentions,

original: bden pa la dmigs pa zag pa med pa'i yid la byed pa dang ldan pa thams cad ni chos rnam par 'byed pa zhes bya'o //üîΩde la rnam par 'byed pa ni sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa'o zhes sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa thams cad 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: bden pa la dmigs pa zag pa med pa'i yid la byed pa dang ldan pa thams cad ni chos rnam par 'byed pa zhes bya'o // de la rnam par 'byed pa ni sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa'o zhes sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa thams cad 'dzin pa'o //
translated: all the uncontaminated mental attentions that have the four noble truths as their object are called the discrimination of phenomena.

original: rab tu rnam par 'byed pa ni 'di ltar skye ba ni sdug bsngal /
analyzed: rab tu rnam par 'byed pa ni 'di ltar skye ba ni sdug bsngal /
translated: The discrimination of suffering is the apprehension of all the aspects of suffering, as in the statement, The noble truth of suffering is the discrimination of suffering.üîΩThe full discrimination of suffering is the apprehension of the aspects of the origin of suffering, as in the statement, The origin of suffering is the full discrimination of suffering.

original: rga ba ni sdug bsngal zhes bya ba la sogs pa so sor rnam par phye ba 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: rga ba ni sdug bsngal zhes bya ba la sogs pa so sor rnam par phye ba 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The distinction is the apprehension of the individual distinctions of aging as suffering, etc.

original: chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa ni de'i gzhi mdo la sogs pa'i chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa ste /
analyzed: chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa ni de'i gzhi mdo la sogs pa'i chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa ste /
translated: The thorough differentiation of dharmas is the thorough differentiation of the dharmas of the sutras, etc. which are the basis of that.

original: 'di ltar de la brten nas snga ma gnyis 'byed par byed pa'o ;
analyzed: 'di ltar de la brten nas snga ma gnyis 'byed par byed pa'o ;
translated: In this way, the first two are differentiated in dependence on that.

original: / de la rnam par 'byed pa nges par 'dzin pa ni rtog pa'o //üîΩrab tu rnam par 'byed pa nges par 'dzin pa ni yang dag par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: / de la rnam par 'byed pa nges par 'dzin pa ni rtog pa'o // rab tu rnam par 'byed pa nges par 'dzin pa ni yang dag par rtog pa'o //
translated: The distinction is the apprehension of the differentiation.üîΩ The thorough differentiation is the apprehension of the thorough differentiation.

original: chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa nges par 'dzin pa ni nye bar rtog pa'o //
analyzed: chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa nges par 'dzin pa ni nye bar rtog pa'o //
translated: The thorough differentiation of dharmas is the apprehension of the thorough differentiation of dharmas.

original: de la snga ma ni kun tu tshol ba'i lam mo //
analyzed: de la snga ma ni kun tu tshol ba'i lam mo //
translated: The first is the path of seeking.

original: 'di ni rnam par nges pa'i lam mo ;
analyzed: 'di ni rnam par nges pa'i lam mo ;
translated: The second is the path of ascertainment.

original: / rnam grangs gzhan yang rtog pa ni shes bya'i dngos po la yid la byed pa gtod pa'o //
analyzed: / rnam grangs gzhan yang rtog pa ni shes bya'i dngos po la yid la byed pa gtod pa'o //
translated: Another formulation: imagination is the directing of attention to the thing to be known.

original: yang dag par rtog pa ni gtad pa'i 'og tu yongs su tshol ba'o //
analyzed: yang dag par rtog pa ni gtad pa'i 'og tu yongs su tshol ba'o //
translated: Correct imagination is the thorough investigation that follows the directing.

original: nye bar rtog pa ni yongs su btsal ba'i 'og tu gtan la 'bebs pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar rtog pa ni yongs su btsal ba'i 'og tu gtan la 'bebs pa'o //
translated: Thorough investigation is the determination that follows the thorough search.

original: bsten pa ni rnam par rtog pa'i lus shes pa'o //
analyzed: bsten pa ni rnam par rtog pa'i lus shes pa'o //
translated: Application is the knowledge of the body of discrimination.

original: yang dag par rtogs pa ni shes bya'i dngos po shes pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par rtogs pa ni shes bya'i dngos po shes pa'o //
translated: Realization is the knowledge of the thing to be known.

original: rnam grangs gzhan yang rang gi mtshan nyid kyi sgo nas bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan yang rang gi mtshan nyid kyi sgo nas bstan pa'o //
translated: Another explanation: the knowledge of the thing to be known is taught from the point of view of own-characteristic.

original: spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi sgo nas yang dag par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi sgo nas yang dag par rtogs pa'o //
translated: Realization is from the point of view of universal characteristic.

original: yod 'dzin ni ji snyed yod pa dang ji ltar yod pa bzhin 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: yod 'dzin ni ji snyed yod pa dang ji ltar yod pa bzhin 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Apprehension of existence is the apprehension of things as they are and to the extent that they are.

original: rgyas par 'gyur ba dang // 'phel ba dang / yangs pa ni snga ma dang phyi ma las so //
analyzed: rgyas par 'gyur ba dang // 'phel ba dang / yangs pa ni snga ma dang phyi ma las so //
translated: Expansion, increase, and abundance are from the former to the latter.

original: yid gzhungs pa ni de'i don snga phyi mi brjed pa'o //
analyzed: yid gzhungs pa ni de'i don snga phyi mi brjed pa'o //
translated: Intellect is the non-forgetting of the former and latter meanings.

original: blo ni rnam par 'byed par nus pa'i shes rab lhan cig skyes pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: blo ni rnam par 'byed par nus pa'i shes rab lhan cig skyes pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Understanding is the innate wisdom that is able to discriminate.

original: mkhas pa ni yang dag par blangs pa'i shes rab gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mkhas pa ni yang dag par blangs pa'i shes rab gang yin pa'o //
translated: Skill is the wisdom that is taken up.

original: shes rab rgyu ba ni lung dang kha ton dang / yongs su 'dri ba dang / 'bel ba'i gtam rnam par nges pa la sogs pas don rnam par shes pa de gong nas gong du rnam par shes par bya ba dang ldan pa'i shes rab gang yin pa'o //
