analyzed: shes rab rgyu ba ni lung dang kha ton dang / yongs su 'dri ba dang / 'bel ba'i gtam rnam par nges pa la sogs pas don rnam par shes pa de gong nas gong du rnam par shes par bya ba dang ldan pa'i shes rab gang yin pa'o //
translated: The wisdom that is engaged is the wisdom that is endowed with the understanding of the meaning that is progressively understood through scriptures, recitation, questioning, and the ascertainment of discussions.

original: lhag mthong ni sngar rnam par shes zin pa'i don la so sor rtog pa'o //
analyzed: lhag mthong ni sngar rnam par shes zin pa'i don la so sor rtog pa'o //
translated: Insight is the discernment of the meaning that has been previously understood.

original: gtod pa @28b ni rtog pa sngon du btang ba'i dmigs pa yid la byed pa gang yin pa dang / der sems gtod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gtod pa @28b ni rtog pa sngon du btang ba'i dmigs pa yid la byed pa gang yin pa dang / der sems gtod par byed pa'o //
translated: Attention is the mental attention to the object that is preceded by investigation and the directing of the mind to that object.

original: rnam par gtod pa ni gang gis mjug rtul bar byed pa'o //üîΩrtog pa ni mtshan mar 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par gtod pa ni gang gis mjug rtul bar byed pa'o // rtog pa ni mtshan mar 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Readjustment is that by which one makes the mind pliant.üîΩInvestigation is the apprehension of the sign.

original: rab tu rtog pa ni mngon rtags su 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu rtog pa ni mngon rtags su 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Discernment is the apprehension of the prognostic.

original: rnam grangs gzhan yang rtog pa ni kun tu tshol ba'i sems kyis rtog pa'o //
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan yang rtog pa ni kun tu tshol ba'i sems kyis rtog pa'o //
translated: Another explanation is that investigation is the investigation of the mind that is seeking.

original: rab tu rtog pa ni kun tu lta bas so sor rtog pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu rtog pa ni kun tu lta bas so sor rtog pa'o //
translated: Discernment is the discernment of the mind that is looking.

original: mngon par rtog pa ni yon tan dang skyon la rtog pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par rtog pa ni yon tan dang skyon la rtog pa'o //
translated: Investigation is the investigation of virtues and faults.

original: de dag nyid lung la brten nas bye brag tu rtog pa dang bye brag tu bgrang ba'o //üîΩmngon sum la brten nas rtog pa dang rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: de dag nyid lung la brten nas bye brag tu rtog pa dang bye brag tu bgrang ba'o // mngon sum la brten nas rtog pa dang rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: They are also investigation and enumeration of distinctions, based on scripture.üîΩThey are also investigation and analysis, based on direct perception.

original: rjes su dpag pa la brten nas yang dag par rtog pa dang / yang dag par rtog pa nyid do //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa la brten nas yang dag par rtog pa dang / yang dag par rtog pa nyid do //
translated: They are also correct investigation and correct analysis, based on inference.

original: kun tu spong ba ni lhag pa'i bsam pas spong ba nges par skye ba'o //
analyzed: kun tu spong ba ni lhag pa'i bsam pas spong ba nges par skye ba'o //
translated: Abandonment is the abandonment of evil through superior attitude.

original: rnam par spong ba ni gzhan las yang dag par len pa'o //üîΩnye bar spong ba ni yang dag par blangs pa'i 'og tu tshul khrims rjes su srung ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par spong ba ni gzhan las yang dag par len pa'o // nye bar spong ba ni yang dag par blangs pa'i 'og tu tshul khrims rjes su srung ba'o //

original: so sor spong ba ni ltung ba 'byung ba chos bzhin du yang phyir byed pa'o //
analyzed: so sor spong ba ni ltung ba 'byung ba chos bzhin du yang phyir byed pa'o //
translated: Abstinence is the purification of transgressions through the performance of rituals.

original: de la yang dag par sdom pa dang / sdom pa gnyis kyis tshul khrims rjes su srung ba zhes bya ba de la yang dag par sdom pa ni bzod pa dang / des pa dang / 'dod pa chung ba dang / byams pa'i sems la sogs pa'o //

analyzed: sdom pa ni dbang po'i sgo bsdams pa'o //

analyzed: spong ldan ni spong ba de dag la lhag pa'i bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: The phrase he does not engage in any offense means that he does not engage in any offense knowingly.üîΩThe phrase

analyzed: mi 'da' ba ni bslab pa'i tshogs thams cad rnam par 'byed par mi byed cing mi spong ba'o //

analyzed: rnam par mi 'da' ba ni phyogs 'ga' yang 'phan mi 'byin zhing mi spong ba'o //

original: gnas pa ni sems 'jog par byed pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gnas pa ni sems 'jog par byed pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Abiding is the settling of the mind.

original: yang dag par 'jog pa ni yang dag par 'jog pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: yang dag par 'jog pa ni yang dag par 'jog pa gang yin pa ste /

analyzed: rgyas pa ni 'di lta ste / nyan thos kyi sa las sems @29a * //

analyzed: gnas pa rnam pa dgu 'byung ba bzhin du rtogs par bya'o //
translated: The settling of the mind should be understood as it is explained in the Sravaka Levels.üîΩThe summary verse states:üîΩKnowledge, teaching, virtue,üîΩaspiration, perseverance, solitude,

original: sdom ni / shes dang ston dang dge ba dang // 'dun dang brtun dang gcig pu dang // rdul bral nad dang snang ba dang // bdag dang sred bcad skye ba zad //
analyzed: sdom ni / shes dang ston dang dge ba dang // 'dun dang brtun dang gcig pu dang // rdul bral nad dang snang ba dang // bdag dang sred bcad skye ba zad //
translated: freedom from dust, freedom from disease, illumination,üîΩself, cutting off craving, and the end of rebirth.üîΩThe many beings, including the gods,

original: lhar bcas skye bo mang po dang // phung po dang ni ngar 'dzin pa'o ;
analyzed: lhar bcas skye bo mang po dang // phung po dang ni ngar 'dzin pa'o ;
translated: the aggregates, and the conception of ‚ÄúI.‚Äù

analyzed: / shes pa zhes bya ba ni thos pa'i tha snyad sngon du 'gro ba'i shes rab po //
translated: ‚ÄúKnowledge‚Äù refers to the wisdom that is preceded by the conventions of listening.

original: mthong ba ni mthong ba'i tha snyad sngon du 'gro ba'i shes rab po //
analyzed: mthong ba ni mthong ba'i tha snyad sngon du 'gro ba'i shes rab po //

analyzed: rig pa ni bye brag phyed pa'i tha snyad sngon du 'gro ba'i shes rab po //

analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni rnam par shes pa'i tha snyad sngon du 'gro ba'i shes rab po //
translated: Consciousness is the wisdom that precedes the convention of consciousness.

original: ye shes ni lkog tu gyur pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes ni lkog tu gyur pa shes pa'o //
translated: Knowledge is the knowledge of what is hidden.

original: mthong ba ni mngon du mngon sum du gyur ba mthong ba'o //
analyzed: mthong ba ni mngon du mngon sum du gyur ba mthong ba'o //
translated: Seeing is the seeing of what is manifest and present.

original: rig pa ni ma rig pa las bzlog pa'i bye brag tu rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: rig pa ni ma rig pa las bzlog pa'i bye brag tu rtogs pa'o //
translated: Knowledge is the specific realization that turns away from ignorance.

original: blo ni yang dag par yod pa'i don shes pa'o //
analyzed: blo ni yang dag par yod pa'i don shes pa'o //
translated: Intelligence is the knowledge of the meaning that truly exists.

original: rtogs pa ni yang dag pa ma yin pa la sgro 'dogs pa'o //
analyzed: rtogs pa ni yang dag pa ma yin pa la sgro 'dogs pa'o //
translated: Realization is the superimposition on what is not real.

original: shes rab gang yin pa ni lhan cig skyes pa'i shes rab gang yin pa ste skyes nas thob pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab gang yin pa ni lhan cig skyes pa'i shes rab gang yin pa ste skyes nas thob pa'o //
translated: Wisdom is the innate wisdom that is obtained from birth.

original: snang ba'i sbyor ba las yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i shes rab gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: snang ba'i sbyor ba las yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i shes rab gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the wisdom that is accomplished through the application of illumination.

original: mngon par rtogs pa ni chos mngon par rtogs pa dang ldan pa chos rnams la gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog cing /
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa ni chos mngon par rtogs pa dang ldan pa chos rnams la gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog cing /
translated: Realization is the realization of phenomena, which is not dependent on others.üîΩ

original: lkog tu gyur pa ma yin pa nang gi so so'i nang gi shes rab gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa ma yin pa nang gi so so'i nang gi shes rab gang yin pa'o //
translated: Realization is the inner wisdom of one who has realized the Dharma and who is not dependent on others for the meaning of the Dharma.

original: ston pa ni dris pa lung ston pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: ston pa ni dris pa lung ston pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Teaching is the explanation of the Dharma that is requested.

original: 'dogs par byed pa ni lung ston par 'dod pa'i ming dang tshig dang yi ge'i tshogs rnams mthar gyis legs par sdeb par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'dogs par byed pa ni lung ston par 'dod pa'i ming dang tshig dang yi ge'i tshogs rnams mthar gyis legs par sdeb par byed pa'o //
translated: Designation is the successive arrangement of the collections of names, words, and letters that are desired for the explanation of the Dharma.

original: rab tu 'jog par byed pa ni mthar gyis legs par bsdebs pa rnams ston par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu 'jog par byed pa ni mthar gyis legs par bsdebs pa rnams ston par byed pa'o //
translated: Establishment is the teaching of the successive arrangement.

original: bye brag tu 'grel pa ni bstan pa rnams bye brag tu ston par byed cing don 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: bye brag tu 'grel pa ni bstan pa rnams bye brag tu ston par byed cing don 'chad pa'o //
translated: Analysis is the explanation of the teaching by means of distinctions.

original: rnam par 'grel ba ni gzhan gyi the tshom skyes so cog sel bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par 'grel ba ni gzhan gyi the tshom skyes so cog sel bar byed pa'o //
translated: Exposition is the removal of the doubts that arise in others.

original: gsal bar byed pa ni don dang tshig dang zab mo yang dang yang du rtogs par byas nas rab tu ston par byed pa'o ;
analyzed: gsal bar byed pa ni don dang tshig dang zab mo yang dang yang du rtogs par byas nas rab tu ston par byed pa'o ;
translated: It makes clear by teaching after having understood the meaning, the words, and the profundity again and again.

original: / ston par byed pa ni snying brtse bas ma dris ma bcol bar chos 'chad bar byed cing kun tu ston pa'o //
analyzed: / ston par byed pa ni snying brtse bas ma dris ma bcol bar chos 'chad bar byed cing kun tu ston pa'o //
translated: It teaches by teaching and demonstrating the Dharma out of compassion, without being asked or requested.

original: yang dag par rab tu ston pa ni bar chad med par ston pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par rab tu ston pa ni bar chad med par ston pa'o //
translated: It perfectly demonstrates by teaching without interruption.

original: slob dpon gyi dpe mkhyud mi byed pa ni 'chab pa mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: slob dpon gyi dpe mkhyud mi byed pa ni 'chab pa mi byed pa'o //
translated: It does not hold back like a teacher by not being secretive.

original: thog mar dge ba ni nyan pa rnams rab tu dga' ba @29b skyed pa'o //
analyzed: thog mar dge ba ni nyan pa rnams rab tu dga' ba @29b skyed pa'o //
translated: It is virtuous in the beginning by arousing great joy in the listeners.

original: bar du dge ba ni rab tu sbyor ba rnams tshegs chung ngus mtha' gnyis rnam par spangs pa dbu ma'i lam la yang dag par brten pa'o //
analyzed: bar du dge ba ni rab tu sbyor ba rnams tshegs chung ngus mtha' gnyis rnam par spangs pa dbu ma'i lam la yang dag par brten pa'o //
translated: It is virtuous in the middle by causing those who are well engaged to rely on the middle way, which is free from the two extremes, with little difficulty.

original: tha mar dge ba ni shin tu dri ma med pa dang / shin tu mthar phyin pa'i phyir dang / thams cad la 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / shin tu 'dod chags dang bral ba'i mthar gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha mar dge ba ni shin tu dri ma med pa dang / shin tu mthar phyin pa'i phyir dang / thams cad la 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / shin tu 'dod chags dang bral ba'i mthar gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The last is virtuous because it is extremely pure and extremely perfected, and because it is the end of all detachment and the end of complete detachment.

original: don bzang po ni phan pa dang / bde ba dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don bzang po ni phan pa dang / bde ba dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It has good meaning because it is endowed with benefit and happiness.

original: tshig 'bru bzang po ni ming gi tshogs la sogs pa legs par sbyar ba dang / tshig tu 'don pa zur phyin pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: tshig 'bru bzang po ni ming gi tshogs la sogs pa legs par sbyar ba dang / tshig tu 'don pa zur phyin pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: It has good phrasing because it is endowed with well-formed collections of words, etc., and with well-formed pronunciation.

original: ma 'dres pa ni 'di las phyi rol pa rnams dang thun mong ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: ma 'dres pa ni 'di las phyi rol pa rnams dang thun mong ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is not mixed with other traditions.

original: yongs su rdzogs pa ni tshad med pa'i phyir thams cad kyi mchog tu byung ba'o //
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs pa ni tshad med pa'i phyir thams cad kyi mchog tu byung ba'o //
translated: It is complete because it is the best of all, being immeasurable.

original: yongs su dag pa ni rang bzhin rnam par grol ba'o //
analyzed: yongs su dag pa ni rang bzhin rnam par grol ba'o //
translated: It is pure because it is naturally liberated.

original: yongs su byang ba ni rgyud rnam par grol ba'o //
analyzed: yongs su byang ba ni rgyud rnam par grol ba'o //
translated: It is purified because it is liberated from the stream.

original: tshangs par spyod pa ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad de /
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad de /
translated: It is the holy life, the eightfold path of the noble ones.

original: de ni ma 'dres pa'i rnam pa la sogs pas mtshan nyid rnam pa bzhir bstan to //
analyzed: de ni ma 'dres pa'i rnam pa la sogs pas mtshan nyid rnam pa bzhir bstan to //
translated: That is taught to have four characteristics: unmixed aspects, and so on.

original: nyon la zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid de lta bu'i chos la rna gtod par yang dag par sbyor bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: nyon la zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid de lta bu'i chos la rna gtod par yang dag par sbyor bar byed pa'o //
translated: Listen well means to apply oneself to listening to the Dharma with such characteristics.

original: shin tu legs par zhes bya ba ni phyin ci ma log pa dang / rgyun mi 'chad pa dang / gus par tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dang yang dag par sbyor bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu legs par zhes bya ba ni phyin ci ma log pa dang / rgyun mi 'chad pa dang / gus par tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dang yang dag par sbyor bar byed pa'o //
translated: Very well means to apply oneself to listening without error, continuously and respectfully.

original: 'dun pa drag po ni nam zhig na gnas te zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'dun pa drag po ni nam zhig na gnas te zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba'o //
translated: Intense aspiration is the wish to listen to the Dharma at any time.

original: dga' ba drag po ni yang dag par sbyor ba la dga' ba'o //
analyzed: dga' ba drag po ni yang dag par sbyor ba la dga' ba'o //
translated: Intense joy is delight in correct application.

original: rab tu dga' ba drag po ni ston par byed pa ston pa'am bla ma'i gnas lta bu la rab tu dga' ba'o //
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba drag po ni ston par byed pa ston pa'am bla ma'i gnas lta bu la rab tu dga' ba'o //
translated: Intense delight is delight in the teacher who teaches or in the teacher's seat.

original: dang ba drag po ni chos ston pa dang gdams ngag rjes su ston pa la dang ba'o //
analyzed: dang ba drag po ni chos ston pa dang gdams ngag rjes su ston pa la dang ba'o //
translated: Intense clarity is clarity in the teaching of the Dharma and in the instructions and follow up teachings.

original: brtun par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mngon par shes pa myur bar bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: brtun par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mngon par shes pa myur bar bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: For the sake of being diligent means for the sake of quick higher perception.

original: sang bya'o sang bya'o zhes mi sdod par brtson 'grus rtsom pa'o //
analyzed: sang bya'o sang bya'o zhes mi sdod par brtson 'grus rtsom pa'o //
translated: One should not procrastinate, thinking, I will do it tomorrow, I will do it tomorrow.

original: rjes su brtson par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rjes su brtson par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: For the sake of being assiduous means

original: ji ltar bslab pa dang / mnyam pa'am /
analyzed: ji ltar bslab pa dang / mnyam pa'am /
translated: to apply oneself equally or

original: lhag par rab tu sbyor gyi /
analyzed: lhag par rab tu sbyor gyi /
translated: more to the training

original: chung ngur ni ma yin no //
analyzed: chung ngur ni ma yin no //
translated: and not less.

original: spang ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa rnams kyi gnyen po bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: spang ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa rnams kyi gnyen po bsgom pa'o //
translated: For the sake of abandoning means cultivating the antidotes to the afflictions.

original: nang du yang dag gzhag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bas mtha'i gnas mal dag tu ma 'dres par gnas shing ting nge 'dzin mngon sum du bya ba la ting nge 'dzin gang @30a * //
analyzed: nang du yang dag gzhag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bas mtha'i gnas mal dag tu ma 'dres par gnas shing ting nge 'dzin mngon sum du bya ba la ting nge 'dzin gang @30a * //
translated: For the sake of inner equipoise means to dwell in solitude in a remote dwelling and to actualize concentration.

original: la brten nas gnyen po bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: la brten nas gnyen po bsgom pa'o //
translated: The concentration on which one relies is the antidote cultivation.

original: gcig pu ni dben pa'i gnas mal du song ba gnyis lhan cig tu mi gnas pa'o //
analyzed: gcig pu ni dben pa'i gnas mal du song ba gnyis lhan cig tu mi gnas pa'o //
translated: Alone means to go to a solitary dwelling and not to dwell together with a second person.

original: ma 'dres pa ni nyon mongs pa can dang lung du ma bstan pa'i yid la byed pa la kun tu mi spyod pa'o //
analyzed: ma 'dres pa ni nyon mongs pa can dang lung du ma bstan pa'i yid la byed pa la kun tu mi spyod pa'o //
translated: Non-confusion is the non-cultivation of defiled and neutral mental activities.

original: bag yod pa ni 'dod pa'i rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa sdig pa can gyi chos las sems srung ba dang / dge ba la yang dag par sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: bag yod pa ni 'dod pa'i rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa sdig pa can gyi chos las sems srung ba dang / dge ba la yang dag par sbyor ba'o //
translated: Carefulness is the guarding of the mind against sinful, negative dharmas such as thoughts of sensual desire, and the right application to virtue.

original: bstan pa can ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: bstan pa can ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The possession of learning is as above.

original: bdag nyid gtod pa ni sgrib pa lnga spangs nas sems nang du rab tu gtod pa dang 'das bla na med pa'i grub pa dang bde ba la sems gtod pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag nyid gtod pa ni sgrib pa lnga spangs nas sems nang du rab tu gtod pa dang 'das bla na med pa'i grub pa dang bde ba la sems gtod pa yin no //
translated: The fixing of the self is the fixing of the mind within, after the abandonment of the five hindrances, and the fixing of the mind on the unsurpassed accomplishment and happiness of the past.

original: rdul dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni mthar ma thug pa'i shes pa skyes pa la mngon par rtogs pa'i bar chad byed pa nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal bar chad dang bcas pa dang bar chad med par 'byung ba gang yin pa de ni rdul zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rdul dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni mthar ma thug pa'i shes pa skyes pa la mngon par rtogs pa'i bar chad byed pa nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal bar chad dang bcas pa dang bar chad med par 'byung ba gang yin pa de ni rdul zhes bya'o //
translated: The absence of dust is the arising of the knowledge that has not yet reached its conclusion, with or without the pride of thinking ‚ÄúI am,‚Äù which is an obstacle to realization. This is called dust.

original: dri ma ni de'i phyogs dang mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i phyogs kyi gnas ngan len to ;
analyzed: dri ma ni de'i phyogs dang mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i phyogs kyi gnas ngan len to ;
translated: The stain is the negative reflex of the side of the path of vision.

original: / de dag med pa'i phyir rdul dang bral ba dang dri ma dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: / de dag med pa'i phyir rdul dang bral ba dang dri ma dang bral ba'o //
translated: Because of the absence of these two, it is free from dust and free from stain.

original: yang nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal de dang / mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa ni rdul lo //
analyzed: yang nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal de dang / mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa ni rdul lo //
translated: Moreover, the pride of thinking ‚ÄúI am‚Äù and the defilements to be eliminated by the path of vision are the dust.

original: phyogs gnyis ka'i gnas ngan len ni dri ma'o //
analyzed: phyogs gnyis ka'i gnas ngan len ni dri ma'o //
translated: The negative reflex of both sides is the stain.

original: chos rnams la zhes bya ba ni rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid du gnas pa dag la'o //
analyzed: chos rnams la zhes bya ba ni rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid du gnas pa dag la'o //
translated: With regard to the dharmas means with regard to those that are established as general and particular characteristics.

original: chos kyi mig ni chos tsam yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin mngon sum du nyams su myong ba can gyi shes rab po //
analyzed: chos kyi mig ni chos tsam yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin mngon sum du nyams su myong ba can gyi shes rab po //
translated: The eye of Dharma is the wisdom that experiences the mere dharma just as it is in actuality.

original: chos mthong ba ni sdug bsngal la sogs pa la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba'o //
analyzed: chos mthong ba ni sdug bsngal la sogs pa la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba'o //
translated: The vision of Dharma is the correct vision of suffering and so forth.

original: chos thob pa ni dge sbyong gi 'bras bu mthun par thob pa'o //
analyzed: chos thob pa ni dge sbyong gi 'bras bu mthun par thob pa'o //
translated: The attainment of Dharma is the attainment of the concordant fruit of the spiritual practitioner.

original: chos rtogs pa de thob pa na bdag gis thob pa'o //
analyzed: chos rtogs pa de thob pa na bdag gis thob pa'o //
translated: When one realizes the attainment of Dharma, one thinks ‚ÄúI have attained it.‚Äù

original: bdag ni rgyun du zhugs pa ste ltung ba'i chos can ma yin zhes bya bar shes pa'o //
analyzed: bdag ni rgyun du zhugs pa ste ltung ba'i chos can ma yin zhes bya bar shes pa'o //
translated: I am a stream-enterer, not subject to falling back.

original: chos kyi gting sleb pa ni bden pa mngon par rtogs pa'i dbang du byas te shes nas dad pa rnyed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chos kyi gting sleb pa ni bden pa mngon par rtogs pa'i dbang du byas te shes nas dad pa rnyed pa'i phyir /
translated: Having reached the depths of the Dharma refers to the realization of the truths, because one has attained faith born of understanding.

original: ston pa dang chos dang dge 'dun dang bdag nyid kyis 'phags pa dgyes pa'i tshul khrims rnams rnam pa'i sgo nas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du gting rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: ston pa dang chos dang dge 'dun dang bdag nyid kyis 'phags pa dgyes pa'i tshul khrims rnams rnam pa'i sgo nas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du gting rtogs pa'o //
translated: One has penetrated the depths of the Teacher, the Dharma, the Sa·πÖgha, and the morality pleasing to the ƒÄryas, by way of their aspects, just as they are.

original: som nyi las rgal ba ni rang gi rtogs pa la'o //
analyzed: som nyi las rgal ba ni rang gi rtogs pa la'o //
translated: Having crossed over doubt refers to one‚Äôs own realization.

original: the tshom las rgal ba ni gzhan dag gi rtogs pa dag la'o //
analyzed: the tshom las rgal ba ni gzhan dag gi rtogs pa dag la'o //
translated: Having crossed over uncertainty refers to the realizations of others.

original: gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog pa ni chos de bdag nyid kyis yang dag par rtogs kyi gzhan @30b las mnyan pa la sogs pa dag las ni ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog pa ni chos de bdag nyid kyis yang dag par rtogs kyi gzhan @30b las mnyan pa la sogs pa dag las ni ma yin pa'o //
translated: Not being led by others refers to the fact that one has realized the Dharma by oneself, not through listening to others.

original: gzhan gyis bkrir mi btub pa ni ston pa'i bstan pa la phas kyi rgol ba thams cad kyis mi 'phrogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis bkrir mi btub pa ni ston pa'i bstan pa la phas kyi rgol ba thams cad kyis mi 'phrogs pa'o //
translated: Not being swayed by others refers to the fact that one is not carried away by any opponents in the Teacher‚Äôs teachings.

original: chos rnams la mi 'jigs pa thob pa ni rtog pa de la gzhan gyis dris kyang spa 'gong ba med pa'o //
analyzed: chos rnams la mi 'jigs pa thob pa ni rtog pa de la gzhan gyis dris kyang spa 'gong ba med pa'o //
translated: The attainment of fearlessness with regard to all things is the absence of embarrassment when questioned by others about those thoughts.

original: mngon bar rgal ba mngon par rgal ba zhes bya ba ni rgyun phyogs las bzlog pa'i lam la yang dag par zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: mngon bar rgal ba mngon par rgal ba zhes bya ba ni rgyun phyogs las bzlog pa'i lam la yang dag par zhugs pa'o //
translated: The phrase one who has crossed over and gone beyond means one who has entered the path that turns away from the direction of the stream.

original: lan gnyis su brjod pa ni shin tu mngon par rgal ba las phyir mi ldog pa'o //
analyzed: lan gnyis su brjod pa ni shin tu mngon par rgal ba las phyir mi ldog pa'o //
translated: The repetition of the word crossed over indicates that one who has crossed over does not turn back.

original: rnam grangs gzhan yang brdar btags pa dang don dam pa'i chos khas blangs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan yang brdar btags pa dang don dam pa'i chos khas blangs par rig par bya'o //
translated: Another interpretation is that the terms crossed over and gone beyond refer to the conventional and ultimate truths, respectively.

original: nad du snang ngo zhes rgyas par bshad pa gang yin pa ji ltar na nad la sogs par snang ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: nad du snang ngo zhes rgyas par bshad pa gang yin pa ji ltar na nad la sogs par snang ba yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that the Buddha has said, I see sickness, and so on?

original: 'di'i nad ni 'di ma yin mod kyi zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: 'di'i nad ni 'di ma yin mod kyi zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ste /
translated: The text says, It is not that I see sickness, and so on, as real, and so on.

original: 'on kyang de dang po de nyid du mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pas de ltar rnam par sun phyung ba yin te //
analyzed: 'on kyang de dang po de nyid du mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pas de ltar rnam par sun phyung ba yin te //
translated: However, in the beginning, I did teach impermanence and so on in that way in order to disgust them with the world.

original: gang zhig yid la byed pa na 'grogs par mi 'dod pas nad la sogs pa bzhin du mi mthun par 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig yid la byed pa na 'grogs par mi 'dod pas nad la sogs pa bzhin du mi mthun par 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: When one attends to it, one does not want to be accompanied by it, and so one holds it to be disagreeable, like a disease, etc.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mjug thogs su mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa smos te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mjug thogs su mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa smos te /
translated: That is why the aspects of impermanence, etc., are mentioned immediately after that.

original: de ltar snang ba de ni der yongs su rtag pa'i 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: de ltar snang ba de ni der yongs su rtag pa'i 'bras bu yin no //
translated: The result of the complete understanding of that appearance is the aspect of cessation.üîΩThe aspect of cessation is the result of the complete understanding of that appearance.

original: mi rtag pa nyid du zhes bya ba ni tshe'i skad cig brgyud pa mthong pa ste /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid du zhes bya ba ni tshe'i skad cig brgyud pa mthong pa ste /
translated: The aspect of impermanence is the seeing of the stream of moments of life.

original: skad cig brgyud pa na dper na mngon sum pa dang / gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog pa'i shes pas reg pa de dang de kun tu 'byung ba dang nub pa'i sgo nas tshor ba de dang de kun tu 'byung ba dang nub pa'i rgyun mthong ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: skad cig brgyud pa na dper na mngon sum pa dang / gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog pa'i shes pas reg pa de dang de kun tu 'byung ba dang nub pa'i sgo nas tshor ba de dang de kun tu 'byung ba dang nub pa'i rgyun mthong ba lta bu'o //
translated: The seeing of the stream of moments is like the seeing of the arising and cessation of this or that feeling through the arising and cessation of this or that contact, by means of the knowledge of one who is not in error and who is not dependent on another.

original: sdug bsngal nyid du zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal rnam pa gnyis te skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal dang / gang ci tshor yang rung ba de ni 'dir sdug bsngal lo zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal nyid du zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal rnam pa gnyis te skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal dang / gang ci tshor yang rung ba de ni 'dir sdug bsngal lo zhes bya'o //
translated: Suffering itself is twofold: the suffering of the two kinds of suffering and the suffering of everything that is felt.

original: tshe'i skad cig brgyud pa mthong ba'i sgo nas ci rigs par de nyid la 'jug ste /
analyzed: tshe'i skad cig brgyud pa mthong ba'i sgo nas ci rigs par de nyid la 'jug ste /
translated: One enters into the reality of suffering by seeing the continuity of the moments of life.

original: shi ba'i 'og tu skye'o //
analyzed: shi ba'i 'og tu skye'o //
translated: After death, one is born again.

original: skyes nas kyang rga ba la sogs pas sdug bsngal te de'i phyir gang mi rtag pa de ni sdug bsngal lo zhes skye ba brgyud pa'i sgo nas sdug bsngal ba nyid la 'jug go //
analyzed: skyes nas kyang rga ba la sogs pas sdug bsngal te de'i phyir gang mi rtag pa de ni sdug bsngal lo zhes skye ba brgyud pa'i sgo nas sdug bsngal ba nyid la 'jug go //
translated: And having been born, one suffers from old age, etc. Therefore, one enters into the reality of suffering by way of the continuity of birth, in accordance with the statement: ‚ÄúWhatever is impermanent is suffering.

original: ji ltar na gang ci tshor yang rung de ni 'dir sdug bsngal ba'o zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na gang ci tshor yang rung de ni 'dir sdug bsngal ba'o zhes bya zhe na /
translated: ‚Äù How is it that whatever is felt is suffering in this context?

original: bde ba'i tshor ba ni 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid kyis sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: bde ba'i tshor ba ni 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid kyis sdug bsngal lo //
translated: Pleasant feeling is suffering because of the suffering of change.

original: sdug bsngal ni sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal @31a * //üîΩnyid kyis skye ba dang gnas pas sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ni sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal @31a * //üîΩnyid kyis skye ba dang gnas pas sdug bsngal lo //
translated: Painful feeling is suffering because of the suffering of suffering.üîΩFeeling that is neither pleasant nor painful is suffering because of the suffering of the formative forces.

original: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa ni mi rtag pa dang 'gog pa'i chos can pas sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa ni mi rtag pa dang 'gog pa'i chos can pas sdug bsngal lo //
translated: The neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant is suffering because it is subject to cessation.

original: de la bde ba ni mi rtag pa'i phyir yongs su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la bde ba ni mi rtag pa'i phyir yongs su 'gyur ro //
translated: The pleasant is subject to change because it is impermanent.

original: sdug bsngal ni mi rtag pa'i phyir skye'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ni mi rtag pa'i phyir skye'o //
translated: The unpleasant is subject to arising because it is impermanent.

original: rgyun du 'byung ba'i phyir gnas so //
analyzed: rgyun du 'byung ba'i phyir gnas so //
translated: It is subject to abiding because it occurs in a stream.

original: sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa yang 'gag pa ni mi rtag pa skyes pa ni 'gags pa'i chos can te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa yang 'gag pa ni mi rtag pa skyes pa ni 'gags pa'i chos can te /
translated: The neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant is subject to cessation because it is impermanent and subject to arising because it is subject to cessation.

original: de 'gags kyang de gnyis dang ma bral ba ni de gnyis dang rjes su 'brel ba yin pas de'i phyir de yang sdug bsngal ba yin no //
analyzed: de 'gags kyang de gnyis dang ma bral ba ni de gnyis dang rjes su 'brel ba yin pas de'i phyir de yang sdug bsngal ba yin no //
translated: Even though it ceases, it is not free from the two, because it is associated with the two. Therefore, it is also suffering.

original: ji ltar na bde ba'i tshor ba sdug bsngal ba nyid du lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na bde ba'i tshor ba sdug bsngal ba nyid du lta zhe na /
translated: How is the pleasant feeling seen as suffering?

original: de la 'dod chags rgyas par 'gyur la //
analyzed: de la 'dod chags rgyas par 'gyur la //
translated: Because it increases attachment.

original: de la yang tshe phyi ma la sdug bsngal yongs su 'dzin pa dang / mthong ba'i chos la yang des 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal skyed par byed de /
analyzed: de la yang tshe phyi ma la sdug bsngal yongs su 'dzin pa dang / mthong ba'i chos la yang des 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal skyed par byed de /
translated: Furthermore, it is the cause of suffering in the next life and the cause of the suffering of change in this life.

original: de ltar na sdug bsngal nyid du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na sdug bsngal nyid du blta bar bya'o //
translated: Thus, one should see it as suffering.

original: ji ltar na sdug bsngal la zug rngu nyid du blta bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na sdug bsngal la zug rngu nyid du blta bar bya zhe na /
translated: How should one see it as a dart?

original: mngon du gyur na zug rngu bzhin du gnod pa byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon du gyur na zug rngu bzhin du gnod pa byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it causes harm like a dart when it manifests.

original: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa de ni mi rtag pa 'gyur ba'i chos can no zhes bya ba ni 'gags pa gang yin pa ni mi rtag pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa de ni mi rtag pa 'gyur ba'i chos can no zhes bya ba ni 'gags pa gang yin pa ni mi rtag pa'o //
translated: That which is neither pleasant nor unpleasant is impermanent and subject to change.

original: ma 'gags pa gang yin pa ni 'gog pa'i chos can te /
analyzed: ma 'gags pa gang yin pa ni 'gog pa'i chos can te /
translated: That which is impermanent is subject to cessation.

original: mi rtag pa gang yin pa de las ni bde ba'am sdug bsngal mi skye'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa gang yin pa de las ni bde ba'am sdug bsngal mi skye'o //
translated: That which is impermanent does not produce pleasure or pain.

original: 'gog pa'i chos can ni des bde ba dang sdug bsngal dag las yongs su ma grol ba yin no //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i chos can ni des bde ba dang sdug bsngal dag las yongs su ma grol ba yin no //
translated: That which is subject to cessation is not completely free from pleasure and pain.

original: stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni rtag pa dang brtan pa dang mi 'gyur pa'i chos can gyi bdag dang bral pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni rtag pa dang brtan pa dang mi 'gyur pa'i chos can gyi bdag dang bral pa'o //
translated: Emptiness is the absence of a self that is permanent, stable, and enduring.

original: bdag med pa nyid ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang rang dbang med pa'o //
analyzed: bdag med pa nyid ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang rang dbang med pa'o //
translated: Selflessness is the absence of independence and the absence of intrinsic reality.

original: snang ba ni rang bzhin gyis so //
analyzed: snang ba ni rang bzhin gyis so //
translated: Appearance is the intrinsic reality of things.

original: rab tu snang ba ni de yongs su shes par bya ba dang / spang bar bya ba'o //üîΩngan par snang ba ni de yongs su ma shes shing ma spangs na /
analyzed: rab tu snang ba ni de yongs su shes par bya ba dang / spang bar bya ba'o // ngan par snang ba ni de yongs su ma shes shing ma spangs na /
translated: Clear appearance is the thorough knowledge and abandonment of that.

original: skyon 'di lta bu dang mthun par 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: skyon 'di lta bu dang mthun par 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Bad appearance is the occurrence of faults such as these when there is no thorough knowledge and abandonment of that.

original: kun shes pa ni mtshan nyid so sor yang dag par rtogs pas so //
analyzed: kun shes pa ni mtshan nyid so sor yang dag par rtogs pas so //
translated: Thorough knowledge is the thorough understanding of the characteristics of things.

original: rnam par shes pa ni mos pa yid la byed pas so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni mos pa yid la byed pas so //
translated: Consciousness is the mental attention to resolve.

original: rab tu shes pa ni rab tu dben pa dang ldan pa la sogs pas so //
analyzed: rab tu shes pa ni rab tu dben pa dang ldan pa la sogs pas so //
translated: Clear knowledge is the possession of isolation, etc.

original: yang dag par rtog par byed pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyi sgo nas so //
analyzed: yang dag par rtog par byed pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyi sgo nas so //
translated: Correct conception is the conception of the individual characteristics of things.

original: nye bar rtog par byed pa ni spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi sgo nas so //
analyzed: nye bar rtog par byed pa ni spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi sgo nas so //
translated: The investigation is by way of the general characteristics.

original: bsten @31b par byed pa ni ji snyed yod pa las so //
analyzed: bsten @31b par byed pa ni ji snyed yod pa las so //
translated: The cultivation is by way of the extent of existence.

original: so sor rtog pa ni ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa las so //
analyzed: so sor rtog pa ni ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa las so //
translated: The discernment is by way of the mode of existence.

original: reg par byed pa ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad tshangs par spyod pas yang dag par bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: reg par byed pa ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad tshangs par spyod pas yang dag par bsdus pa'o //
translated: The touching is by way of the pure life which is included in the eightfold noble path.

original: mngon sum du byed pa ni 'bras bu mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: mngon sum du byed pa ni 'bras bu mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: The realization is by way of the fruit, which is nirvana.

original: bdag ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga rnams la bdag dang bdag gir lta ba kun du spyod pa'o //
analyzed: bdag ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga rnams la bdag dang bdag gir lta ba kun du spyod pa'o //
translated: The self is the practice of the view of I and mine in regard to the five aggregates.

original: sems can ni yod pa'i chos de dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du ma shes pa dang de dag la chags pa'o //
analyzed: sems can ni yod pa'i chos de dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du ma shes pa dang de dag la chags pa'o //
translated: The sentient beings are those who do not know those things as they are and who are attached to them.

original: shed las skyes pa ni yid kyi rnam pa'o //
analyzed: shed las skyes pa ni yid kyi rnam pa'o //
translated: The living beings are the forms of mind.

original: shed bu ni nga rgyal la brten nas mtho dman du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: shed bu ni nga rgyal la brten nas mtho dman du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The souls are those who, based on pride, become high and low.

original: gso ba ni yang 'byung ba pa'i srid pa'i lam gyis rgyas par byas pa'o //
analyzed: gso ba ni yang 'byung ba pa'i srid pa'i lam gyis rgyas par byas pa'o //
translated: The persons are those who are nourished by the path of existence which is to be repeated.

original: skyes bu ni skyes bu'i rtsal byed pa'o //
analyzed: skyes bu ni skyes bu'i rtsal byed pa'o //
translated: A person is one who is capable of action.

original: gang zag ni yang dang yang du 'gro ba la ngoms par dang chog mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: gang zag ni yang dang yang du 'gro ba la ngoms par dang chog mi shes pa'o //
translated: A being is one who is satisfied with going and coming again and again.

original: srog ni tshe dang lhan cig gson zhing gnas pa'o //
analyzed: srog ni tshe dang lhan cig gson zhing gnas pa'o //
translated: Life is the life that is together with the life-force.

original: skye ba po ni skye ba la sogs pa'i chos so //
analyzed: skye ba po ni skye ba la sogs pa'i chos so //
translated: A living being is one who has the qualities of birth, etc.

original: kun tu sbyor ba rnams rnam par bzlog nas sred pa bcad pa dang ldan zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: kun tu sbyor ba rnams rnam par bzlog nas sred pa bcad pa dang ldan zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Having turned away from the fetters, he is endowed with the cutting off of craving.

original: bden pa mngon par rtogs pa dang bcas pa kun tu sbyor ba gsum spang ba'i phyir yang srid pa'i sred pa kun tu mi spyod pa'o //
analyzed: bden pa mngon par rtogs pa dang bcas pa kun tu sbyor ba gsum spang ba'i phyir yang srid pa'i sred pa kun tu mi spyod pa'o //
translated: This means that, having realized the truths, he does not engage in the craving for renewed existence in order to abandon the three fetters.

original: des dus gzhan na yang dang yang du skye ba dang 'jig pa rjes su mthong nas nga rgyal ma lus par rab tu spong ste de'i phyir nga rgyal yang dag par mngon par rtogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: des dus gzhan na yang dang yang du skye ba dang 'jig pa rjes su mthong nas nga rgyal ma lus par rab tu spong ste de'i phyir nga rgyal yang dag par mngon par rtogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Having seen again and again the arising and perishing of others at other times, he completely abandons pride. Therefore, it is called the realization of pride.

original: de'i sred pa'i bag la nyal 'di thams cad spangs pa yin te de'i phyir phyi ma la sdug bsngal yang mi skye ba'i chos nyid rnyed pa'i phyir sdug bsngal mthar byas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i sred pa'i bag la nyal 'di thams cad spangs pa yin te de'i phyir phyi ma la sdug bsngal yang mi skye ba'i chos nyid rnyed pa'i phyir sdug bsngal mthar byas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: He has abandoned the latent tendencies of craving for all of that. Therefore, he has attained the nature of not producing suffering again in the future. Thus, he is called ‚Äúone who has made an end of suffering.‚Äù

original: bdag gi skye bzad do zhes bya ba ni yang srid pa brgyad pa phan chad do //
analyzed: bdag gi skye bzad do zhes bya ba ni yang srid pa brgyad pa phan chad do //
translated: ‚ÄúMy births have been exhausted‚Äù means that he will not have an eighth birth.

original: tshangs par spyod pa bsten to zhes bya ba ni lam shin tu goms par bya ba'i phyir yongs su mi nyams pa'o //
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa bsten to zhes bya ba ni lam shin tu goms par bya ba'i phyir yongs su mi nyams pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúI have lived the holy life‚Äù means that he will not fall away from the path because he has become very familiar with it.

original: bya ba byas pa zhes bya ba ni kun tu sbyor ba thams cad yongs su gtugs pa dang lam mtha' dag thob pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba byas pa zhes bya ba ni kun tu sbyor ba thams cad yongs su gtugs pa dang lam mtha' dag thob pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWhat was to be done has been done‚Äù means that he has completely exhausted all of the fetters and has attained the entire path.

original: 'di las srid pa gzhan mi shes so zhes bya ba ni srid pa bdun yang zad pa'o //
analyzed: 'di las srid pa gzhan mi shes so zhes bya ba ni srid pa bdun yang zad pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThere is no more of this sort of existence‚Äù means that he has exhausted the seven existences.

original: yang bdag gi skye ba zad do zhes bya ba ni skye ba ni gnyis te skye ba'i skye ba dang / nyon mongs pa'i skye ba ste skye ba'i skye ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: yang bdag gi skye ba zad do zhes bya ba ni skye ba ni gnyis te skye ba'i skye ba dang / nyon mongs pa'i skye ba ste skye ba'i skye ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: ‚ÄúMy births have been exhausted‚Äù means that there are two kinds of births: the birth of birth and the birth of afflictions. The birth of birth is as explained above.

original: de gnyis bsrabs ba ni zad pa ste /
analyzed: de gnyis bsrabs ba ni zad pa ste /
translated: The exhaustion of those two is the exhaustion of the two fruits.

original: 'bras bu dang po gnyis ston to //üîΩtshangs par spyod pa bsten zhes bya ba ni phyir mi 'ong bas mi @32a * //
analyzed: 'bras bu dang po gnyis ston to // tshangs par spyod pa bsten zhes bya ba ni phyir mi 'ong bas mi @32a * //
translated: The first two fruits are shown.

original: tshangs par spyod pa'i 'dod chags spang pa'o //
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa'i 'dod chags spang pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúhe resorts to pure conduct‚Äù means that the non-returner abandons the attachment of pure conduct.

original: bya ba byas so //
analyzed: bya ba byas so //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúhe has done what was to be done‚Äù means that he has completed the practice of the path.

original: 'di las srid pa gzhan mi shes so zhes bya ba ni dgra bcom pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di las srid pa gzhan mi shes so zhes bya ba ni dgra bcom pa nyid do //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúhe knows that he will not know another existence‚Äù means that he has attained arhatship.

original: de dag ni kun shes pa brda sprod pa'i rnam pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni kun shes pa brda sprod pa'i rnam pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: These are the aspects of the knowledge of all things.

original: lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten zhes bya ba ni mngon bstan pa'o //
analyzed: lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten zhes bya ba ni mngon bstan pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe world with its gods‚Äù means that he has attained the state of being a teacher.

original: de ni rnam pa gnyis te bdud dang bcas pa dang / tshangs pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: de ni rnam pa gnyis te bdud dang bcas pa dang / tshangs pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: This is of two kinds: the state of being a teacher of the gods and the state of being a teacher of humans.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúthe world with its Brahma gods‚Äù means that he has attained the state of being a teacher of those who are Brahmas and Maras.

original: dge sbyong dang bram zer bcas pa'i skye dgu zhes bya ba ni dge sbyong dang bram ze gang dag mi rnams kyi nang du skyes pa tshangs pa'am bdud kyi phyir zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: dge sbyong dang bram zer bcas pa'i skye dgu zhes bya ba ni dge sbyong dang bram ze gang dag mi rnams kyi nang du skyes pa tshangs pa'am bdud kyi phyir zhugs pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe world with its ascetics and Brahmins‚Äù means that he has attained the state of being a teacher of those ascetics and Brahmins who are humans and who have entered the path of the Brahmas and Maras.

original: lha dang mir bcas pa'i skye dgu zhes bya ba ni lha dag gi nang na ni tshangs pa dang bdud dag ma gtogs so //
analyzed: lha dang mir bcas pa'i skye dgu zhes bya ba ni lha dag gi nang na ni tshangs pa dang bdud dag ma gtogs so //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúall living beings, including gods and humans‚Äù means that gods are excluded except for BrahmƒÅ and MƒÅra,

original: mi dag gi nang na ni dge sbyong dang bram ze ma gtogs so //
analyzed: mi dag gi nang na ni dge sbyong dang bram ze ma gtogs so //
translated: and humans are excluded except for ascetics and brahmins.

original: grol ba ni 'ching ba gsum gyi dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: grol ba ni 'ching ba gsum gyi dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: Liberation is in terms of the three bonds.

original: nges par 'byung ba ni 'dun pa'i 'dod chags 'dul ba dang / spong ba dang / yang dag par 'da' ba zhes bya ba la 'dul ba ni mtshan nyid so so yang dag par rig pa dang / mos pa yid la byed pa gnyis kyis so //
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba ni 'dun pa'i 'dod chags 'dul ba dang / spong ba dang / yang dag par 'da' ba zhes bya ba la 'dul ba ni mtshan nyid so so yang dag par rig pa dang / mos pa yid la byed pa gnyis kyis so //
translated: Renunciation is in terms of subduing, abandoning, and transcending the desire for sensual pleasure. Subduing is by means of the two mental attentions of the discernment of the characteristics of things and of aspiration.

original: spong ba ni rab tu dben pa dang ldan pa la sogs pas so //
analyzed: spong ba ni rab tu dben pa dang ldan pa la sogs pas so //
translated: Abandoning is by means of the mental attentions of isolation, etc.

original: yang dag par 'da' ba ni sbyor ba mthar phyin pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: yang dag par 'da' ba ni sbyor ba mthar phyin pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: Transcending is the result of the culmination of practice.

original: rnam par mi ldan pa ni kun tu sbyor ba dgu dang rnam par bral ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par mi ldan pa ni kun tu sbyor ba dgu dang rnam par bral ba'o //
translated: Non-possession is freedom from the nine fetters.

original: rab tu rnam par grol ba ni skye ba dang rga ba la sogs pa las so //
analyzed: rab tu rnam par grol ba ni skye ba dang rga ba la sogs pa las so //
translated: Complete liberation is from birth, aging, etc.

original: phyin ci log dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam gyis so //
analyzed: phyin ci log dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam gyis so //
translated: The phrase free from error refers to the path of seeing.

original: mang du zhes bya ba ni bsgom pa'i lam gyis lan du byas pa'o //
analyzed: mang du zhes bya ba ni bsgom pa'i lam gyis lan du byas pa'o //
translated: The phrase in great measure refers to the path of meditation.

original: skye bo mang po la phan pa dang bde ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la phan pa zhes bya ba ni dge ba spyod pa'o //
analyzed: skye bo mang po la phan pa dang bde ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la phan pa zhes bya ba ni dge ba spyod pa'o //
translated: The phrase for the benefit and welfare of many people means that benefit refers to the practice of virtue.

original: bde ba ni gnod pa med pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba ni gnod pa med pa'o //
translated: Welfare refers to the absence of injury.

original: snying brtse ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: snying brtse ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Compassion is the desire to benefit others.

original: kha cig dge ba dang gnod pa med pa'i spyod pas gzhan la snying brtse ba'o //
analyzed: kha cig dge ba dang gnod pa med pa'i spyod pas gzhan la snying brtse ba'o //
translated: It is the desire to cause others to practice virtue and to avoid injury.

original: don ni don du gnyer ba dang ldan pa ste /üîΩ'dod pa dang kha na ma tho ba med pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: don ni don du gnyer ba dang ldan pa ste /üîΩ'dod pa dang kha na ma tho ba med pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The word purpose refers to the desire to benefit others.üîΩIt is the desire to cause others to practice virtue and to avoid injury.

original: phan pa dang bde ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rgyal rigs la sogs pa mi gang dag dge ba dang gnod pa med pa'i spyod pa la 'jug pa mang po phal cher la sangs rgyas 'byung ba dang / legs par gsungs pa'i chos dang / dge 'dun legs par bsgrubs pas phan pa dang bde ba yin pa de dag bdag nyid la phan pa dang bde ba mang po byas nas 'jig rten la snying brtse bar byed de /üîΩde dag 'di snyam @32b du ji ltar na gzhan dag la phan pa dang bde bas yang dag par rab tu sbyor bar 'gyur snyam du sems la /
analyzed: phan pa dang bde ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rgyal rigs la sogs pa mi gang dag dge ba dang gnod pa med pa'i spyod pa la 'jug pa mang po phal cher la sangs rgyas 'byung ba dang / legs par gsungs pa'i chos dang / dge 'dun legs par bsgrubs pas phan pa dang bde ba yin pa de dag bdag nyid la phan pa dang bde ba mang po byas nas 'jig rten la snying brtse bar byed de / de dag 'di snyam @32b du ji ltar na gzhan dag la phan pa dang bde bas yang dag par rab tu sbyor bar 'gyur snyam du sems la /
translated: Having done much for their own benefit and happiness, they have compassion for the world.üîΩThey think, How can we truly engage in benefiting and making others happy?

original: gzhan dag kyang 'di snyam du ji ltar na bdag cag la phan pa byed snyam du sems par 'gyur ba ste de'i phyir don dang phan pa dang bde ba'i phyir zhes bstan to //
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang 'di snyam du ji ltar na bdag cag la phan pa byed snyam du sems par 'gyur ba ste de'i phyir don dang phan pa dang bde ba'i phyir zhes bstan to //
translated: Others think, How can they benefit us? Therefore, it is taught for the sake of benefit, welfare, and happiness.

original: lha dang mi rnams la zhes bya ba ni de dag don kun shes pa dang bsgrub par nus pa'o //
analyzed: lha dang mi rnams la zhes bya ba ni de dag don kun shes pa dang bsgrub par nus pa'o //
translated: Gods and humans refers to those who are capable of understanding and accomplishing the meaning.

original: rdzas ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga dang / pha dang ma dang bu la sogs pa yongs su bzung ba'i rdzas bdun no //
analyzed: rdzas ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga dang / pha dang ma dang bu la sogs pa yongs su bzung ba'i rdzas bdun no //
translated: Substantiality refers to the five appropriated aggregates and the seven substances that are held, such as father, mother, son, and so on.

original: bye brag du ma bshad na ni 'dun pa'i 'dod chags kyang nye bar len pa yin no //
analyzed: bye brag du ma bshad na ni 'dun pa'i 'dod chags kyang nye bar len pa yin no //
translated: If one does not explain the distinctions, then desire for craving is also appropriation.

original: bye brag tu bshad na ni nye bar len pa bzhi yin no //
analyzed: bye brag tu bshad na ni nye bar len pa bzhi yin no //
translated: If one explains the distinctions, then there are four appropriations.

original: sems kyi rten ni rnam par shes pa gnas pa bzhi yin no //
analyzed: sems kyi rten ni rnam par shes pa gnas pa bzhi yin no //
translated: The basis of mind refers to the four abodes of consciousness.

original: mngon par zhen pa ni nyon mongs pa gang dag gis phung po 'dzin pa de dag gis kun nas dkris pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa ni nyon mongs pa gang dag gis phung po 'dzin pa de dag gis kun nas dkris pa'o //
translated: Clinging refers to the entanglements by those afflictions that grasp the aggregates.

original: de'i phyogs kyi gnas ngan len ni bag la nyal zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyogs kyi gnas ngan len ni bag la nyal zhes bya ste /
translated: The negative reflex actions of that are called latent impulses.

original: de ltar na de dag ni rdzas dang nye bar len pa dang / sems kyi rten dang mngon par zhen pa dang / bag la nyal ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar na de dag ni rdzas dang nye bar len pa dang / sems kyi rten dang mngon par zhen pa dang / bag la nyal ba'o //
translated: Thus, they are substantiality, appropriation, the basis of mind, clinging, and latent impulses.

original: rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa'i lus 'di dang phyi'i rgyud thams cad la zhes bya ba ni ngar 'dzin pa dang / bdag tu 'dzin pa dang / nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal du ma mngon par zhen pa'i bag la nyal rnams kyi gzhi dang dmigs pa'i rgyu dag pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa'i lus 'di dang phyi'i rgyud thams cad la zhes bya ba ni ngar 'dzin pa dang / bdag tu 'dzin pa dang / nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal du ma mngon par zhen pa'i bag la nyal rnams kyi gzhi dang dmigs pa'i rgyu dag pa ste /
translated: The phrase in this body with consciousness and in all external continua refers to the ground and objective support of the latent propensities for the manifest clinging to I, mine, and the pride that thinks I am.

original: de la ngar 'dzin pa dang bdag tu 'dzin pa dag ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'o //
analyzed: de la ngar 'dzin pa dang bdag tu 'dzin pa dag ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'o //
translated: Clinging to I and mine is the view of the transitory collection.

original: nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal ni de dag nyid do //
analyzed: nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal ni de dag nyid do //
translated: The pride that thinks I am is just those two.

original: de dag gis kun nas dkris pa ni mngon par zhen pa'o //üîΩgnas ngan len ni bag la nyal lo //
analyzed: de dag gis kun nas dkris pa ni mngon par zhen pa'o // gnas ngan len ni bag la nyal lo //
translated: The entanglements by those two are the manifest clinging.üîΩ The negative reflex actions are the latent propensities.

original: de la rab tu mngon par zhen pa ni phyi pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: de la rab tu mngon par zhen pa ni phyi pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: The manifest clinging is that of the non-Buddhists.

original: bag la nyal ni gnyis ka'i'o //
analyzed: bag la nyal ni gnyis ka'i'o //
translated: The latent propensities are those of both.üîΩ The summary verse:

original: sdom ni / de bzhin gshegs dang mi rtag pa'i //
analyzed: sdom ni / de bzhin gshegs dang mi rtag pa'i //
translated: The Tathagata, impermanence,

original: 'du shes gsum 'jigs 'dus ma byas //
analyzed: 'du shes gsum 'jigs 'dus ma byas //
translated: three perceptions, fear, unconditioned,

original: bdag tu ma gyur mtshams sbyor med //
analyzed: bdag tu ma gyur mtshams sbyor med //
translated: not becoming, not linking,

original: stong nyid mi rtag ma lus spong //
analyzed: stong nyid mi rtag ma lus spong //
translated: emptiness, impermanence, abandoning all.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya ba ni ji ltar mdo las rnam par phye ba bzhin te ;
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya ba ni ji ltar mdo las rnam par phye ba bzhin te ;
translated: The expression ‚ÄúTathƒÅgata, Arhat, Perfectly Enlightened One‚Äù is as explained in the sutra.

original: dgra bcom pa zhes bya ba ni mchod par 'os pa'o //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa zhes bya ba ni mchod par 'os pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúArhat‚Äù means ‚Äúworthy of offerings.‚Äù

original: rig pa dang zhabs su ldan pa zhes bya ba la rig pa ni gsum mo //
analyzed: rig pa dang zhabs su ldan pa zhes bya ba la rig pa ni gsum mo //
translated: ‚ÄúEndowed with knowledge and good conduct‚Äù means endowed with the three knowledges.

original: zhabs ni spyod pa dang bzog  pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / lhag pa'i sems las byung ba bzhi po mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa'o //
analyzed: zhabs ni spyod pa dang bzog  pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / lhag pa'i sems las byung ba bzhi po mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúGood conduct‚Äù means the perfection of conduct and the four excellent mental states, which are the bases of happiness in this life.

original: dang po ni rgyu pa'i zhabs so //üîΩtha @33a * //
analyzed: dang po ni rgyu pa'i zhabs so // tha @33a * //
translated: The first is the conduct of the path.

original: ma ni gnas pa'i zhabs te /
analyzed: ma ni gnas pa'i zhabs te /
translated: The last is the conduct of the basis.

original: de la sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi kun tu spyod pa yongs su dag pa dang / 'tsho ba yongs su dag pa ni spyod pa'o //
analyzed: de la sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi kun tu spyod pa yongs su dag pa dang / 'tsho ba yongs su dag pa ni spyod pa'o //
translated: Among these, the purity of body, speech, and mind and the purity of livelihood are conduct.

original: dbang po'i sgo bsrungs pa ni bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po'i sgo bsrungs pa ni bzlog pa'o //
translated: The guarding of the sense doors is restraint.

original: de gnyis ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i srung ba med pa gsum dang bsnyel ba med pa'i chos yin no //
analyzed: de gnyis ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i srung ba med pa gsum dang bsnyel ba med pa'i chos yin no //
translated: These two are the three kinds of fearlessness and the absence of forgetfulness of the TathƒÅgata.

original: bsam gtan dag gis spyod pa drag po bkag pa'i phyir 'jig rten la nyes pa mi spyod pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan dag gis spyod pa drag po bkag pa'i phyir 'jig rten la nyes pa mi spyod pa'o //
translated: By means of the meditative concentrations, he stops the violence of his conduct, and so he does not commit any faults in the world.

original: bde bar gshegs pa ni yun ring po nas rnam pa thams cad du bdag dang gzhan la phan par dgyes pa'o //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa ni yun ring po nas rnam pa thams cad du bdag dang gzhan la phan par dgyes pa'o //
translated: The Sugata is one who is pleased for a long time with every aspect of benefiting himself and others.

original: 'jig rten mkhyen pa ni sems can dang snod kyi 'jig rten gyi rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten mkhyen pa ni sems can dang snod kyi 'jig rten gyi rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa ste /
translated: The Knower of the World is one who knows every aspect of the world of sentient beings and the inanimate world.

original: de la sems can ni sngon dang phyi ma'i mtha' las brtsams te /
analyzed: de la sems can ni sngon dang phyi ma'i mtha' las brtsams te /
translated: In this regard, the world of sentient beings is known in terms of the past and future,

analyzed: sngon gyi gnas dang / 'chi 'pho dang / skye ba mkhyen pa'o //
translated: and in terms of the knowledge of past abodes, of death and rebirth, and of the exhaustion of the contaminants.

original: dus thams cad las brtsams te spyod pa brgyad khri bzhi stong la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: dus thams cad las brtsams te spyod pa brgyad khri bzhi stong la 'jug pa'o //
translated: In terms of all times, he engages in the eighty-four thousand kinds of conduct.

original: snod kyi 'jig rten ni shar phyogs la sogs pa phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten 'jig pa dang 'chags pa mtha' dag mkhyen pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i chos rnams kyi rang bzhin dang / gleng gzhi dang / sred pa dang / nyes dmigs dang / nges par 'byung ba dang /
analyzed: snod kyi 'jig rten ni shar phyogs la sogs pa phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten 'jig pa dang 'chags pa mtha' dag mkhyen pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i chos rnams kyi rang bzhin dang / gleng gzhi dang / sred pa dang / nyes dmigs dang / nges par 'byung ba dang /
translated: The world of beings is the knowledge of the nature of worldly dharmas, their origin, their cessation, and the path to their cessation.

original: 'gro ba'i lam yang mkhyen pa'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i lam yang mkhyen pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of the paths is the knowledge of the paths of the three vehicles.üîΩUnsurpassed is the knowledge of what is superior to that.üîΩThe knowledge of the various inclinations is the knowledge of the various inclinations of beings.

original: bla na med pa ni mnyam pa med pa mkhyen pa dang de las ches mchog tu gyur pa med pa dang mthong ba'i chos la mnyam pa med pa'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa ni mnyam pa med pa mkhyen pa dang de las ches mchog tu gyur pa med pa dang mthong ba'i chos la mnyam pa med pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of the various elements is the knowledge of the various elements of beings.üîΩThe knowledge of the faculties is the knowledge of the various faculties of beings.

original: skyes bu 'dul ba'i kha lo sgyur ba ni 'di skyes bu yang yin la gdul bar bya ba'i skyes bu rnams kyang phal cher 'dul bar byed pa'o //üîΩkha lo sgyur ba zhes bya ba ni mchog dang gtso bo'o //
