original: sangs rgyas ni bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa ste bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas ni bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa ste bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'o //
translated: The Buddha is the one who has abandoned the afflictions together with their traces, who has fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: bcom ldan 'das ni byang chub kyi snying por sdig pa can gyi chos dang / bdud kyi g-yul gyi stobs thams cad bcom pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni byang chub kyi snying por sdig pa can gyi chos dang / bdud kyi g-yul gyi stobs thams cad bcom pa'o //
translated: The Blessed One is the one who, at the site of awakening, has conquered all the forces of evil and the forces of MƒÅra.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba ni mdor bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba ni mdor bstan pa'o //
translated: The TathƒÅgata is the one who has gone thus, who has come thus.

original: 'di ltar dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol ba'o //
translated: The one who is called a worthy one, a perfectly awakened Buddha, is the one who is liberated from the obscurations of the afflictions and the obscurations of the knowable.

original: de yang thun mong dang thun mong ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: de yang thun mong dang thun mong ma yin pa ste /
translated: Moreover, he is the one who is both common and uncommon.

original: @33b re zhig de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya ba 'dis ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol ba thun mong ba bstan to //
analyzed: @33b re zhig de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya ba 'dis ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol ba thun mong ba bstan to //
translated: The phrase the Tathagata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One indicates the common liberation from the obscurations of the afflictions and the knowable.

original: rig pa dang zhabs su ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni thun mong ma yin pa bstan to //
analyzed: rig pa dang zhabs su ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni thun mong ma yin pa bstan to //
translated: The phrase endowed with knowledge and good conduct and so forth indicates the uncommon qualities.

original: mdo las mi rtag pa'i 'du shes bsgom pa zhes bya ba ni kun tu bsten pa dang / goms par byas pas sangs rgyas par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: mdo las mi rtag pa'i 'du shes bsgom pa zhes bya ba ni kun tu bsten pa dang / goms par byas pas sangs rgyas par 'byung ba'o //
translated: The sutra states, The cultivation of the perception of impermanence, when practiced and cultivated, leads to the attainment of nirvana.

original: bsgom pa'i 'bras bu ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i 'bras bu ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba'o //
translated: The result of cultivation is the abandonment of attachment to the desire realm, and so forth.

original: bsgom pa'i rnam pa ni dpe'i dbye ba dag gis so //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i rnam pa ni dpe'i dbye ba dag gis so //
translated: The aspects of cultivation are the various examples.

original: bsgom pa'i thabs ni dgon par song ste zhes bya ba'am rgyas par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i thabs ni dgon par song ste zhes bya ba'am rgyas par 'byung ba'o //
translated: The means of cultivation is to go to a secluded place, and so forth.

original: de la kun tu bsten pa ni mtshan nyid so so yang dag par rig pa yid la byed pas so //
analyzed: de la kun tu bsten pa ni mtshan nyid so so yang dag par rig pa yid la byed pas so //
translated: Among these, practice refers to the attention of the knowledge of the characteristics.

original: goms par byas pa ni mos pa yid la byas pas so //
analyzed: goms par byas pa ni mos pa yid la byas pas so //
translated: Cultivation is through attention to interest.

original: lan mang du byas pas ni ma lus pa dag gis so //
analyzed: lan mang du byas pas ni ma lus pa dag gis so //
translated: Repeated practice is through complete practice.

original: yang kun du bsten pa ni shes bya'i dngos po la kun tu gtod pa'o //
analyzed: yang kun du bsten pa ni shes bya'i dngos po la kun tu gtod pa'o //
translated: Again, cultivation is the application to the object of knowledge.

original: goms par byas pa ni rgyun mi 'chad pa dang gus par byas te sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: goms par byas pa ni rgyun mi 'chad pa dang gus par byas te sbyor ba'o //
translated: Repeated practice is uninterrupted and respectful application.

original: lan mang du byas pa ni yun ring po nas 'dris par byas pa'o //üîΩtheg par byas pa ni rten gyi sgo nas so //
analyzed: lan mang du byas pa ni yun ring po nas 'dris par byas pa'o // theg par byas pa ni rten gyi sgo nas so //
translated: Repeated practice is familiarity over a long period of time.üîΩ Application is from the point of view of the basis.

original: dngos por byas pa ni dmigs pa'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: dngos por byas pa ni dmigs pa'i sgo nas so //
translated: Realization is from the point of view of the object.

original: nan tan du byas pa ni yid la byed pa'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: nan tan du byas pa ni yid la byed pa'i sgo nas so //
translated: Practice is from the point of view of attention.

original: yongs su 'dris pa ni ci 'dod pa dang tshegs med par 'thob pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su 'dris pa ni ci 'dod pa dang tshegs med par 'thob pa'o //
translated: Familiarity is the attainment of what is desired without difficulty.

original: legs par mthar phyin pa ni chos mnyan pa'o //
analyzed: legs par mthar phyin pa ni chos mnyan pa'o //
translated: Completion is the listening to the Dharma.

original: legs par brtsams pa ni nang du tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: legs par brtsams pa ni nang du tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'o //
translated: Beginning is the proper attention to the inner.

original: yang legs par mthar phyin pa ni gus par yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: yang legs par mthar phyin pa ni gus par yid la byed pa'o //
translated: Again, completion is respectful attention.

original: legs par brtsams pa ni rgyun mi 'chad par yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: legs par brtsams pa ni rgyun mi 'chad par yid la byed pa'o //
translated: Properly undertaken means to attend to it uninterruptedly.

original: yang legs par rdzogs pa ni mthar phyin par 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: yang legs par rdzogs pa ni mthar phyin par 'gro ba'o //
translated: Properly completed means to reach the end.

original: legs par brtsams pa ni yang dag par sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: legs par brtsams pa ni yang dag par sbyor ba'o //
translated: Properly undertaken means to apply oneself correctly.

original: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyi rjes su mthun pa'i phyir rgod pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyi rjes su mthun pa'i phyir rgod pa bstan to //
translated: Excitement is taught because it is conducive to attachment to sense objects.

original: gzugs kyi 'dod chags kyi rjes su mthun pa'i phyir nga rgyal bstan to //
analyzed: gzugs kyi 'dod chags kyi rjes su mthun pa'i phyir nga rgyal bstan to //
translated: Pride is taught because it is conducive to attachment to the form realm.

original: gzugs med pa'i 'dod chags kyi rjes su mthun pa'i phyir ma rig pa bstan to //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i 'dod chags kyi rjes su mthun pa'i phyir ma rig pa bstan to //
translated: Ignorance is taught because it is conducive to attachment to the formless realm.

original: rtsa ba'i 'ching ba gcod pa ni bag la nyal yang dag par 'joms pa'o //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i 'ching ba gcod pa ni bag la nyal yang dag par 'joms pa'o //
translated: Cutting the root fetters means to destroy the latent tendencies.

original: rtse mo yang dag par g-yo bar byed pa ni sa 'og ma'i dge ba'i chos spong ba'o //üîΩrtsva dag sel ba ni mi rtag par 'du @34a * //
analyzed: rtse mo yang dag par g-yo bar byed pa ni sa 'og ma'i dge ba'i chos spong ba'o // rtsva dag sel ba ni mi rtag par 'du @34a * //
translated: Shaking the peak means to abandon the wholesome dharmas of the lower stage.

original: shes pa la dmigs pa la mi rtag pa'i 'du shes su yang dag par ston pa ste /
analyzed: shes pa la dmigs pa la mi rtag pa'i 'du shes su yang dag par ston pa ste /
translated: Removing the grass means to teach the perception of impermanence in the perception of impermanence.

original: rang gi yid la byed byed pa la mi rtag par yongs su rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi yid la byed byed pa la mi rtag par yongs su rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the discernment of impermanence that is cultivated in the mind.

original: brtsegs pa ni rnam par grol ba'i rgyu dang lhan cig pa'i mi rtag par 'du shes pa'o //
analyzed: brtsegs pa ni rnam par grol ba'i rgyu dang lhan cig pa'i mi rtag par 'du shes pa'o //
translated: The mountain peak is the discernment of impermanence that is the cause of liberation and is simultaneous with it.

original: phyi ma dgu po dag ni de'i rgyur gyur pa rnams so //
analyzed: phyi ma dgu po dag ni de'i rgyur gyur pa rnams so //
translated: The latter nine are the causes of that.

original: glang po che'i rjes ni mi sdug pa la sogs pa'i 'du shes rnams kyi nang na dmigs pa rgya chen po'i ngo bos mchog tu gyur pa'o //
analyzed: glang po che'i rjes ni mi sdug pa la sogs pa'i 'du shes rnams kyi nang na dmigs pa rgya chen po'i ngo bos mchog tu gyur pa'o //
translated: The elephant's footprint is the supreme among the perceptions of foulness, etc., because of the nature of its vast objective mental domain.

original: 'bab pa ni rnam par grol ba'i rgyu dang lhan cig pa'i mi rtag par 'du shes pa rnams mya ngan las 'das par 'bab pa'o //
analyzed: 'bab pa ni rnam par grol ba'i rgyu dang lhan cig pa'i mi rtag par 'du shes pa rnams mya ngan las 'das par 'bab pa'o //
translated: The river is the discernment of impermanence that is the cause of liberation and is simultaneous with it, flowing to nirvana.

original: nyi ma shar ba ni ma rig pa'i mun pa'i gnyen po'o //
analyzed: nyi ma shar ba ni ma rig pa'i mun pa'i gnyen po'o //
translated: The rising sun is the antidote to the darkness of ignorance.

original: 'khor los sgyur ba lta bu ni mi bslab pa'i mi rtag par 'du shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba lta bu ni mi bslab pa'i mi rtag par 'du shes pa'o //
translated: The universal monarch is the impermanence discernment of one who is not a trainee.

original: khams kyi rgyal phran lta bu ni de las gzhan pa rnams so //
analyzed: khams kyi rgyal phran lta bu ni de las gzhan pa rnams so //
translated: The minor kings are the others.

original: dgon pa dang / shing drung dang / khang stong dag gi bla gab med pa dang / shing drung dang / sgrib g-yogs smos pa ni gnas mal thams cad bsdus te rab tu dbye ba ni de lta bu'o //
analyzed: dgon pa dang / shing drung dang / khang stong dag gi bla gab med pa dang / shing drung dang / sgrib g-yogs smos pa ni gnas mal thams cad bsdus te rab tu dbye ba ni de lta bu'o //
translated: The foot of a tree and the open air are mentioned in order to include all kinds of bedding. This is the classification of the four kinds of bedding.

original: gzugs mi rtag pa nyid dam zhes bya ba ni gzugs tsam yin gyi bdag ni med do zhes de ltar yang dag par rab tu sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs mi rtag pa nyid dam zhes bya ba ni gzugs tsam yin gyi bdag ni med do zhes de ltar yang dag par rab tu sbyor ba'o //
translated: The phrase, impermanence of form, means that one should apply oneself correctly to the idea that form alone is impermanent, and that the self does not exist.

original: lam du 'gro ba la bar chad byed pa bzhi ni lam rnam pa gnyis la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: lam du 'gro ba la bar chad byed pa bzhi ni lam rnam pa gnyis la sogs pa ste /
translated: The four obstacles to the path of the one who is traveling are the two kinds of paths, etc.

original: de la the tshom gyis ni 'gro bar mi rtsol ba nyid do //
analyzed: de la the tshom gyis ni 'gro bar mi rtsol ba nyid do //
translated: Doubt is the obstacle to the path of setting out, because one does not make an effort to set out.

original: rnam par rtog pa dag dang log pa'i yan lag gis ni brtsal kyang rnam par rtog pa dang lta ba spyod pa dag gzhan du 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dag dang log pa'i yan lag gis ni brtsal kyang rnam par rtog pa dang lta ba spyod pa dag gzhan du 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Conceptual differentiation and false views are the obstacles to the path of setting out, because one who has set out on the path, even though he makes an effort, goes astray due to conceptual differentiation and false views.

original: de dag med kyang gdams ngag rjes su bstan pa la mi bzod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag med kyang gdams ngag rjes su bstan pa la mi bzod par 'gyur te /
translated: Even though one has set out on the path, one becomes impatient with the instructions and teachings.

original: khro ba ni gzhan dag smra ba la 'khrug pa'o //
analyzed: khro ba ni gzhan dag smra ba la 'khrug pa'o //
translated: Anger is the obstacle to the path of the one who has set out, because one is agitated by the teachings of others.

original: rab tu byung ba la yang rang dbang med pa dang gzhan la rag lus pa dang / mi bzad pa dang ngan pa'i spyod pa dag gis dga' ba ma yin pa dag dang 'dris pa ste /
analyzed: rab tu byung ba la yang rang dbang med pa dang gzhan la rag lus pa dang / mi bzad pa dang ngan pa'i spyod pa dag gis dga' ba ma yin pa dag dang 'dris pa ste /
translated: The life of a householder is also not conducive to the religious life because of lack of independence, dependence on others, and the difficulty of avoiding the unwholesome.

original: gnod pa'i dngos po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnod pa'i dngos po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are the basis of harm.

original: de gnyis ni g-yang sa yin te /
analyzed: de gnyis ni g-yang sa yin te /
translated: These two are like precipices

original: de gnyis kyis kyang 'gro ba la bar chad byed do //
analyzed: de gnyis kyis kyang 'gro ba la bar chad byed do //
translated: because they are obstacles to the progress of beings.

original: de dag med kyang rnyed pa dang bkur sti'i nags khrod du zhugs pa'i phyir bar chad byed pa ni mi bzod pa'i thibs po'i nang du zhugs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de dag med kyang rnyed pa dang bkur sti'i nags khrod du zhugs pa'i phyir bar chad byed pa ni mi bzod pa'i thibs po'i nang du zhugs pa'i phyir te /
translated: Even when they are not present, the life of a householder is an obstacle because it is an entry into the thick forest of gain and honor.

original: 'di ltar yongs su bzung ba btang yang spang bar mi nus pa'o //üîΩ'jigs pa dang bcas pa ni chom rkun dang g-yo sgyu can gyi 'jigs pa yod pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar yongs su bzung ba btang yang spang bar mi nus pa'o // 'jigs pa dang bcas pa ni chom rkun dang g-yo sgyu can gyi 'jigs pa yod pa'o //
translated: Even when one has given up possessions, one is still unable to give up the forest of gain and honor.üîΩIt is dangerous because of the danger of thieves and rogues.

original: mi mngon pa'i 'jigs pa dang bcas pa ni nye @34b 'khor thibs po yin pa dang gcan gzan dang mi ma yin pa'i 'jigs pa yod pa'o //
analyzed: mi mngon pa'i 'jigs pa dang bcas pa ni nye @34b 'khor thibs po yin pa dang gcan gzan dang mi ma yin pa'i 'jigs pa yod pa'o //
translated: It is full of hidden dangers because of the danger of thickets, wild beasts, and nonhuman beings.

original: tsher ma dang bcas pa ni thams cad nas tsher mas gang ba'o //
analyzed: tsher ma dang bcas pa ni thams cad nas tsher mas gang ba'o //
translated: The thorny path is one that is completely covered with thorns.

original: lam gol ba ni gzhan du 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: lam gol ba ni gzhan du 'gro ba'o //
translated: The wrong path is one that leads elsewhere.

original: lam ngan pa ni mi mnyam pa ste /
analyzed: lam ngan pa ni mi mnyam pa ste /
translated: The bad path is an uneven path.

original: de ltar na lnga po de dag ni lam gyi skyon yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na lnga po de dag ni lam gyi skyon yin no //
translated: These are the five faults of the path.

original: 'gro ba ngan pa sdang ba'i 'gro ba ni 'gro ba'i skyon no //
analyzed: 'gro ba ngan pa sdang ba'i 'gro ba ni 'gro ba'i skyon no //
translated: The bad destination is the destination of the wicked.

original: lam gol ba dang lam ngan par 'gro ba ni skyes bu dam pa ma yin pa kun tu bsten pa'i phyir 'gro ba po'i gang zag gi nyes pa ste /
analyzed: lam gol ba dang lam ngan par 'gro ba ni skyes bu dam pa ma yin pa kun tu bsten pa'i phyir 'gro ba po'i gang zag gi nyes pa ste /
translated: The wrong path and the bad path are faults of the person who travels on them, because he associates with bad people.

original: chom rkun pa la sogs pa skyes bu dam pa ma yin pa dag kun tu bsten pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chom rkun pa la sogs pa skyes bu dam pa ma yin pa dag kun tu bsten pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He associates with bad people such as thieves, etc.

original: mi g-yo ba ni mtshan ma thams cad dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba ni mtshan ma thams cad dang bral ba'o //
translated: The unmoving path is free from all signs.

original: mtha' yas pa ni sred pa zad pa dang yul gyis yongs su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtha' yas pa ni sred pa zad pa dang yul gyis yongs su 'gyur ro //
translated: The endless path is the end of craving and the end of objects.

original: mthong bar dka' ba ni zab pa'o //
analyzed: mthong bar dka' ba ni zab pa'o //
translated: The difficult to see path is the profound path.

original: 'chi ba med pa ni skye ba dang rga ba dang na ba dang 'chi ba yang dag par zad pa'o //
analyzed: 'chi ba med pa ni skye ba dang rga ba dang na ba dang 'chi ba yang dag par zad pa'o //
translated: The immortal path is the complete exhaustion of birth, old age, sickness, and death.

original: bde ba ni mi dang mi ma yin pas gtse ba'i 'jigs pa thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba ni mi dang mi ma yin pas gtse ba'i 'jigs pa thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa'o //
translated: Happiness is the complete transcendence of all fear of harm from humans and non-humans.

original: zhi ba ni sdug bsngal thams cad nye bar zhi ba dang mchog tu bsil bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: zhi ba ni sdug bsngal thams cad nye bar zhi ba dang mchog tu bsil bar gyur pa'o //
translated: Peace is the complete pacification of all suffering and the highest coolness.

original: dngos po bzang po ni mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas par bya ba'i phyir dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos po bzang po ni mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas par bya ba'i phyir dmigs pa yin no //
translated: The good thing is the objective support for abiding in happiness in this life.

original: bde legs su 'gyur ba ni nyon mongs pa thams cad spang bar bya ba'i dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: bde legs su 'gyur ba ni nyon mongs pa thams cad spang bar bya ba'i dmigs pa'o //
translated: Well-being is the objective support for the abandonment of all afflictions.

original: mya ngan med pa ni dga' ba dang mi dga' ba las yang dag par 'das pa dang thob pa chud mi za ba'o //
analyzed: mya ngan med pa ni dga' ba dang mi dga' ba las yang dag par 'das pa dang thob pa chud mi za ba'o //
translated: The absence of sorrow is the transcendence of joy and sorrow and the non-wastage of what has been attained.

original: 'chi 'pho med pa ni rtag pa dang phyir mi ldog pa'o //
analyzed: 'chi 'pho med pa ni rtag pa dang phyir mi ldog pa'o //
translated: The absence of death is permanence and irreversibility.

original: rims nad med pa ni rnam par byang ba'o //
analyzed: rims nad med pa ni rnam par byang ba'o //
translated: The absence of disease is purification.

original: yongs su gdung ba med pa ni 'dod pas phongs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su gdung ba med pa ni 'dod pas phongs pa med pa'o //
translated: The absence of torment is the absence of deprivation in regard to what is desired.

original: nad med pa ni nad dang 'bras thams cad rnam par zhi ba'o //
analyzed: nad med pa ni nad dang 'bras thams cad rnam par zhi ba'o //
translated: The absence of sickness is the complete pacification of all illness and tumors.

original: mi g-yo ba ni g-yo ba dang rlom pa thams cad zad pa'o //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba ni g-yo ba dang rlom pa thams cad zad pa'o //
translated: Immovability is the exhaustion of all movement and conceit.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ni phung po thams cad bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ni phung po thams cad bzlog pa'o //
translated: Nirvana is the reversal of all the aggregates.

original: bdag tu ma gyur cig / bdag gir ma gyur cig ces bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus las brtsams te /
analyzed: bdag tu ma gyur cig / bdag gir ma gyur cig ces bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus las brtsams te /
translated: The statement May I not become! May I not become mine! is in terms of the future.

original: bdag dang bdag gi ngo bor nye bar song ba nang dang phyi'i skye mched kyis bsdus pa bdag gi lus dang yongs su gzung ba'i dngos po mi skye ba don du gnyer ba'o //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gi ngo bor nye bar song ba nang dang phyi'i skye mched kyis bsdus pa bdag gi lus dang yongs su gzung ba'i dngos po mi skye ba don du gnyer ba'o //
translated: The statement May I not become! is the desire that the body and the things grasped, which are included in the internal and external sense bases and which have come into existence as I and mine, not arise.

original: yang lus mi skye ba don du gnyer ba dang / de la brten pa'i tshor ba mi skye ba don du gnyer ba yang yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: yang lus mi skye ba don du gnyer ba dang / de la brten pa'i tshor ba mi skye ba don du gnyer ba yang yongs su bstan to //
translated: The statement May I not become mine! is the desire that the feeling based on that body not arise.

original: bdag tu ma gyur cig bdag gir ma gyur cig ces bya ba ni da ltar byung ba'i dus @35a * //üîΩlas brtsams te /
analyzed: bdag tu ma gyur cig bdag gir ma gyur cig ces bya ba ni da ltar byung ba'i dus @35a * //üîΩlas brtsams te /
translated: The statement May I not become! May I not become mine! is in terms of the present.üîΩThe statement May I not become! is the desire that the body not arise.

original: 'di ni mi rtag pa'i 'gog pa la yongs su rtog pa sngon du 'gro ba so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa la yongs su rtog pa ste sngar legs su smon pa byas nas /
analyzed: 'di ni mi rtag pa'i 'gog pa la yongs su rtog pa sngon du 'gro ba so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa la yongs su rtog pa ste sngar legs su smon pa byas nas /
translated: This is the thorough examination of the cessation of impermanence, which precedes the thorough examination of the cessation of discrimination.

original: phyis da ltar byung ba'i rgyu la mi rtag par yongs su rtog go //
analyzed: phyis da ltar byung ba'i rgyu la mi rtag par yongs su rtog go //
translated: Having previously made a good aspiration, one later thoroughly examines the cause of the present as impermanent.

original: nying mtshams mi sbyor ba ni shi 'phos pa'i rnam par shes pa mi skye ba'o //
analyzed: nying mtshams mi sbyor ba ni shi 'phos pa'i rnam par shes pa mi skye ba'o //
translated: Non-connection is the non-arising of consciousness at death and transmigration.

original: len pa med pa ni mi gnas pa'i rnam par shes pa la ming dang gzugs mi 'jug pa'i phyir lus mi skye ba'o //
analyzed: len pa med pa ni mi gnas pa'i rnam par shes pa la ming dang gzugs mi 'jug pa'i phyir lus mi skye ba'o //
translated: Non-appropriation is the non-arising of the body due to the non-abiding consciousness not engaging in name-and-form.

original: mi skye ba ni ming dang gzugs 'phel ba dang rgyas pa med pa'o //
analyzed: mi skye ba ni ming dang gzugs 'phel ba dang rgyas pa med pa'o //

original: 'dus byas thams cad zhi ba ni phung po lnga zhig pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas thams cad zhi ba ni phung po lnga zhig pa'o //
translated: The peace of all conditioned things is the destruction of the five aggregates.

original: stong pa nyid ni nyon mongs pa thams cad dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni nyon mongs pa thams cad dang bral ba'o //
translated: Emptiness is freedom from all afflictions.

original: mi dmigs pa ni mtshan ma thams cad dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa ni mtshan ma thams cad dang bral ba'o //
translated: Non-apprehension is freedom from all signs.

original: sred pa zad pa ni ma 'ongs pa la don du gnyer ba med pa'o //
analyzed: sred pa zad pa ni ma 'ongs pa la don du gnyer ba med pa'o //
translated: The exhaustion of craving is the absence of striving for the future.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba ni da ltar byung ba'i longs spyod la dga' ba med pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba ni da ltar byung ba'i longs spyod la dga' ba med pa'o //

original: 'gog pa ni de las gzhan pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa'o /
analyzed: 'gog pa ni de las gzhan pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa'o /

analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ni phung po'i lhag ma ma lus pa'o //

original: mi rtag pa ni zhig pa dang 'jig pa'i chos can no //
analyzed: mi rtag pa ni zhig pa dang 'jig pa'i chos can no //

analyzed: 'dus byas ni sngon gyi mtha' las brtsams te rnam par brtags pa gang yin pa'o //

original: bsam pa ni phyi ma'i mtha' las brtsams te don du gnyer ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: bsam pa ni phyi ma'i mtha' las brtsams te don du gnyer ba gang yin pa'o //

analyzed: zad pa'i chos can ni phyogs gcig zad pa'o // 'jig pa'i chos can ni thams cad 'gag pa'o //

original: yang zad pa'i chos can ni thams cad 'gag pa'o //
analyzed: yang zad pa'i chos can ni thams cad 'gag pa'o //

original: 'jig pa'i chos can ni rgyun rnam par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i chos can ni rgyun rnam par 'gyur ba'o //

analyzed: ma lus par spong ba zhes bya ba ni mdor bstan pa'o // phyis spang ba ni kun nas dkris pa spangs pa'o //

original: byang bar gyur pa ni bag la nyal spangs pa'o //
analyzed: byang bar gyur pa ni bag la nyal spangs pa'o //

original: zad pa ni 'das pa las rnam par grol ba'o //
analyzed: zad pa ni 'das pa las rnam par grol ba'o //

analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba ni da ltar byung ba las rnam par grol ba'o //

original: 'gog pa ni ma 'ongs pa las rnam par grol ba'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa ni ma 'ongs pa las rnam par grol ba'o //
translated: The cessation is the liberation from the future.

original: rnam par zhi ba ni mthong ba'i lam gyis so //
analyzed: rnam par zhi ba ni mthong ba'i lam gyis so //

original: nub pa ni bsgom pa'i lam gyis te /
analyzed: nub pa ni bsgom pa'i lam gyis te /
