translated: The four kinds of perversions are the perversions of permanence, pleasure, purity, and self.

original: byis pa 'drid pa ni yang dag pa ji lta ba de bzhin du mi shes pa'i phyir byis pa thos pa dang mi ldan pa rnams la yin te /
analyzed: byis pa 'drid pa ni yang dag pa ji lta ba de bzhin du mi shes pa'i phyir byis pa thos pa dang mi ldan pa rnams la yin te /
translated: The deception of children is for those who are not learned, who do not know the truth as it is.

original: de dag gi yun ring po nas slu ba la lhag par chags pa'i sgo nas rnam par 'gyur ba la skyes pa'i sdug bsngal gyis reg pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gi yun ring po nas slu ba la lhag par chags pa'i sgo nas rnam par 'gyur ba la skyes pa'i sdug bsngal gyis reg pa'o //
translated: They are touched by the suffering of birth, through their excessive attachment to deception over a long period of time.

original: mkhas pa rnams ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa'i phyir de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: mkhas pa rnams ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa'i phyir de lta ma yin no //
translated: The wise, on the other hand, do not have that, because they know the truth as it is.

original: rus pa'i keng rus lta bu ni ngoms mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: rus pa'i keng rus lta bu ni ngoms mi shes pa'o //
translated: The skeleton is like a skeleton, because it is insatiable.

original: sha'i kham tshad lta bu ni mang po dang thun mong ba'o //
analyzed: sha'i kham tshad lta bu ni mang po dang thun mong ba'o //
translated: The morsel of flesh is like a morsel of flesh, because it is shared by many.

original: rtsva'i sgron ma lta bu ni chos ma yin pa spyod pa dang mi mthun par spyod pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: rtsva'i sgron ma lta bu ni chos ma yin pa spyod pa dang mi mthun par spyod pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: The grass torch is like a grass torch, because it is the cause of conduct that is contrary to the practice of the Dharma.

original: me'i dong lta bu ni 'dod pa'i sred pa'i yongs su gdung ba 'phel bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: me'i dong lta bu ni 'dod pa'i sred pa'i yongs su gdung ba 'phel bar byed pa'o //
translated: The pit of embers is like a pit of embers, because it increases the burning of craving for sensual pleasure.

original: sbrul gdug pa lta bu ni mkhas pa rnams kyis spang bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: sbrul gdug pa lta bu ni mkhas pa rnams kyis spang bar bya ba'o //
translated: The poisonous snake is like a poisonous snake, because it is to be avoided by the wise.

original: rmi lam lta bu ni myur du 'jig par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rmi lam lta bu ni myur du 'jig par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Like a dream, it is quickly destroyed.

original: brnyan po'i rgyan lta bu ni rkyen la rag las pa'o //
analyzed: brnyan po'i rgyan lta bu ni rkyen la rag las pa'o //
translated: Like a borrowed ornament, it is dependent on conditions.

original: shing tog lta bu ni bag med pa'i sa'o //
analyzed: shing tog lta bu ni bag med pa'i sa'o //
translated: Like a fruit, it is the abode of carelessness.

original: mi gtsang ba rnams zhes bya ba ni mdor bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mi gtsang ba rnams zhes bya ba ni mdor bstan pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúimpure substances‚Äù is the summary.

original: dri mi zhim pa ni zas dang skom dang longs spyod rnam par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: dri mi zhim pa ni zas dang skom dang longs spyod rnam par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúfoul-smelling‚Äù refers to the transformation of food and drink into enjoyments.

original: de la bshang pa dang gci ba la sogs pa mi gtsang bar yongs su gyur pa ni dri mi zhim pa'o //
analyzed: de la bshang pa dang gci ba la sogs pa mi gtsang bar yongs su gyur pa ni dri mi zhim pa'o //
translated: In this context, the transformation of feces, urine, and so on into impure substances is foul-smelling.

original: dri nga ba ni sha dang khrag la sogs pa yongs su gyur pa'o //
analyzed: dri nga ba ni sha dang khrag la sogs pa yongs su gyur pa'o //
translated: The transformation of flesh, blood, and so on into foul-smelling substances is putrid.

original: mi mthun pa ni 'khrig pa'i longs spyod yongs su gyur na mi mthun pa'o //
analyzed: mi mthun pa ni 'khrig pa'i longs spyod yongs su gyur na mi mthun pa'o //
translated: The transformation of sexual enjoyments into something unpleasant is repulsive.

original: gus par bde bar bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i zang zing @36a * //üîΩyongs su gtang bar bya ba'i phyir bod pa'o //
analyzed: gus par bde bar bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i zang zing @36a * // yongs su gtang bar bya ba'i phyir bod pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúto be respectfully enjoyed‚Äù refers to the enjoyment of worldly material things.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúto be enjoyed with respect‚Äù refers to the enjoyment of the Dharma.

original: rab tu bod par bya ba ni sred pa zad par bya ba'i phyir bod pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu bod par bya ba ni sred pa zad par bya ba'i phyir bod pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúto be enjoyed with great respect‚Äù refers to the enjoyment of the Dharma in order to exhaust craving.

original: 'bras bu 'dod pa dag gis ni gus par bod par bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu 'dod pa dag gis ni gus par bod par bya ba'o //
translated: Those who desire the fruit should honor it.

original: thar pa 'dod pa dag gis ni rab tu bod par bya ba'o //
analyzed: thar pa 'dod pa dag gis ni rab tu bod par bya ba'o //
translated: Those who desire liberation should honor it greatly.

original: thal mo sbyar bar bya ba ni don de nyid de dag gis slong ba'i dus na'o //
analyzed: thal mo sbyar bar bya ba ni don de nyid de dag gis slong ba'i dus na'o //
translated: One should join the palms in reverence when requesting that meaning from them.

original: 'dud par bya ba ni phyag la sogs pa bya bar 'os pa dang tshul khrims dang lta ba mthun par khas blang bar 'os pa'o //
analyzed: 'dud par bya ba ni phyag la sogs pa bya bar 'os pa dang tshul khrims dang lta ba mthun par khas blang bar 'os pa'o //
translated: One should bow to them, as they are worthy of prostrations and so forth, and worthy of being accepted as having the same ethical and philosophical view.

original: 'jig rten gyi bsod nams kyi zhing bla na med pa dang sbyin gnas zhes bya ba ni de la yon phul ba'i 'bras bu gzhal du med pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi bsod nams kyi zhing bla na med pa dang sbyin gnas zhes bya ba ni de la yon phul ba'i 'bras bu gzhal du med pa'o //
translated: The unsurpassed field of merit in the world and the object of generosity means that the result of offering gifts to them is immeasurable.

original: legs par gsungs pa zhes bya ba ni don bzang po dang tshig 'bru bzang po'o //
analyzed: legs par gsungs pa zhes bya ba ni don bzang po dang tshig 'bru bzang po'o //
translated: Well-spoken means good meaning and good words.

original: yang dag par mthong ba ni mthong ba'i chos la rtogs par bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang dag par mthong ba ni mthong ba'i chos la rtogs par bya ba'o //
translated: Correct seeing is to be realized in the present life.

original: rims nad med pa ni nyon mongs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: rims nad med pa ni nyon mongs pa med pa'o //
translated: Free from disease means free from afflictions.

original: dus chad pa med pa ni dus gsum las rnam par grol ba'o //
analyzed: dus chad pa med pa ni dus gsum las rnam par grol ba'o //
translated: Not limited by time means being liberated from the three times.

original: nye bar gtod pa ni rga ba dang na ba dang 'chi ba la sogs pas nye bar mi bkri ba'o //
analyzed: nye bar gtod pa ni rga ba dang na ba dang 'chi ba la sogs pas nye bar mi bkri ba'o //
translated: The unapproachable is that which is not approached by old age, sickness, death, etc.

original: 'di mthong ba la yod pa ni lha la sogs pa'i 'gro ba dag la yang snang ba'o //
analyzed: 'di mthong ba la yod pa ni lha la sogs pa'i 'gro ba dag la yang snang ba'o //
translated: The visible is that which appears in the realms of gods, etc.

original: so so rang gis rig par bya ba ni gzhan la dad pa la sogs pas yang dag par rig par bya ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: so so rang gis rig par bya ba ni gzhan la dad pa la sogs pas yang dag par rig par bya ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: The self-cognized is that which is not cognized by faith in another, etc.

original: mkhas pa dag gis zhes bya ba ni slob pa dang mi slob pa dag gis so //
analyzed: mkhas pa dag gis zhes bya ba ni slob pa dang mi slob pa dag gis so //
translated: The cognized by the wise is that which is cognized by the learners and the adepts.

original: gnas dang gling dang / mgon dang / skyabs dang / dpung gnyen zhes bya ba ni phyi ma phyi ma bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: gnas dang gling dang / mgon dang / skyabs dang / dpung gnyen zhes bya ba ni phyi ma phyi ma bshad pa yin te /
translated: The refuge, island, protector, shelter, and steadfast friend are the successive explanations.

original: de dag gi nges par byung bar bya ba'i phyir yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: de dag gi nges par byung bar bya ba'i phyir yongs su bstan to //
translated: They are taught for the purpose of emancipation from those.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi shes nas yang dag pa'i lta ba dus thams cad du skye'o zhes skabs dbye bar mdzad pa ni 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa'i slob pa rnams kyi skyes pa dang skye bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi shes nas yang dag pa'i lta ba dus thams cad du skye'o zhes skabs dbye bar mdzad pa ni 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa'i slob pa rnams kyi skyes pa dang skye bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The Buddha has opened the way for the arising of right view at all times, having understood the four noble truths. This refers to the arising of right view in the past, present, and future of those in training.

original: da ltar skyes pa ni gang dag gis da ltar gyi dus su thob pa dang / bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: da ltar skyes pa ni gang dag gis da ltar gyi dus su thob pa dang / bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The present arising of right view refers to those who have attained it in the present time and will perfect the cultivation of it.

original: dus phyis skyed par byed pa ni gang dag gis ma thob pa la rab tu brtson pa rnams so //
analyzed: dus phyis skyed par byed pa ni gang dag gis ma thob pa la rab tu brtson pa rnams so //
translated: The future arising of right view refers to those who have not attained it but are striving for it.

original: kun tu bsten par bya /
analyzed: kun tu bsten par bya /
translated: One should cultivate it,

original: goms par bya lan mang du bya zhes bya ba ni ci rigs par snga ma bzhin no //üîΩmthun par bsrung bar bya ba ni yongs su nyams par 'gyur pa ni chos rnam par spang pa'o //
analyzed: goms par bya lan mang du bya zhes bya ba ni ci rigs par snga ma bzhin no // mthun par bsrung bar bya ba ni yongs su nyams par 'gyur pa ni chos rnam par spang pa'o //
translated: practice it, and increase it refers to the past, present, and future as appropriate.üîΩThe protection of what is favorable refers to the non-abandonment of the favorable.

original: reg par bya ba ni khyad par can gyi cha dang mthun pa'i chos bsten pa'am /
analyzed: reg par bya ba ni khyad par can gyi cha dang mthun pa'i chos bsten pa'am /
translated: The protection of what is to be directly experienced refers to the cultivation of the factors conducive to penetrative insight,

original: lus kyis reg par bya ba'o //
analyzed: lus kyis reg par bya ba'o //
translated: or the direct experience of the body.

original: @36b 'bras bu'am /üîΩshes pa phyi ma'am /
analyzed: @36b 'bras bu'am / shes pa phyi ma'am /
translated: or in terms of the result,üîΩor in terms of the subsequent cognition,

original: rtogs pa'i sgo nas ni mngon sum du bya ba'o //üîΩdus su gtam zhes bya ba ni pha rol po stan dma' ba la 'dug pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas nyan pa dang 'dod pa dang nyan par 'os par shes shing 'di ni sngar gtam bya ba'i dus yin no //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i sgo nas ni mngon sum du bya ba'o // dus su gtam zhes bya ba ni pha rol po stan dma' ba la 'dug pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas nyan pa dang 'dod pa dang nyan par 'os par shes shing 'di ni sngar gtam bya ba'i dus yin no //
translated: or in terms of the realization.

original: 'di ni yang dag par 'phags pa'i dus yin no zhes bya bar shes nas gtam bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni yang dag par 'phags pa'i dus yin no zhes bya bar shes nas gtam bya ba'o //
translated: The expression at the proper time means that one should speak when one knows that the other person is ready to listen, is interested, and is a fit vessel for listening, and when one knows that this is the time to speak first, and this is the time to speak in reply.

original: gus par byas te zhes bya ba ni ci nus par bdag nyid thams cad kyi chos ston pa ste /
analyzed: gus par byas te zhes bya ba ni ci nus par bdag nyid thams cad kyi chos ston pa ste /
translated: The expression respectfully means that one teaches the Dharma with one's whole being, to the best of one's ability.

original: rnam grangs de dang de dag gis mi 'khrug cing don rab tu bstan par 'dod kyi /
analyzed: rnam grangs de dang de dag gis mi 'khrug cing don rab tu bstan par 'dod kyi /
translated: One should not be upset by any of the various kinds of opposition, but should be eager to explain the meaning.

original: ston pa tsam du 'dod pa ni ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: ston pa tsam du 'dod pa ni ma yin pa'o //
translated: One should not be eager to teach merely for the sake of teaching.

original: mthar gyis zhes bya ba ni don yang dag par rab tu ston pa'i sgo nas so //üîΩmtshams sbyar ba ni rgol bar byed nas so //
analyzed: mthar gyis zhes bya ba ni don yang dag par rab tu ston pa'i sgo nas so //üîΩmtshams sbyar ba ni rgol bar byed nas so //
translated: The expression gradually means that one should teach the meaning correctly.üîΩ The expression in sequence means that one should teach in a connected manner, without skipping any steps.

original: mthun par 'brel pa ni de'i lan yang dag par rab tu ston pa'i sgo nas so //üîΩrangs par byed pa ni yang dag par blangs te 'dug pa rnams la'o //
analyzed: mthun par 'brel pa ni de'i lan yang dag par rab tu ston pa'i sgo nas so // rangs par byed pa ni yang dag par blangs te 'dug pa rnams la'o //
translated: The harmonious is the one who teaches the correct reply.üîΩ The pleasing is the one who teaches the correct reply to those who have taken up the correct practice.

original: dga' bar byed pa ni bar mar gnas pa rnams la'o ;
analyzed: dga' bar byed pa ni bar mar gnas pa rnams la'o ;
translated: The delighting is the one who teaches the correct reply to those who are indifferent.

original: / mgu bar byed pa ni zhe 'gras pa rnams la'o //
analyzed: / mgu bar byed pa ni zhe 'gras pa rnams la'o //
translated: The satisfying is the one who teaches the correct reply to those who are hostile.

original: spro bar mi byed pa ni bsten pa dang mgu ba'i sems kyis pha rol po'i yang dag pa'i yon tan rnams la spro bar byed kyi /üîΩrang gi ming gis mi ston pa'o //
analyzed: spro bar mi byed pa ni bsten pa dang mgu ba'i sems kyis pha rol po'i yang dag pa'i yon tan rnams la spro bar byed kyi / rang gi ming gis mi ston pa'o //
translated: The not discouraging is the one who, with a mind of devotion and satisfaction, encourages others with regard to their good qualities, but does not point out their faults.

original: spa 'gong bar mi byed pa ni zhe sdang gis pha rol po'i yang dag pa'i skyon rang gi ming gis mi ston pa'o //
analyzed: spa 'gong bar mi byed pa ni zhe sdang gis pha rol po'i yang dag pa'i skyon rang gi ming gis mi ston pa'o //
translated: The not belittling is the one who, with a mind of devotion and satisfaction, encourages others with regard to their good qualities, but does not point out their faults by name.üîΩ The reasonable is the one who teaches the correct reply with the four reasonings: the reasoning of dependence, the reasoning of function, the reasoning of proof, and the reasoning of nature.

original: rigs pa dang ldan pa ni rigs pa bzhi po ltos pa'i rigs pa dang / gtan tshigs sgrub pa'i rigs pa dang / bya ba byed pa'i rigs pa dang / chos nyid kyi rigs pa bzhi dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: rigs pa dang ldan pa ni rigs pa bzhi po ltos pa'i rigs pa dang / gtan tshigs sgrub pa'i rigs pa dang / bya ba byed pa'i rigs pa dang / chos nyid kyi rigs pa bzhi dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The appropriate is the one who teaches the correct reply in a manner that is appropriate to the disciples.

original: 'brel pa ni skabs mi 'dor ba'o //
analyzed: 'brel pa ni skabs mi 'dor ba'o //
translated: Connection is not missing the occasion.

original: ma 'dres pa ni ma 'khrug pa dang 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: ma 'dres pa ni ma 'khrug pa dang 'brel pa'o //
translated: Unmixed is not confused.

original: chos dang mthun pa ni don dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: chos dang mthun pa ni don dang ldan pa ste /
translated: In accordance with the Dharma is meaningful.

original: sdug bsngal la sogs pa dang nges par 'byung ba dang rab tu dben pa las skyes pa'i chos rnam pa du ma las brtsam pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la sogs pa dang nges par 'byung ba dang rab tu dben pa las skyes pa'i chos rnam pa du ma las brtsam pa'o //
translated: It is based on the many aspects of the Dharma that arise from renunciation, seclusion, and suffering.

original: 'khor ji lta ba bzhin zhes bya ba ni rgyal rigs la sogs pa 'khor bzhi la rung ba'o //
analyzed: 'khor ji lta ba bzhin zhes bya ba ni rgyal rigs la sogs pa 'khor bzhi la rung ba'o //
translated: As befits the retinue means it is suitable for the four retinues of the warrior class, etc.

original: byams pa'i sems kyis zhes bya ba ni don de rtogs pa dang phan par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: byams pa'i sems kyis zhes bya ba ni don de rtogs pa dang phan par 'dod pa'o //
translated: With a mind of love means desiring to realize that meaning and benefit.

original: phan pa'i sems kyis zhes bya ba ni ci nas kyang de gus par chos nyan par 'gyur ba dang / kun shes par 'gyur ba dang / des na de dag la phan par 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa'o //
analyzed: phan pa'i sems kyis zhes bya ba ni ci nas kyang de gus par chos nyan par 'gyur ba dang / kun shes par 'gyur ba dang / des na de dag la phan par 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa'o //
translated: With a mind of benefit means thinking, ‚ÄúHow can they listen to the Dharma respectfully, understand it, and benefit from it?‚Äù

original: snying brtse ba'i sems kyis @37a * //
analyzed: snying brtse ba'i sems kyis @37a * //
translated: With a mind of compassion means

original: zhes bya ba ni chos dang mthun pa'i chos sgrub par 'dod pas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni chos dang mthun pa'i chos sgrub par 'dod pas so //
translated: desiring to accomplish the Dharma in accordance with the Dharma.

original: rnyed pa dang bkur sti dang tshigs su bcad pa dag la mi rten pa zhes bya ba ni chos gos la sogs pa las brtsams te ma yin phyag 'tshal ba la sogs pa dag gi phyir ma yin gyi /
analyzed: rnyed pa dang bkur sti dang tshigs su bcad pa dag la mi rten pa zhes bya ba ni chos gos la sogs pa las brtsams te ma yin phyag 'tshal ba la sogs pa dag gi phyir ma yin gyi /
translated: He does not depend on gain, honor, or fame means that he does not depend on robes, etc.

original: gzhan dag g-yen spyo'o snyam pa 'ba' zhig tu sems pa'o zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag g-yen spyo'o snyam pa 'ba' zhig tu sems pa'o zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba'o //
translated: He does not think, ‚ÄúI will honor others in order to gain honor, etc.‚Äù

original: bdag la bstod par mi byed cing gzhan la smod par mi byed pa ni rnyed pa dang bkur sti 'dod pas bdag ni chos 'dul ba 'di kun shes so //
analyzed: bdag la bstod par mi byed cing gzhan la smod par mi byed pa ni rnyed pa dang bkur sti 'dod pas bdag ni chos 'dul ba 'di kun shes so //
translated: He does not praise himself and disparage others means that he does not say, ‚ÄúI know this Dharma and Vinaya well,

original: khyod ni mi shes so zhes bya ba rgya cher bdag gi yon tan mi brjod cing gzhan gyi skyon nas mi brjod pa'o //
analyzed: khyod ni mi shes so zhes bya ba rgya cher bdag gi yon tan mi brjod cing gzhan gyi skyon nas mi brjod pa'o //
translated: but you do not know it.‚Äù

original: dus su chos mnyan par bya ba ni bdag gi gtam 'di ni de phan pa mang po byed do snyam du bdag nyid kyis gtam bya ba gang yin pa'i dus la bab par mthong zhing /
analyzed: dus su chos mnyan par bya ba ni bdag gi gtam 'di ni de phan pa mang po byed do snyam du bdag nyid kyis gtam bya ba gang yin pa'i dus la bab par mthong zhing /
translated: He listens to the Dharma at the proper time means that he sees the time for his own discourse as the time for others‚Äô discourse, thinking, ‚ÄúThis discourse will be of great benefit to me.‚Äù

original: gzhan gyi yang 'di'i bar chad du mi 'gyur ro zhes ston pa'i dus shes nas gtam bya ba'o //üîΩgus par bya ba ni sems dma' bas stan dma' ba la 'dug ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyi yang 'di'i bar chad du mi 'gyur ro zhes ston pa'i dus shes nas gtam bya ba'o // gus par bya ba ni sems dma' bas stan dma' ba la 'dug ste /
translated: One should speak at the proper time, having understood the time when it is not an obstacle for the other person.

original: spyod lam phun sum tshogs par 'gyur bas ci nus su chos mnyan pa'o //
analyzed: spyod lam phun sum tshogs par 'gyur bas ci nus su chos mnyan pa'o //
translated: One should listen respectfully, sitting on a low seat with a humble mind, and listening to the Dharma with perfect behavior, as much as possible.

original: gus par mnyan pa ni don bye brag tu ma rtogs pa bye brag tu rtogs par bya ba'i phyir dang po nyid du dri ba dang / bye brag tu rtogs pa the tshom can yang the tshom bsal bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: gus par mnyan pa ni don bye brag tu ma rtogs pa bye brag tu rtogs par bya ba'i phyir dang po nyid du dri ba dang / bye brag tu rtogs pa the tshom can yang the tshom bsal bar bya ba'o //
translated: One should listen with respect, first asking questions in order to understand the specific meaning that has not been understood, and then removing doubts about the specific meaning that has been understood.

original: spang bar mi bya bas zhes bya ba ni khyad par ches 'phags pa'o //
analyzed: spang bar mi bya bas zhes bya ba ni khyad par ches 'phags pa'o //
translated: One should not abandon the Dharma, thinking I will not understand it, because it is superior to other teachings.

original: rjes su mthun par bya ba ni mnyam pa dang dman pa gnyis so //
analyzed: rjes su mthun par bya ba ni mnyam pa dang dman pa gnyis so //
translated: One should be in harmony with the Dharma, both with those who are equal and with those who are inferior.

original: chos la bsnyen bkur nye bar bzhag ste zhes bya ba ni de'i 'bras bu chen po dang phan yon chen po rtogs nas de la bkur sti bskyed nas nyan pa'o //
analyzed: chos la bsnyen bkur nye bar bzhag ste zhes bya ba ni de'i 'bras bu chen po dang phan yon chen po rtogs nas de la bkur sti bskyed nas nyan pa'o //
translated: One should listen to the Dharma with reverence, having realized its great result and great benefit, and having generated respect for it.üîΩ üîΩOne should listen to the Dharma with reverence is said because it is the cause of the great result and great benefit.

original: chos smra ba la zhes bya ba ni de ston pa ni 'di'o zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: chos smra ba la zhes bya ba ni de ston pa ni 'di'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase to the Dharma teacher means to the one who teaches this.

original: chos la mi brnyas pas zhes bya ba ni 'di ni yi ge dang tshig 'bru bzang po ma yin gyi /
analyzed: chos la mi brnyas pas zhes bya ba ni 'di ni yi ge dang tshig 'bru bzang po ma yin gyi /
translated: The phrase without despising the Dharma means without despising it by thinking, 'This is not a good text or a good composition;

original: 'di ni tshig dang yi ge yang ba dang mngon pa'o zhes brnyas par mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni tshig dang yi ge yang ba dang mngon pa'o zhes brnyas par mi byed pa'o //
translated: this is a poor text and a poor composition.'

original: chos smra ba la zhes bya ba ni 'di ni bdag pas rigs dma' zhing chos ngan pa yin no zhes brnyas par mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: chos smra ba la zhes bya ba ni 'di ni bdag pas rigs dma' zhing chos ngan pa yin no zhes brnyas par mi byed pa'o //
translated: The phrase to the Dharma teacher means without despising him by thinking, 'He is of a low caste and of poor Dharma.'

original: bdag nyid la zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid la ni chos 'di kun shes par bya ba'i mthu med do zhes rtogs par bya ba la spa mi 'gong ba'o //üîΩkun shes par 'dod pa'i sems kyis zhes bya ba ni tho mi 'tshams pa'i bsam pas shes par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid la zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid la ni chos 'di kun shes par bya ba'i mthu med do zhes rtogs par bya ba la spa mi 'gong ba'o // kun shes par 'dod pa'i sems kyis zhes bya ba ni tho mi 'tshams pa'i bsam pas shes par 'dod pa'o //
translated: The phrase to oneself means without being discouraged by thinking, 'I am not capable of understanding this Dharma.'üîΩ The phrase with a mind that desires to understand means with a mind that is not hostile.

original: rtse gcig pa'i sems kyis zhes @37b bya ba ni yi ge'i bye brag rtogs par bya ba'o //
analyzed: rtse gcig pa'i sems kyis zhes @37b bya ba ni yi ge'i bye brag rtogs par bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase with a one-pointed mind means with a mind that is focused on understanding the distinctions of the letters.

original: rna gtad do zhes bya ba ni sgra rtogs par bya ba'o //
analyzed: rna gtad do zhes bya ba ni sgra rtogs par bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase they are attentive means that they understand the words.

original: yid yang dag par gtad do zhes bya ba ni don dang mthun par 'jug par bya ba'o //
analyzed: yid yang dag par gtad do zhes bya ba ni don dang mthun par 'jug par bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase they are focused means that they engage in a manner that is consistent with the meaning.

original: sems can thams cad kyis bsams te zhes bya ba ni ci nas kyang 'ga' yang yang dag par mi rigs pa dang yang dag par mi rtog par mi 'gyur bar bya ba'i bar chad med par yi ge dang sgra'i bye brag rtogs par bya ba'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyis bsams te zhes bya ba ni ci nas kyang 'ga' yang yang dag par mi rigs pa dang yang dag par mi rtog par mi 'gyur bar bya ba'i bar chad med par yi ge dang sgra'i bye brag rtogs par bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase they are intent on all sentient beings means that they understand the various types of letters and words in a manner that is uninterrupted, so that no one will fail to understand the correct meaning and no one will fail to understand the correct expression.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos kyi dge 'dun ni legs par zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni mdor bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos kyi dge 'dun ni legs par zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni mdor bstan pa'o //
translated: The phrase the Bhagavat's ≈õrƒÅvaka sa·πÖgha is well behaved is the brief statement.

original: rigs par zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni slob pa 'bras bu la gnas pa rnams so //
analyzed: rigs par zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni slob pa 'bras bu la gnas pa rnams so //
translated: The phrase they are properly behaved refers to those who are learners and abide in the result.

original: drang por zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni zhugs pa'i lam la gnas pa rnams so //
analyzed: drang por zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni zhugs pa'i lam la gnas pa rnams so //
translated: The phrase they are straightforwardly behaved refers to those who abide in the path of preparation.üîΩ The phrase they are correctly behaved refers to those who abide in the path of seeing.

original: mthun par zhugs pa ni mi slob pa rnams te de dag ni ston pa dang chos dang bslab pa la sogs pa la gus par byed pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //üîΩmthun pa'i chos spyod pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu la gnas pa rnams so //
analyzed: mthun par zhugs pa ni mi slob pa rnams te de dag ni ston pa dang chos dang bslab pa la sogs pa la gus par byed pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do // mthun pa'i chos spyod pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu la gnas pa rnams so //
translated: Those who are properly engaged are the adepts, because they are only engaged in respect for the teacher, the teaching, the training, etc.üîΩThose who practice the Dharma in accordance with the Dharma are those who are established in the cause.

original: chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub pa ni gang dag pha rol gyi sgra'i rgyu las byung bas nang du tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub pa ni gang dag pha rol gyi sgra'i rgyu las byung bas nang du tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa'o //
translated: Those who practice the Dharma in accordance with the Dharma are those who practice the Dharma in accordance with the Dharma.

original: yang legs par zhugs pa ni de'i lam dang de'i 'bras bu 'gog pa la zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: yang legs par zhugs pa ni de'i lam dang de'i 'bras bu 'gog pa la zhugs pa'o //
translated: Those who are properly engaged are those who are engaged in the path and the cessation which is the fruit of that.

original: drang por zhugs pa ni ji ltar bstan pa bzhin du sgrub pa ste g-yo dang sgyu med par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'chags pa'o //
analyzed: drang por zhugs pa ni ji ltar bstan pa bzhin du sgrub pa ste g-yo dang sgyu med par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'chags pa'o //
translated: Those who are straightforwardly engaged are those who practice in accordance with the teaching, who confess with sincerity, without deceit or pretense, just as it is.

original: mthun par zhugs pa ni mgu bar 'gyur ba'i chos drug dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: mthun par zhugs pa ni mgu bar 'gyur ba'i chos drug dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Those who are engaged in accordance with the Dharma are those who possess the six qualities that please the spiritual teacher.

original: mthun pa'i chos spyod pa ni chos dang mthun pa'i chos spyod pa'o //
analyzed: mthun pa'i chos spyod pa ni chos dang mthun pa'i chos spyod pa'o //
translated: Those who practice the Dharma in accordance with the Dharma are those who practice the Dharma in accordance with the Dharma.

original: dgra bcom pa dang zag pa zad pa zhes rgyas par 'byung ba dang / shin tu mthar thug pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba dang / gtan pa med pa dang / 'obs bor ba dang / 'obs las yang dag par rgal ba zhes rgyas par 'byung ba dang /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa dang zag pa zad pa zhes rgyas par 'byung ba dang / shin tu mthar thug pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba dang / gtan pa med pa dang / 'obs bor ba dang / 'obs las yang dag par rgal ba zhes rgyas par 'byung ba dang /
translated: and ‚Äúarhat, one who has destroyed the defilements,‚Äù and so on, and ‚Äúone who has gone to the very end,‚Äù and so on, and ‚Äúone who is not subject to retrogressing,‚Äù and ‚Äúone who has crossed over the swamp,‚Äù and ‚Äúone who has crossed over the abyss,‚Äù and so on,üîΩand ‚Äúone who has abandoned the five members,‚Äù and ‚Äúone who possesses the six members,‚Äù and so on, and ‚Äústream-winner, one who will never fall into a wretched state, one who is certain to attain complete enlightenment,‚Äù and so on.

original: yan lag lnga spangs pa dang / yan lag drug dang ldan pa zhes rgyas par 'byung ba dang / rgyun du zhugs pa dang rnam par mi ltung ba'i chos can dang nges par rdzogs par byang chub tu 'gro ba zhes rgyas par 'byung ba 'di dag thams cad ni gzhi bsdu bar rang gi gnas nas bshad par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yan lag lnga spangs pa dang / yan lag drug dang ldan pa zhes rgyas par 'byung ba dang / rgyun du zhugs pa dang rnam par mi ltung ba'i chos can dang nges par rdzogs par byang chub tu 'gro ba zhes rgyas par 'byung ba 'di dag thams cad ni gzhi bsdu bar rang gi gnas nas bshad par rig par bya'o //
translated: All these terms should be understood as explained in the chapter on the faculties.

original: ston pa'i sras zhes bya ba ni mdor bstan pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: ston pa'i sras zhes bya ba ni mdor bstan pa'i tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúSon of the Teacher‚Äù is the brief definition.

original: thugs las skyes pa zhes bya ba ni sras kyi nang na dman pas so so'i skye bo bsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thugs las skyes pa zhes bya ba ni sras kyi nang na dman pas so so'i skye bo bsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúBorn of the mind‚Äù is said in order to exclude ordinary persons, since they are inferior to the sons.

original: gsung las skyes pa ni chos bstan @38a * //
analyzed: gsung las skyes pa ni chos bstan @38a * //
translated: Those born from speech are the DharmaüîΩ

original: pa'i sgra las skyes pa'o //
analyzed: pa'i sgra las skyes pa'o //
translated: Born from speech means born from the sound of the teaching of the Dharma.

original: chos las skyes pa ni tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dang chos dang mthun pa'i chos sgrub pa las skyes pa'o //
analyzed: chos las skyes pa ni tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dang chos dang mthun pa'i chos sgrub pa las skyes pa'o //
translated: Born from the Dharma means born from proper mental attention and from the practice of Dharma in accordance with the Dharma.

original: chos kyi sprul pa ni chos kyi sku yongs su grub pa dang chos mthun pa yin no //
analyzed: chos kyi sprul pa ni chos kyi sku yongs su grub pa dang chos mthun pa yin no //
translated: Emanation of the Dharma means similar to the accomplishment of the Dharma Body.

original: chos kyi bgo skal la spyod pa ni zag pa med pa'i chos kyi longs spyod la chos mthun pa yin no //
analyzed: chos kyi bgo skal la spyod pa ni zag pa med pa'i chos kyi longs spyod la chos mthun pa yin no //
translated: Enjoyer of the portion of the Dharma means similar to the enjoyment of the undefiled Dharma.

original: de dag gis ni skye ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / yab dang chos mthun pa phun sum tshogs pa yongs su bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: de dag gis ni skye ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / yab dang chos mthun pa phun sum tshogs pa yongs su bstan pa yin te /
translated: By these, the perfection of birth and the perfection of similarity to the father are taught.

original: tshig dang pos ni skye ba bzang po phun sum tshogs pa snod kyi skyon dgag pa bstan to //
analyzed: tshig dang pos ni skye ba bzang po phun sum tshogs pa snod kyi skyon dgag pa bstan to //
translated: By the first phrase, the perfection of good birth is taught, which is the negation of the fault of a vessel.

original: gnyis pas ni khu ba dang khrag mi gtsang ba las skye ba dgag pa bstan to //
analyzed: gnyis pas ni khu ba dang khrag mi gtsang ba las skye ba dgag pa bstan to //
translated: By the second, the negation of birth from impure semen and blood is taught.

original: gsum pas ni dam pa'i chos ma yin pa 'dod pa'i 'dod chags las skye ba dgag pa bstan te /
analyzed: gsum pas ni dam pa'i chos ma yin pa 'dod pa'i 'dod chags las skye ba dgag pa bstan te /
translated: The third line teaches the prevention of birth from attachment to non-Dharma.

original: tshig gsum po de dag gis skye ba bzang po phun sum tshogs pa yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: tshig gsum po de dag gis skye ba bzang po phun sum tshogs pa yongs su bstan to //
translated: These three lines teach the excellence of birth.

original: tshig bzhi pas ni bdag dang chos mthun pa bstan to //
analyzed: tshig bzhi pas ni bdag dang chos mthun pa bstan to //
translated: The fourth line teaches the similarity of self.

original: lnga pas ni longs spyod la chos mthun pa bstan to //
analyzed: lnga pas ni longs spyod la chos mthun pa bstan to //
translated: The fifth line teaches the similarity of enjoyments.

original: tshig 'di gnyis kyis ni chos mthun pa la skye ba phun sum tshogs pa yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: tshig 'di gnyis kyis ni chos mthun pa la skye ba phun sum tshogs pa yongs su bstan to //
translated: These two lines teach the excellence of birth in similarity.

original: gzhi ni rkyen dang kun 'byung ba dang rgyu'o //üîΩrkyen gyi dbang du byas nas de las skye ba'o //
analyzed: gzhi ni rkyen dang kun 'byung ba dang rgyu'o // rkyen gyi dbang du byas nas de las skye ba'o //
translated: Basis means condition, origin, and cause.üîΩFrom that, birth is in terms of condition.

original: rgyu'i dbang du byas nas de las rab tu skyes pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu'i dbang du byas nas de las rab tu skyes pa'o //
translated: From that, complete birth is in terms of cause.

original: rgyu las rab tu skye yang rkyen gyi dbang gis ni skye'i gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu las rab tu skye yang rkyen gyi dbang gis ni skye'i gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Although complete birth is from a cause, it is birth by the power of conditions, not otherwise.

original: yang na tshig phyi ma phyi ma bshad pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yang na tshig phyi ma phyi ma bshad pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Or, the later lines should be understood as explanations of the earlier lines.

original: legs par mthong ba zhes bya ba ni mdor bstan pa'o //
analyzed: legs par mthong ba zhes bya ba ni mdor bstan pa'o //
translated: The term ‚Äúwell-seen‚Äù refers to the brief indication.

original: legs par rig pa ni chos dang don so so yang dag par rig pa'o //
analyzed: legs par rig pa ni chos dang don so so yang dag par rig pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWell-understood‚Äù refers to the discernment of phenomena and their meaning.

original: legs par yid la byas pa ni yang dag par tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: legs par yid la byas pa ni yang dag par tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWell-internalized‚Äù refers to the correct and proper internalization.

original: legs par bstan pa ni kun nas so //
analyzed: legs par bstan pa ni kun nas so //
translated: ‚ÄúWell-taught‚Äù refers to the complete teaching.

original: legs par rtog pa ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin gyi sgo nas te /
analyzed: legs par rtog pa ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin gyi sgo nas te /
translated: ‚ÄúWell-realized‚Äù refers to the realization of the truth.

original: de gnyis ni legs par mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: de gnyis ni legs par mthong ba yin no //
translated: These two are the ‚Äúwell-seen.‚Äù

original: snga ma gnyis ni de'i sbyor ba yin no //
analyzed: snga ma gnyis ni de'i sbyor ba yin no //
translated: The first two are the ‚Äúpreparatory‚Äù stages.

original: 'phags pa ni zag pa med pa dang 'phags pa'i rgyu la yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa ni zag pa med pa dang 'phags pa'i rgyu la yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúNoble‚Äù refers to the uncontaminated and the cause of the noble.

original: nges par 'byung ba ni khams gsum pa'i sdug bsngal las nges par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba ni khams gsum pa'i sdug bsngal las nges par 'byung ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúLiberation‚Äù refers to the liberation from the suffering of the three realms.

original: nges par rtog pa can ni shin tu nges par 'byung ba dang phyir mi zlog pa'o //
analyzed: nges par rtog pa can ni shin tu nges par 'byung ba dang phyir mi zlog pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúRealization‚Äù refers to the definite liberation and the absence of reversal.

original: bcom ldan 'das ni chos thams cad kyi rtsa ba zhes bya ba ni dang por mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni chos thams cad kyi rtsa ba zhes bya ba ni dang por mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'o //
translated: The Blessed One is the ‚Äúroot of all phenomena‚Äù because he is the first to attain complete enlightenment.

original: bcom ldan 'das ni 'dren @38b par byed pa zhes bya ba ni mngon par rdzogs par byang chub nas lha dang mi'i bar la yang dag par rab tu ston pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni 'dren @38b par byed pa zhes bya ba ni mngon par rdzogs par byang chub nas lha dang mi'i bar la yang dag par rab tu ston pa'o //
translated: The Blessed One is the leader because, having attained perfect awakening, he teaches gods and humans correctly.

original: bcom ldan 'das ni rten zhes bya ba ni chos bstan pa la the tshom skyes pa thams cad yang dang yang du sel ba'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni rten zhes bya ba ni chos bstan pa la the tshom skyes pa thams cad yang dang yang du sel ba'o //
translated: The Blessed One is the support because he repeatedly dispels all doubts that arise in the teachings.

original: bcom ldan 'das de mig tu gyur pa zhes bya ba ni lhan cig skyes pa'i shes rab sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de mig tu gyur pa zhes bya ba ni lhan cig skyes pa'i shes rab sgrub pa'o //
translated: The Blessed One is the eye because he accomplishes innate wisdom.

original: ye shes su gyur pa zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba las byung ba'i shes rab sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes su gyur pa zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba las byung ba'i shes rab sgrub pa'o //
translated: He is wisdom because he accomplishes wisdom arisen from practice.

original: mngon du gyur pa ni bsams pa las byung ba'i shes rab sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: mngon du gyur pa ni bsams pa las byung ba'i shes rab sgrub pa'o //
translated: He is manifest because he accomplishes wisdom arisen from reflection.

original: chos su gyur pa ni thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: chos su gyur pa ni thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab sgrub pa'o //
translated: He is the Dharma because he accomplishes wisdom arisen from listening.

original: don gsal bar gtan la 'bebs par byed pa ni the tshom thams cad gcod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: don gsal bar gtan la 'bebs par byed pa ni the tshom thams cad gcod par byed pa'o //
translated: He clarifies and establishes the meaning because he cuts through all doubts.

original: don thams cad kyi rten ni 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phun sum tshogs pa thams cad sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: don thams cad kyi rten ni 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phun sum tshogs pa thams cad sgrub pa'o //
translated: The support of all objects is the accomplishment of all mundane and supramundane perfections.

original: yid byung ba ni mthong ba'i lam la'o //
analyzed: yid byung ba ni mthong ba'i lam la'o //
translated: Disenchantment is on the path of seeing.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba ni bsgom pa'i lam yongs su rdzogs pa dag la'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba ni bsgom pa'i lam yongs su rdzogs pa dag la'o //
translated: Freedom from attachment is on the complete path of cultivation.

original: 'gog pa ni phung po thams cad 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa ni phung po thams cad 'gog pa'o //
translated: Cessation is the cessation of all aggregates.

original: yid byung ba dang 'dod chags dang bral ba la zhugs pa ni de gnyis kyi sbyor ba la gnas pa rnams yin no //
analyzed: yid byung ba dang 'dod chags dang bral ba la zhugs pa ni de gnyis kyi sbyor ba la gnas pa rnams yin no //
translated: Those who are engaged in disenchantment and freedom from attachment are those who are engaged in the preparatory stages of those two.

original: 'gog pa la zhugs pa rnams ni mi slob pa yin no //
analyzed: 'gog pa la zhugs pa rnams ni mi slob pa yin no //
translated: Those who are engaged in cessation are those who are beyond training.

original: yid 'byung bar 'gyur ba ni bden pa mthong bas 'dus byas thams cad las mi mthun par 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: yid 'byung bar 'gyur ba ni bden pa mthong bas 'dus byas thams cad las mi mthun par 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Disenchantment is the apprehension of all conditioned things as disagreeable through seeing the truths.

original: de nas 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni bsgom pa'i lam la 'dod chags spong ba'o //
analyzed: de nas 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni bsgom pa'i lam la 'dod chags spong ba'o //
translated: Then one becomes free from attachment is the abandonment of attachment on the path of cultivation.

original: rnam par grol bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni de nas 'dod chags dang de dang de grub pa dang bde ba gcig la de las gzhan pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams las sems rnam par grol ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par grol bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni de nas 'dod chags dang de dang de grub pa dang bde ba gcig la de las gzhan pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams las sems rnam par grol ba'o //
translated: Liberated means that from that time on, the mind is liberated from attachment and from the afflictions other than that one, in regard to that object and in regard to the pleasure of its attainment.

original: yongs su grol ba ni nyon mongs pa spong ba'i phyir skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal las grol ba'o //
analyzed: yongs su grol ba ni nyon mongs pa spong ba'i phyir skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal las grol ba'o //
translated: Fully liberated means that it is liberated from the suffering of birth, etc., because the afflictions have been abandoned.

original: de ni bram ze zhes bya ba ni pha rol gyi mthar thug par 'gro ba dang sdig pa bsal ba'o //
analyzed: de ni bram ze zhes bya ba ni pha rol gyi mthar thug par 'gro ba dang sdig pa bsal ba'o //
translated: He is a brahmin means that he has gone to the other shore and has removed evil.

original: de'i mtshan nyid la the tshom med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rang gi rtogs pa la the tshom med pa'o //
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid la the tshom med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rang gi rtogs pa la the tshom med pa'o //
translated: He has no doubt about its characteristics and so on means that he has no doubt about his own realization.

original: 'gyod pa bcad pa ni bya ba mi byed pa med pa dang bya ba ma yin pa byed pa med pa'o //
analyzed: 'gyod pa bcad pa ni bya ba mi byed pa med pa dang bya ba ma yin pa byed pa med pa'o //
translated: He has cut off regret means that he does not do what should not be done and does what should be done.

original: sred pa dang bral ba ni rnyed pa dang bkur sti la sred pa med pa'o //
analyzed: sred pa dang bral ba ni rnyed pa dang bkur sti la sred pa med pa'o //
translated: He is free from craving means that he is free from craving for gain and honor.

original: 'byung ba dang zhig pa la chags pa rgyas par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni bag la nyal spangs pa'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba dang zhig pa la chags pa rgyas par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni bag la nyal spangs pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúone does not increase attachment to origination and destruction‚Äù means that one abandons the latent propensities.

original: de la da ltar dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus ni 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: de la da ltar dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus ni 'byung ba'o //
translated: In this context, the present and future times are origination.

original: 'das pa @39a * //
analyzed: 'das pa @39a * //
translated: The past is destruction.

original: ni zhig pa ste de dag gis ni bram ze de yongs su brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: ni zhig pa ste de dag gis ni bram ze de yongs su brtag par bya'o //
translated: The brahmin should be examined in terms of these three.

original: de la thos pa mang po dang shes bzhin dang dge ba'i phyogs la brtson pa la yang gong ma gsum srid pas de'i phyir lung ston pas na bzhi pas kyang yongs su brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: de la thos pa mang po dang shes bzhin dang dge ba'i phyogs la brtson pa la yang gong ma gsum srid pas de'i phyir lung ston pas na bzhi pas kyang yongs su brtag par bya'o //
translated: Since the three higher realms are possible for one who has much learning, is mindful, and is devoted to virtue, the brahmin should be examined in terms of the fourth realm as well.

original: de la chags pa zhes bya ba ni chags pa brgyad de /
analyzed: de la chags pa zhes bya ba ni chags pa brgyad de /
translated: In this context, ‚Äúattachment‚Äù refers to the eight attachments.

original: zhig pa las mya ngan du gyur pa dang / da ltar gyis yang dag par bsdus pa 'byung ba la lnga ste /
analyzed: zhig pa las mya ngan du gyur pa dang / da ltar gyis yang dag par bsdus pa 'byung ba la lnga ste /
translated: There are five attachments related to origination that are included in the present:

original: byi dor byas pa dang / sbas pa dang / bdag gir byas pa dang / gyen du bsgreng ba dang / chung ngu bsgreng ba'o //
analyzed: byi dor byas pa dang / sbas pa dang / bdag gir byas pa dang / gyen du bsgreng ba dang / chung ngu bsgreng ba'o //
translated: attachment to being rubbed, attachment to being covered, attachment to being possessed, attachment to being raised up, and attachment to being lowered.

original: ma 'ongs pa la gnyis te /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa la gnyis te /
translated: There are two attachments related to the future:

original: rnam par spyad pa dang / rnam par bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par spyad pa dang / rnam par bskyod pa'o //
translated: and (3) the enjoyment of the results of past actions.

original: gsum ka la ni stug por byas pa dang / ro bro bar byas pa'o //
analyzed: gsum ka la ni stug por byas pa dang / ro bro bar byas pa'o //
translated: In all three cases, there is the desire to enjoy and the desire to avoid.

original: de la mya ngan du gyur pa ni sdug pa yongs su gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de la mya ngan du gyur pa ni sdug pa yongs su gyur pa'o //
translated: Here, ‚Äúsorrow‚Äù is the transformation of what is dear.

original: byi dor byas pa ni gsos pa dang yongs su bskyangs pa'o //
analyzed: byi dor byas pa ni gsos pa dang yongs su bskyangs pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Anointing‚Äù is the nurturing and protection.

original: sbas pa ni 'tshe ba'i gnas las bskyabs pa'o //
analyzed: sbas pa ni 'tshe ba'i gnas las bskyabs pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Concealment‚Äù is the protection from the place of danger.

original: bdag gir byas pa ni bdag gir bya bas rang gir byas pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gir byas pa ni bdag gir bya bas rang gir byas pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Appropriation‚Äù is the possession by the act of appropriation.

original: gyen du bsgreng ba ni bdag mchog go snyam pa'i nga rgyal te /
analyzed: gyen du bsgreng ba ni bdag mchog go snyam pa'i nga rgyal te /
translated: ‚Äú Elevation‚Äù is the pride that thinks ‚ÄúI am superior.‚Äù

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis skye dgu ni nga rgyal gyi rgyal mtshan can no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis skye dgu ni nga rgyal gyi rgyal mtshan can no zhes gsungs so //
translated: The Blessed One said, ‚ÄúPeople are bannered by pride.‚Äù

original: chung ngu bsgreng ba ni bdag chung ngo snyam pa'i nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: chung ngu bsgreng ba ni bdag chung ngo snyam pa'i nga rgyal lo //
translated: ‚Äú Lowering‚Äù is the pride that thinks ‚ÄúI am inferior.‚Äù

original: rnam par spyad pa ni ma 'ongs pa don du gnyer ba'i sred pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par spyad pa ni ma 'ongs pa don du gnyer ba'i sred pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Enjoyment‚Äù is the craving for the future.

original: rnam par bskyod pa ni don du gnyer ba yongs su tshol ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par bskyod pa ni don du gnyer ba yongs su tshol ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú Agitation‚Äù is the search for what is desired.

original: stug por byas pa ni gang zhig 'dod pa nye bar longs spyod par bya ba ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: stug por byas pa ni gang zhig 'dod pa nye bar longs spyod par bya ba ma yin pa ste /
translated: The dense is that which is not to be enjoyed,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: such as

original: gser ram zong gzhan dag go //
analyzed: gser ram zong gzhan dag go //
translated: gold or other goods.

original: ro bro bar byas pa ni nye bar longs spyad par bya ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: ro bro bar byas pa ni nye bar longs spyad par bya ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: The tasty is that which is to be enjoyed.

original: rnam grangs gzhan yang mdor bsdu na tshig lngas lam rtogs pa dang / lam rtogs pa'i 'bras bu mngon du bya ba yongs su bstan te /
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan yang mdor bsdu na tshig lngas lam rtogs pa dang / lam rtogs pa'i 'bras bu mngon du bya ba yongs su bstan te /
translated: Moreover, in brief, the path of realization and the realization of the result of the path are taught by five terms.

original: de la de ni bram ze zhes bya bas ni lam rtogs pa yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: de la de ni bram ze zhes bya bas ni lam rtogs pa yongs su bstan to //
translated: Among them, the one called Brahmin teaches the path of realization.

original: the tshom med pa dang / 'gyod pa chad pa dang / sred pa dang bral ba dang / 'byung ba dang zhig pa la chags pa rgyas par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di dag gis ni lam rtogs pa'i 'bras bu mngon du bya ba yongs su bstan te /
analyzed: the tshom med pa dang / 'gyod pa chad pa dang / sred pa dang bral ba dang / 'byung ba dang zhig pa la chags pa rgyas par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di dag gis ni lam rtogs pa'i 'bras bu mngon du bya ba yongs su bstan te /
translated: The words ‚Äúwithout doubt,‚Äù ‚Äúwithout regret,‚Äù ‚Äúfree from craving,‚Äù and ‚Äúthe increase of attachment to origination and destruction‚Äù teach the realization of the result of the path.

original: kun shes pa thob pa dang / lung ston pa'i the tshom spong ba dang / rgyu ba na spyod pa brjed pa'i chos nyid spong ba dang / ma 'ongs pa'i sdug bsngal gyi rgyu spong ba dang / da ltar gyi sdug bsngal rgyu gnas ngan len spong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun shes pa thob pa dang / lung ston pa'i the tshom spong ba dang / rgyu ba na spyod pa brjed pa'i chos nyid spong ba dang / ma 'ongs pa'i sdug bsngal gyi rgyu spong ba dang / da ltar gyi sdug bsngal rgyu gnas ngan len spong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because of the attainment of complete knowledge, because of the removal of doubt about prophecy, because of the removal of the nature of forgetting while moving about, because of the removal of the cause of future suffering, and because of the removal of the cause of present suffering, which is the taking up of bad states.

original: de la @39b don gyi skabs 'dir ni 'byung ba ni khams gsum par gtogs pa'i mtshan ma yid la byed pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de la @39b don gyi skabs 'dir ni 'byung ba ni khams gsum par gtogs pa'i mtshan ma yid la byed pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Here, in this context, the arising of signs should be regarded as the attention given to the signs belonging to the three realms.

original: zhig par ni mtshan ma med pa yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: zhig par ni mtshan ma med pa yid la byed pa'o //
translated: The cessation of signs is the attention given to signlessness.

original: chags pa yang don gyi skabs 'dir ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug rnams te /
analyzed: chags pa yang don gyi skabs 'dir ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug rnams te /
translated: In this context, attachment is desire, hatred and delusion.

original: de dag kyang ji ltar mtshan ma med pa la snyoms par zhugs pa'i slob pa la rgyas par 'gyur ba ltar dgra bcom pa ni de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag kyang ji ltar mtshan ma med pa la snyoms par zhugs pa'i slob pa la rgyas par 'gyur ba ltar dgra bcom pa ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: And these are not developed in the way they are in the learner who has entered into the attainment of signlessness, but they are in the Arhat.

original: rnam par rtog pa dang / spros pa dang / chags pa dang // 'du shes zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang / spros pa dang / chags pa dang // 'du shes zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa rnam pa bzhi ste /

original: snga ma gnyis ni rab tu byung ba'i phyogs kyi yin no //
analyzed: snga ma gnyis ni rab tu byung ba'i phyogs kyi yin no //
translated: The first two are for those who have gone forth from the home life.

original: gnyis ni khyim pa phyi ma'i phyogs kyi yin te /
analyzed: gnyis ni khyim pa phyi ma'i phyogs kyi yin te /
translated: The latter two are for those who remain in the home life.

original: chags pa rgyas na de skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chags pa rgyas na de skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When attachment increases, they arise.

original: rab tu byung ba rnams ni yul nyams su myong ba rjes su dran pa las ni rjes su rtog pa tsam yin la g-yo ba kun tu spyod pa las ni spros pa yin gyi /
analyzed: rab tu byung ba rnams ni yul nyams su myong ba rjes su dran pa las ni rjes su rtog pa tsam yin la g-yo ba kun tu spyod pa las ni spros pa yin gyi /
translated: For those who have gone forth, discursive thought arises from the recollection of the experience of objects, and elaboration arises from the practice of movement.

original: khyim pa rnams ni yul nye bar gnas pa las chags pa yin no //
analyzed: khyim pa rnams ni yul nye bar gnas pa las chags pa yin no //
translated: For those who remain in the home life, attachment arises from the presence of objects.

original: chags pa dang de'i mtshan ma la 'dzin pa las de'i 'du shes pa yin no //
analyzed: chags pa dang de'i mtshan ma la 'dzin pa las de'i 'du shes pa yin no //
translated: The perception of those objects arises from the grasping of attachment and its signs.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu ni gnyis te /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu ni gnyis te /
translated: There are two causes of affliction:

original: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa dang / de'i gnas kyi chos rnams te /
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa dang / de'i gnas kyi chos rnams te /

original: rgyu gang las skye ba de ni de'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: rgyu gang las skye ba de ni de'i rgyu yin no //

original: mi rtag pa gang yin pa de ni sdug bsngal lo zhes bya ba'i don ci zhe na /
analyzed: mi rtag pa gang yin pa de ni sdug bsngal lo zhes bya ba'i don ci zhe na /

original: gang gis na mi rtag pa dang ris mthun pa des na skye ba dang rga ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal skye ba dang / gang gis na reg pa la rag lus te tshor ba des na rnam par 'gyur la /
analyzed: gang gis na mi rtag pa dang ris mthun pa des na skye ba dang rga ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal skye ba dang / gang gis na reg pa la rag lus te tshor ba des na rnam par 'gyur la /
translated: Because of dependence on contact, there is the arising of feeling.

original: skye zhing 'jig ste /
analyzed: skye zhing 'jig ste /
translated: Because of change, there is the arising of suffering.

original: de'i phyir tshor ba gsum po thams cad sdug bsngal lo zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir tshor ba gsum po thams cad sdug bsngal lo zhes bshad do //
translated: Therefore, all three kinds of feeling are suffering.

original: gang yang skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyi chos can dang / gang yang rnam par 'gyur ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyi chos can de dag ni bdag nyid kyis bdag med pas bdag med pa'am //
analyzed: gang yang skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyi chos can dang / gang yang rnam par 'gyur ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyi chos can de dag ni bdag nyid kyis bdag med pas bdag med pa'am //
translated: The dharmas of suffering such as birth, etc., and the dharmas of suffering such as change, etc., are not self because they are not in control of themselves.

original: de la bdag mi gnas pas na bdag med pa ste /
analyzed: de la bdag mi gnas pas na bdag med pa ste /
translated: Or, they are not self because the self does not exist in them.

original: des na stong pa nyid dang bdag med pa'i rnam pa smos pa yin no //
analyzed: des na stong pa nyid dang bdag med pa'i rnam pa smos pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the aspects of emptiness and nonself are mentioned.

original: kun shes par byed pa ni thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis te /
analyzed: kun shes par byed pa ni thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis te /
translated: The aspect of knowing all is through the wisdom born of listening.

original: shes pa gsungs pa 'di skad du gsung ngo zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: shes pa gsungs pa 'di skad du gsung ngo zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The knowledge is called the knowledge of the three times.

original: yang dag par shes par byed pa ni bsams pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: yang dag par shes par byed pa ni bsams pa las byung ba'o //

analyzed: nges par rtog pa ni bsgoms pa las byung ba'i ste /

original: ma thob pa thob par bya ba ni de dang po nas ma thob pa'am snga ma las nyams pa'o //
analyzed: ma thob pa thob par bya ba ni de dang po nas ma thob pa'am snga ma las nyams pa'o //

original: rtog par bya ba ni gong ma'i khyad par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: rtog par bya ba ni gong ma'i khyad par rtogs pa'o //
translated: The understanding is the realization of the special qualities of the higher stages.

original: mngon sum du bya ba ni spangs pa'o //
analyzed: mngon sum du bya ba ni spangs pa'o //
translated: The actualization is the abandonment.

original: lta ba zhes bya ba 'dis ni shes rab bstan to //
analyzed: lta ba zhes bya ba 'dis ni shes rab bstan to //
translated: The word view indicates wisdom.

original: nges par rtog pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni ting nge 'dzin bstan to //
analyzed: nges par rtog pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni ting nge 'dzin bstan to //
translated: The word investigation indicates concentration.

original: tshul bzhin yongs su rtog ces bya ba ni chos gnyis po de dag nyid la phyin ci ma log par 'jug par bstan to //
analyzed: tshul bzhin yongs su rtog ces bya ba ni chos gnyis po de dag nyid la phyin ci ma log par 'jug par bstan to //
translated: The words thorough investigation indicate the non-erroneous engagement in those two dharmas.

original: med kyang stang ngo zhes bya ba ni de la bde ba med pa'o //
analyzed: med kyang stang ngo zhes bya ba ni de la bde ba med pa'o //
translated: The words empty and vain indicate the absence of pleasure in that.

original: gsob ces bya ba ni bdag gis stong pa'o //
analyzed: gsob ces bya ba ni bdag gis stong pa'o //
translated: The words hollow and false indicate the emptiness of self.

original: gsog ces bya ba ni mi gtsang ba'o //
analyzed: gsog ces bya ba ni mi gtsang ba'o //
translated: The words worthless and insubstantial indicate impurity.

original: snying po med ces bya ba ni mi rtag pa nyid de /
analyzed: snying po med ces bya ba ni mi rtag pa nyid de /
translated: The words insubstantial and impermanent indicate impermanence.

original: de ltar na de dag gis ni phyin ci log bzhi med par yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar na de dag gis ni phyin ci log bzhi med par yongs su bstan to //
translated: Thus, these indicate the absence of the four errors.

original: ji ltar na gzugs dbu ba rdos pa lta bu yin zhe na bsags pa dang / 'jig pa myur ba dang / chu'i khams las byung ba ltar zas dang skom gyi ro dang / rnam par rtog pa'i chu las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar na gzugs dbu ba rdos pa lta bu yin zhe na bsags pa dang / 'jig pa myur ba dang / chu'i khams las byung ba ltar zas dang skom gyi ro dang / rnam par rtog pa'i chu las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: How is form like a mass of foam? It is like the water element in that it arises from the food and drink whose nature is the water element, and it is like the water element in that it arises from the conceptual water.

original: bcang bar mi bzod pa nyid ni /
analyzed: bcang bar mi bzod pa nyid ni /
translated: It is not fit to be held,

original: bcang bar mi bzod pa dang 'ji ba'i gong bu la sogs pa bzhin du sgyur bar mi nus pa'o //
analyzed: bcang bar mi bzod pa dang 'ji ba'i gong bu la sogs pa bzhin du sgyur bar mi nus pa'o //
translated: like a lump of clay, etc.

original: sems can gcig tu mos pa'i phyir gong bu ma yin yang gong bur snang ba'o //
analyzed: sems can gcig tu mos pa'i phyir gong bu ma yin yang gong bur snang ba'o //
translated: It is not a mass, but appears as a mass because of the single orientation of sentient beings.

original: tshor ba chu'i chu bur lta bu ni gsum 'dus pa las skyes pa dang mi gnas par chos mthun pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: tshor ba chu'i chu bur lta bu ni gsum 'dus pa las skyes pa dang mi gnas par chos mthun pa'i phyir te /
translated: Feeling is like a water bubble, because it arises from the union of the three and because it does not endure.

original: de las lta bu ni dbang po ste /
analyzed: de las lta bu ni dbang po ste /
translated: The eye is like a visual distortion,

original: de skye ba'i gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de skye ba'i gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the basis of the arising of that.

original: yul lta bu ni sprin no //
analyzed: yul lta bu ni sprin no //
translated: The object is like a mirage,

original: chu lta bu ni rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: chu lta bu ni rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: consciousness is like a dream,

original: char pas btab pa lta bu ni reg pa'o //
analyzed: char pas btab pa lta bu ni reg pa'o //
translated: contact is like a magical creation,

original: chu'i chu bur lta bu ni tshor ba ste /
analyzed: chu'i chu bur lta bu ni tshor ba ste /
translated: and feeling is like a water bubble.

original: myur du 'gag pa dang mi gnas pa'o //
analyzed: myur du 'gag pa dang mi gnas pa'o //
translated: It is quickly destroyed and does not last.

original: 'du shes smig rgyu lta bu ni g-yo ba'i bdag nyid dang / rnam pa @40b du ma 'byung ba dang / dmigs pa la phyin ci log tu byed pa dang / skyes pa dang bud med la sogs pa yongs su gcod pa'i tshul gyis yul gsal bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'du shes smig rgyu lta bu ni g-yo ba'i bdag nyid dang / rnam pa @40b du ma 'byung ba dang / dmigs pa la phyin ci log tu byed pa dang / skyes pa dang bud med la sogs pa yongs su gcod pa'i tshul gyis yul gsal bar byed pa'o //
translated: Perception is like a mirage, because it is the basis for the appearance of the object, since it is the cause for the arising of the idea of the object, and because it is the cause for the appearance of the object.

original: ji ltar na 'du byed rnams chu shing lta bu yin zhe na /üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'du byed rnams chu shing lta bu yin zhe na / 'di lta ste /
translated: How are the formations like a plantain tree?üîΩA man with eyes

original: skyes bu mig dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa nyan thos so ;
analyzed: skyes bu mig dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa nyan thos so ;
translated: means a noble disciple.üîΩA sharp axe

original: sta re rnon po zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi mtshon cha'o //
analyzed: sta re rnon po zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi mtshon cha'o //
translated: means the weapon of wisdom.üîΩHe enters the forest

original: tshal du 'jug ces bya ba ni 'gro ba lngar gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: tshal du 'jug ces bya ba ni 'gro ba lngar gtogs pa'o //
translated: means he enters the five destinies.üîΩThe trunk of the plantain tree

original: chu shing gi sdong po zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal sna tshogs kyi lus shing dang chos mthun pa'o //
analyzed: chu shing gi sdong po zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal sna tshogs kyi lus shing dang chos mthun pa'o //
translated: means the body, which is similar to a tree in that it is a collection of various sufferings.üîΩA fresh, straight trunk

original: sar pa drang po zhes bya ba ni bdag byed pa po dang za ba por lta ba'o //
analyzed: sar pa drang po zhes bya ba ni bdag byed pa po dang za ba por lta ba'o //
translated: means the view that the self is an agent and an experiencer.

original: des de drung nas bcad nas zhes bya ba ni bdag tu lta ba spong ba'o //
analyzed: des de drung nas bcad nas zhes bya ba ni bdag tu lta ba spong ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHaving torn it away from him‚Äù means having abandoned the view of self.

original: lo ma'i glegs bu rnam par bshig ste zhes bya ba ni sems pa du ma'i 'du byed rnam par smin pa tsam du rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'o //
analyzed: lo ma'i glegs bu rnam par bshig ste zhes bya ba ni sems pa du ma'i 'du byed rnam par smin pa tsam du rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHaving unraveled the layers of bark‚Äù means having analyzed the many volitions into mere results of evolution.

original: des de'i snying po ma yin pa yang mi rnyed na zhes bya ba ni de dag dus gzhan du mi gnas pa'o //
analyzed: des de'i snying po ma yin pa yang mi rnyed na zhes bya ba ni de dag dus gzhan du mi gnas pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHe does not find even the inner bark‚Äù means that they do not remain for a second instant.

original: snying po lta zhig smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba ni shin tu rtag pa dang brtan pa'i bdag dang byed pa po dang za ba po ga la snang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: snying po lta zhig smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba ni shin tu rtag pa dang brtan pa'i bdag dang byed pa po dang za ba po ga la snang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWhat need is there to speak of the heartwood?‚Äù means that the appearance of a permanent, stable self, an agent and experiencer, is utterly impossible.

original: ji ltar na rnam par shes pa sgyu ma lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na rnam par shes pa sgyu ma lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: How is consciousness like an illusion?

original: sgyu ma byed pa zhes bya ba ni bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dang mi g-yo bar nye bar 'gro ba'i rnam par shes pa'i tshig bla dags so //
analyzed: sgyu ma byed pa zhes bya ba ni bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dang mi g-yo bar nye bar 'gro ba'i rnam par shes pa'i tshig bla dags so //
translated: ‚ÄúThe creator of the illusion‚Äù is a reference to consciousness, which is the basis for the evolution of merit, demerit, and imperturbability.

original: lam po che'i bzhi mdor 'dug ste zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa gnas pa bzhi la brten pa'o //
analyzed: lam po che'i bzhi mdor 'dug ste zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa gnas pa bzhi la brten pa'o //
translated: Sitting at the crossroads of the great road means based on the four abodes of consciousness.

original: sgyu ma rnam pa bzhi byed ces bya ba ni ji ltar de dag tu glang po che'i tshogs la sogs pa snang pa'o //
analyzed: sgyu ma rnam pa bzhi byed ces bya ba ni ji ltar de dag tu glang po che'i tshogs la sogs pa snang pa'o //
translated: Creating the four kinds of magical creations means that, just as a collection of elephants and so on appear there,

analyzed: glang po che la sogs pa'i tshogs de dag yongs su grub pa ma yin pa de bzhin du ;
translated: those collections of elephants and so on are not real.üîΩIn the same way, the four abodes of consciousness that go to merit, demerit, and stability, and manifest the bodies of hell beings and so on, are not real.

original: bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dang mi g-yo ba nye bar 'gro ba'i rnam par shes pa gnas pa bzhi la brten cing dmyal ba la sogs pa'i lus ston pa de yang mi snang bar 'gyur ba'i phyir de nyid kyis de'i lus yongs su grub pa
analyzed: bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dang mi g-yo ba nye bar 'gro ba'i rnam par shes pa gnas pa bzhi la brten cing dmyal ba la sogs pa'i lus ston pa de yang mi snang bar 'gyur ba'i phyir de nyid kyis de'i lus yongs su grub pa
translated: Because they do not appear, their bodies are not real,

original: med de / sgyu ma'i gzugs bzhin no //
analyzed: med de / sgyu ma'i gzugs bzhin no //
translated: like the forms in a magical creation.

original: dkar po'i phyogs kyi rnam grangs rdzogs so /
analyzed: dkar po'i phyogs kyi rnam grangs rdzogs so /

analyzed: ches 'gras ni rgas pa'i gnas skabs kyi bar gang yin pa'o //

analyzed: phung po rnyed pa ni ming dang gzugs kyi gnas skabs so //

analyzed: khams rnyed pa ni de nyid du de'i sa bon rnyed pa'o //

analyzed: skye mched rnyed pa ni ming dang gzungs 'phal bas skye mched drug yongs su rdzogs pa'o //

analyzed: phung po mngon par 'grub pa ni 'byung ba nas bzung ste rgas pa'i bar ro //

analyzed: srog gi dbang po byung ba ni ris mthun pa snga ma yongs su btang ste ris mthun pa gsar gyi tshe yongs su 'dzin pa'o //

analyzed: rga ba ni na tshod yongs su gyur pas 'gro ba na rdeg 'cha' zhing 'gyel ba'o //

analyzed: mgo skya ni skra dang ba sbu ma tshang zhing mdog dkar ba dang ser ba'o //

original: gnyer mas gang ba ni pags pa 'khums pa'o //
analyzed: gnyer mas gang ba ni pags pa 'khums pa'o //

analyzed: rnying pa ni na tshod yongs su gyur pa nyid mdangs med cing skya bor gyur pa gang yin pa'o //

original: gzhom pa ni mthu dang brtson 'grus dang stobs dang rtsal med ba'o //
analyzed: gzhom pa ni mthu dang brtson 'grus dang stobs dang rtsal med ba'o //

analyzed: sgur po phyam sgur po ltar yo ba ni lus mdun du sgu ba gang yin pa ste /

analyzed: khar bal brten pa gang yin pa'o //

analyzed: lus sme ba nag pos gang ba ni sme ba nag po dag gis lus bkra bar byas pa'o //

analyzed: nyam dma' ba ni yul dag la dbang po rnams rgyu ba mi mang ba'o //

analyzed: nyams pa ni dran pa dang blo mi mang ba'o ;

analyzed: rnyings pa ni de dag nyid gzhan du 'gyur ba'o //

original: 'chi 'pho ba ni 'chi ka nyid do //
analyzed: 'chi 'pho ba ni 'chi ka nyid do //

analyzed: zhig pa ni gang zhig na lus ror 'dug pa'o //

original: nub pa ni gang na mi gnas pa'o //
analyzed: nub pa ni gang na mi gnas pa'o //

original: nub pa ni ming gi lus so //

analyzed: zhag bdun lon pa'o //

analyzed: bdag gir 'dzin pas ni nye bar chags par 'gyur ro //
