analyzed: 'di ltar rjes su chags pa @42b la sogs pas so so'i mtshan ma'i rjes su 'brang bas de la kun tu sbyor bar byed pa'o //
translated: For example, the fetters of attachment, etc., are fetters because they bind one to the object by pursuing its specific characteristics.

original: kun tu sbyor ba rnams nang yang phan tshun 'dren par byed pa yin pa'i phyir kun tu sbyor bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: kun tu sbyor ba rnams nang yang phan tshun 'dren par byed pa yin pa'i phyir kun tu sbyor bar byed pa'o //
translated: The fetters are also fetters because they mutually bind one to the fetters.

original: kun tu sbyor ba'i gzhi mthong ba'i chos kyi kha na ma tho bskyed par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: kun tu sbyor ba'i gzhi mthong ba'i chos kyi kha na ma tho bskyed par 'gyur zhing /
translated: The entity that is the basis of the fetters is the basis of the fetters.

original: de las skyes pa sems las byung ba'i sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba'i bar du yang so sor myong bar byed do //
analyzed: de las skyes pa sems las byung ba'i sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba'i bar du yang so sor myong bar byed do //
translated: The fetters arise from it, and one experiences the suffering and mental pain that arise from them.üîΩThe entity that is the cause of the fetters is the cause of the fetters.

original: de'i phyir kha na ma tho ba med pa'i phyir dngos po la yang kun tu sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir kha na ma tho ba med pa'i phyir dngos po la yang kun tu sbyor bar byed do //
translated: Therefore, one is bound to the object because there is no offense in that.

original: ma 'ongs pa na 'dod chags drag po la sogs pa'i ngo bo'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir rgyu mthun pa la yang kun tu sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa na 'dod chags drag po la sogs pa'i ngo bo'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir rgyu mthun pa la yang kun tu sbyor bar byed do //
translated: One is bound to the natural outcome because it becomes the cause of the nature of strong passion, etc., in the future.

original: 'gro ba lnga len pa'i phyir 'gro ba rnams su kun tu sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: 'gro ba lnga len pa'i phyir 'gro ba rnams su kun tu sbyor bar byed do //
translated: One is bound to the destinies because one grasps the five destinies.

original: de'i rgyu las nyes par spyod pa kun tu spyod pa'i phyir bdag la gzhan gyis dbyung pa dang / bsad pa dang / bcing ba dang / brdeg pa dang / spyo ba dang / spyugs pa la sogs pa'i gnod pa skyed pa'i phyir bdag la gnod par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de'i rgyu las nyes par spyod pa kun tu spyod pa'i phyir bdag la gzhan gyis dbyung pa dang / bsad pa dang / bcing ba dang / brdeg pa dang / spyo ba dang / spyugs pa la sogs pa'i gnod pa skyed pa'i phyir bdag la gnod par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: One is bound to harm oneself because one engages in misconduct due to its cause, and thus one generates harm for oneself, such as being expelled, killed, bound, beaten, reviled, banished, and so on, by others.

original: bdag la ma yin yang gzhan la skyed pas gzhan la gnod par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: bdag la ma yin yang gzhan la skyed pas gzhan la gnod par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: One is bound to harm others because one generates harm for others, even though it is not for oneself.

original: gnyis ka la skyed pas na gnyis ka la gnod par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gnyis ka la skyed pas na gnyis ka la gnod par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: One is bound to harm both because one generates harm for both.

original: mthong ba'i chos kyi kha na ma tho ba skyed par byed ces bya ba de ni ji skad du smos pa de nyid yin te /
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos kyi kha na ma tho ba skyed par byed ces bya ba de ni ji skad du smos pa de nyid yin te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúproduces offense in this life‚Äù means just what it says.

original: des gdon mi za bar ngan song du 'gro ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: des gdon mi za bar ngan song du 'gro ba ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not certain that one will go to the lower realms.

original: tshe phyi ma la ni gang gzhan dag gis 'di la mi shes kyang de'i rgyu can gyis ni ngan song du 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: tshe phyi ma la ni gang gzhan dag gis 'di la mi shes kyang de'i rgyu can gyis ni ngan song du 'gro ba'o //
translated: In a future life, one will go to the lower realms because of the cause of that offense, even though others may not know about it.

original: gang gzhan dag gis 'di la shes kyang ngan song du yang 'gro ba ni mthong ba'i chos dang tshe phyi ma gnyis ka yin no //
analyzed: gang gzhan dag gis 'di la shes kyang ngan song du yang 'gro ba ni mthong ba'i chos dang tshe phyi ma gnyis ka yin no //
translated: But if others do know about it, one will go to the lower realms because of that offense in this life and in a future life.

original: de las skyes pa'i sems las byung ba sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba ni chags par gyur pa rnams kyi ji lta ba bzhin du mi 'byor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las skyes pa'i sems las byung ba sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba ni chags par gyur pa rnams kyi ji lta ba bzhin du mi 'byor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The mental factors of pain and sorrow that arise from that offense are not experienced by those who are attached.

original: gtso cher ni kun tu sbyor ba dgu kho na'o //üîΩ'dod dgur mi byed pa'i don gyis na ching ba gsum ste /
analyzed: gtso cher ni kun tu sbyor ba dgu kho na'o // 'dod dgur mi byed pa'i don gyis na ching ba gsum ste /
translated: The principal fetters are nine in number.

original: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug rnams so //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug rnams so //
translated: The three bonds are desire, hatred, and ignorance, in the sense that they do not allow one to act as one wishes.

original: tshor ba gsum gyi dbang du byas pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: tshor ba gsum gyi dbang du byas pa'i phyir te /
translated: because they are governed by the three feelings.

original: de dag gis ni de dag las thar par 'dod kyang mi 'grol lo //
analyzed: de dag gis ni de dag las thar par 'dod kyang mi 'grol lo //
translated: Even though they desire liberation from those, they are not liberated.

original: nyon mongs pa'i phyogs kyi gnas ngan len sa bon dang mthun par gyur pa ni bag la nyal te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i phyogs kyi gnas ngan len sa bon dang mthun par gyur pa ni bag la nyal te /
translated: The latent afflictions are the seeds that are the negative propensities of the side of affliction.

original: rjes su 'brel pa phra ba'i don gyis so //
analyzed: rjes su 'brel pa phra ba'i don gyis so //
translated: They are called latent because they have the meaning of subtle connection.

original: rtsa ba smos pa'i phyir na bdun no //üîΩnyon mongs pa las skyes pa'i phyir dang / @43a * //
analyzed: rtsa ba smos pa'i phyir na bdun no // nyon mongs pa las skyes pa'i phyir dang / @43a * //
translated: There are seven because they are mentioned as roots.

original: nyon mongs pa dang nye bar gyur pa'i phyir dang / sems kyi rgyun nye bar nyon mongs par byed pa'i phyir na nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang nye bar gyur pa'i phyir dang / sems kyi rgyun nye bar nyon mongs par byed pa'i phyir na nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams te /
translated: The secondary afflictions are so called because they arise from the afflictions, because they are close to the afflictions, and because they afflict the continuum of mind.

original: bag la nyal ma gtogs pa sems las byung ba nyon mongs pa can rnams so //
analyzed: bag la nyal ma gtogs pa sems las byung ba nyon mongs pa can rnams so //
translated: They are the afflicted mental factors except for the latent afflictions.

original: skye ba'i rgyun mi chad pa'i don gyis na kun nas dkris pa rnams te ngo tsha ba med pa la sogs pa brgyad do //
analyzed: skye ba'i rgyun mi chad pa'i don gyis na kun nas dkris pa rnams te ngo tsha ba med pa la sogs pa brgyad do //
translated: The entanglements are so called because they are the cause of the continuum of birth. They are the eight such as shamelessness.

original: de dag ni shin tu rgyun chags par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni shin tu rgyun chags par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are very continuous.üîΩ

original: lus dang sems las su mi rung bar byed pa'i phyir tha ba rnams te /
analyzed: lus dang sems las su mi rung bar byed pa'i phyir tha ba rnams te /
translated: They are called thorns because they make the body and mind unserviceable.

original: las su mi rung ba'i zhing rtsub po bzhin no //
analyzed: las su mi rung ba'i zhing rtsub po bzhin no //
translated: They are like a rough field that is unserviceable.

original: rten gyi bye brag gis ni the tshom gyi bye brag sems kyi tha ba rnam pa lnga'o //
analyzed: rten gyi bye brag gis ni the tshom gyi bye brag sems kyi tha ba rnam pa lnga'o //
translated: The five kinds of mental thorns are distinctions of doubt due to distinctions in the basis.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa gsum ni mi gtsang bar byed pa'i phyir na dri ma rnams so //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa gsum ni mi gtsang bar byed pa'i phyir na dri ma rnams so //
translated: The three beginning with passion are called stains because they make the mind unpurified.

original: skye mched rnams kyi sgo nas rtag tu 'dzag pa'i phyir dang drag tu gnod par byed pa'i phyir na rtag 'dzag rnams so //
analyzed: skye mched rnams kyi sgo nas rtag tu 'dzag pa'i phyir dang drag tu gnod par byed pa'i phyir na rtag 'dzag rnams so //
translated: They are called constant drippers because they constantly drip through the sense-spheres and because they harm strongly.

original: ma zhi bar byed pa'i phyir na zug rngu rnams te zug rngu ma phyung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: ma zhi bar byed pa'i phyir na zug rngu rnams te zug rngu ma phyung ba bzhin no //
translated: They are called arrows because they make one uneasy, like an arrow that has not been extracted.

original: btang snyoms kyi bar chad byed pa'i phyir dang / spros pa dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir na ci yang rnams so //
analyzed: btang snyoms kyi bar chad byed pa'i phyir dang / spros pa dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir na ci yang rnams so //
translated: They are called irritants because they obstruct equanimity and because they are associated with elaboration.

original: chos ma yin ba dang mi mthun pa'i spyod pa nye bar gnas pa'i phyir na nyes par spyod pa rnams so //
analyzed: chos ma yin ba dang mi mthun pa'i spyod pa nye bar gnas pa'i phyir na nyes par spyod pa rnams so //
translated: They are called ‚Äúmisconduct‚Äù because they are the basis for the practice of what is not Dharma.

original: nyon mongs pa dang nyes par spyod pa kun nas slong bar byed pa'i phyir na rtsa ba rnams so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang nyes par spyod pa kun nas slong bar byed pa'i phyir na rtsa ba rnams so //
translated: They are called ‚Äúroots‚Äù because they are the motivating force of the afflictions and misconduct.

original: phyi ma la skye ba skyed pa'i phyir na zag pa rnams so //
analyzed: phyi ma la skye ba skyed pa'i phyir na zag pa rnams so //
translated: They are called ‚Äúoutflows‚Äù because they produce birth in the future.

original: skyes pa la rga ba dang 'chi ba la sogs pas gnod pa byed pa'i phyir na gnod pa rnams so //
analyzed: skyes pa la rga ba dang 'chi ba la sogs pas gnod pa byed pa'i phyir na gnod pa rnams so //
translated: They are called ‚Äúdistress‚Äù because they harm what has already arisen, such as aging and death.

original: mi sdug pa dang phrad pa dang / sdug pa dang bral ba dang / 'dod pa mi rnyed pa dag gis yongs su gdungs pa'i phyir na yongs su gdung ba rnams so //
analyzed: mi sdug pa dang phrad pa dang / sdug pa dang bral ba dang / 'dod pa mi rnyed pa dag gis yongs su gdungs pa'i phyir na yongs su gdung ba rnams so //
translated: They are called ‚Äúdistress‚Äù because they torment through contact with what is unpleasant, separation from what is pleasant, and not getting what one wants.

original: mya ngan dang smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug par byed pa'i phyir na 'khrug pa rnams so //
analyzed: mya ngan dang smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug par byed pa'i phyir na 'khrug pa rnams so //
translated: They are called ‚Äúdistress‚Äù because they cause sorrow, lamentation, suffering, unhappiness, and agitation.

original: rgyun phyogs su khyer bar byed pa'i phyir na chu bo rnams so //
analyzed: rgyun phyogs su khyer bar byed pa'i phyir na chu bo rnams so //
translated: They are called ‚Äúfloods‚Äù because they carry one along with the stream.

original: sngon gyi mtha' nas bzung ste mthong ba'i chos la skye ba dang 'khor ba'i thabs su gyur pa'i phyir na sbyor ba rnams so //
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' nas bzung ste mthong ba'i chos la skye ba dang 'khor ba'i thabs su gyur pa'i phyir na sbyor ba rnams so //
translated: They are called fetters because they are the means of producing and transmigrating in the present life, from the point of view of the past.

original: da ltar byung ba nas bzung ste ma 'ongs pa'i thabs su gyur pa'i phyir na nye bar len pa rnams so //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba nas bzung ste ma 'ongs pa'i thabs su gyur pa'i phyir na nye bar len pa rnams so //
translated: They are called appropriative clusters because they are the means of producing the future, from the point of view of the present.

original: dgrol bar dka' ba'i phyir na mdud pa rnams so //
analyzed: dgrol bar dka' ba'i phyir na mdud pa rnams so //
translated: They are called knots because they are difficult to untie.

original: shes bya'i dngos po la shes pa'i sgrib par gyur pa'i phyir na sgrib pa rnams so //
analyzed: shes bya'i dngos po la shes pa'i sgrib par gyur pa'i phyir na sgrib pa rnams so //
translated: They are called obstructions because they are the obstructions to the knowledge of the real.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams tshun chad kyi cha ni @43b 'dod pa'i khams so //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams tshun chad kyi cha ni @43b 'dod pa'i khams so //
translated: The desire realm is the part up to the form and formless realms.

original: bsgom pa'i lam tshun chad kyi cha ni mthong ba'i lam mo //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam tshun chad kyi cha ni mthong ba'i lam mo //
translated: The path of vision is the part up to the path of cultivation.

original: de gnyis ni tha ma yang yin la cha yang yin te /
analyzed: de gnyis ni tha ma yang yin la cha yang yin te /
translated: These two are the end and the part.

original: de'i phyir ci rigs par tshun chad kyi cha dang mthun pa'am tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa'i sgrib pa lnga yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir ci rigs par tshun chad kyi cha dang mthun pa'am tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa'i sgrib pa lnga yin no //
translated: Therefore, the five obstructions are the obstructions that are the part up to the end, as the case may be.

original: de las bzlog pa ni gong ma'i cha dang mthun pa rnams so //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni gong ma'i cha dang mthun pa rnams so //
translated: The opposite of that are the factors conducive to the higher realms.

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag skye ba'i ba gegs byed pa'i phyir rnam par 'ching ba rnams te lus la lta ba la sogs pa rnam pa lnga'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag skye ba'i ba gegs byed pa'i phyir rnam par 'ching ba rnams te lus la lta ba la sogs pa rnam pa lnga'o //
translated: The fetters are so called because they obstruct the arising of the noble path. They are the five types of views, etc.

original: chung du'i char gtogs pa rnams la yang rab tu rgya skyed pa'i phyir na me rnams so //
analyzed: chung du'i char gtogs pa rnams la yang rab tu rgya skyed pa'i phyir na me rnams so //
translated: The bonds are so called because they increase the small portion of the afflictions.

original: srid pa'i rtse mor song ba rnams la yang nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa thams cad 'phel bar byed pa'i phyir dang / dam pa rnams kyis ring du yongs su spang bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mor song ba rnams la yang nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa thams cad 'phel bar byed pa'i phyir dang / dam pa rnams kyis ring du yongs su spang bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The entanglements are so called because they increase all the types of afflictions up to the peak of existence, and because they are thoroughly abandoned by the noble ones.

original: lus dang sems kun tu gdung bar byed pa'i phyir na rims nad rnams so //
analyzed: lus dang sems kun tu gdung bar byed pa'i phyir na rims nad rnams so //
translated: The fevers are so called because they torment the body and mind.

original: 'jig tshogs len pa'i phyir na kun tu len pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs len pa'i phyir na kun tu len pa rnams so //
translated: The clingings are so called because they cling to the perishable collection.

original: nags zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal sna tshogs kyi phung po'i lus mngon par sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: nags zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal sna tshogs kyi phung po'i lus mngon par sgrub pa'o //
translated: The forest is so called because it is the body that is the mass of various sufferings.

original: nags sbyor ni de skyed par byed pa'i chags pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: nags sbyor ni de skyed par byed pa'i chags pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The forest thicket is the passion that produces it.

original: 'thab mo la sogs pas rnam pa sna tshogs rtsom pa'i phyir na 'thab pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'thab mo la sogs pas rnam pa sna tshogs rtsom pa'i phyir na 'thab pa rnams so //
translated: They are quarrels because they are the origin of various kinds of strife.

original: rig pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa'i phyir na nag po'o //
analyzed: rig pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa'i phyir na nag po'o //
translated: They are black because they are adverse to knowledge.

original: sdug bsngal dang ldan pa'i phyir na phung po'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang ldan pa'i phyir na phung po'o //
translated: They are aggregates because they are associated with suffering.

original: dgos pa med pa'i phyir na dman pa'o //
analyzed: dgos pa med pa'i phyir na dman pa'o //
translated: They are inferior because they are purposeless.

original: nyon mongs pa can yin pa'i phyir na kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can yin pa'i phyir na kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa'o //
translated: They are reprehensible because they are defiled.

original: btsal bar gsha' ba ma yin pa'i phyir na yongs su spang bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: btsal bar gsha' ba ma yin pa'i phyir na yongs su spang bar bya ba'o //
translated: They are to be abandoned because they are not to be sought.

original: tshul khrims 'chal pa ni mnos pa nyams par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshul khrims 'chal pa ni mnos pa nyams par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are immoral because they violate the precepts.

original: sdig pa'i chos ni ngo tsha mi shes pa dang / khrel med pa drag pos sangs rgyas la sogs pa la ma dad pa dang / 'phags pa la skur pa 'debs pa la sogs pa log par lta ba dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: sdig pa'i chos ni ngo tsha mi shes pa dang / khrel med pa drag pos sangs rgyas la sogs pa la ma dad pa dang / 'phags pa la skur pa 'debs pa la sogs pa log par lta ba dang ldan pa'o //
translated: They are sinful because they are associated with wrong views, such as lack of faith in the Buddha, etc., and blasphemy of the noble ones, etc., through the force of strong shamelessness and lack of abashment.

original: yang na sdig pa'i chos sna tshogs pa kun tu spyod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yang na sdig pa'i chos sna tshogs pa kun tu spyod pa'i phyir te /
translated: Or else, they are called ‚Äúrotten inside‚Äù because they engage in various kinds of evil conduct.

original: brnab sems dang ldan pa yin /
analyzed: brnab sems dang ldan pa yin /
translated: They are covetous,

original: gnod sems can gyi sems zhes bya ba dang mthun par sbyar ro //
analyzed: gnod sems can gyi sems zhes bya ba dang mthun par sbyar ro //
translated: and they have a mind that is full of malice.

original: khong myags pa ni phyi dge slong gi rtags 'chang ba'i phyir ba dang / nang na dge sbyong du byed pa'i chos med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: khong myags pa ni phyi dge slong gi rtags 'chang ba'i phyir ba dang / nang na dge sbyong du byed pa'i chos med pa'i phyir te /
translated: They are rotten inside because they bear the outward signs of a monk, but they lack the inner qualities that make one a true spiritual practitioner.

original: dper na shing phyi rol mdog bzang po yin la /
analyzed: dper na shing phyi rol mdog bzang po yin la /
translated: For example, a tree may have an attractive outer appearance,

original: nang ni srin bu la sogs pas zos shing khong stong du byas pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: nang ni srin bu la sogs pas zos shing khong stong du byas pa lta bu'o //
translated: but its inner core may be hollowed out by insects and other creatures.

original: nyes 'dzag ni ji ltar nyes 'dzag dang nyes @44a * //
analyzed: nyes 'dzag ni ji ltar nyes 'dzag dang nyes @44a * //
translated: They are like a leaking boat,

original: 'dzag ma yin pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs las byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: 'dzag ma yin pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs las byung ba bzhin no //
translated: as explained in the sutra on the classification of dharmas that are leaks and are not leaks.üîΩThey are like water that is polluted by a rotten log,

original: shing rul gyis brnyogs pa'i chu lta bur gyur pa zhes bya ba ni des thos pa gzung bar gyur pa gang yin pa de ni sred pa sel ba'i phyir chu lta bu yin la /
analyzed: shing rul gyis brnyogs pa'i chu lta bur gyur pa zhes bya ba ni des thos pa gzung bar gyur pa gang yin pa de ni sred pa sel ba'i phyir chu lta bu yin la /
translated: because the water-like teachings that they have heard are polluted by craving.

original: de'i de ni 'chal pa'i tshul khrims la sogs pa'i shing rul gyis brnyogs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i de ni 'chal pa'i tshul khrims la sogs pa'i shing rul gyis brnyogs pa'o //
translated: The water of the Dharma is disturbed by the rotten wood of immorality, etc.

original: de'i phyir shing rul gyis brnyogs pa'i chu bzhin du 'tsho bar byed pa ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir shing rul gyis brnyogs pa'i chu bzhin du 'tsho bar byed pa ma yin pa ste /
translated: Therefore, it is not fit to be drunk, like water disturbed by rotten wood.

original: gzhan dag gis yongs su spang bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag gis yongs su spang bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is to be rejected by others.

original: lung bong ltar spyod pa ni dge sbyong 'dus pa dag tu rnyed pa dang tshul shing nod pa dang / mal cha dang stan 'ged pa dag la lo'i dang po'i dus tsam zhig brjod pa'i phyir ro //üîΩdge sbyong ma yin par dge sbyong du khas 'che ba ni dge slong gi ngo bo las nyams pa dge slong gi ngo bor khas 'che ba'i phyir ba'am /
analyzed: lung bong ltar spyod pa ni dge sbyong 'dus pa dag tu rnyed pa dang tshul shing nod pa dang / mal cha dang stan 'ged pa dag la lo'i dang po'i dus tsam zhig brjod pa'i phyir ro // dge sbyong ma yin par dge sbyong du khas 'che ba ni dge slong gi ngo bo las nyams pa dge slong gi ngo bor khas 'che ba'i phyir ba'am /
translated: He is like an ass in the assembly of monks, because he is only mentioned at the time of the distribution of the robes and bedding.üîΩHe is a sham ascetic, a hypocrite, because he claims to be an ascetic, though he has fallen from the nature of an ascetic.

original: nang ste /'dug pa ni 'khrugs pa'i mjug tu gdong khro gnyer dang bcas par gnas shing tshig tu mi smra ba'o //
analyzed: nang ste /'dug pa ni 'khrugs pa'i mjug tu gdong khro gnyer dang bcas par gnas shing tshig tu mi smra ba'o //
translated: Inner means to remain with a frowning face at the conclusion of agitation, without speaking.

original: 'khrug pa kun tu skyed par byed pa ni gnod par byed pa'i rgyu'i rjes su 'brang bas yang dang yar du khon du 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: 'khrug pa kun tu skyed par byed pa ni gnod par byed pa'i rgyu'i rjes su 'brang bas yang dang yar du khon du 'dzin pa'o //
translated: To generate agitation is to hold a grudge again and again by following the cause of harm.

original: nyon mongs pa byung na sems kun nas nyon mongs par byed pas de'i phyir sdug bsngal bar gnas pa ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa byung na sems kun nas nyon mongs par byed pas de'i phyir sdug bsngal bar gnas pa ste /
translated: When the afflictions arise, the mind is completely afflicted, and therefore one remains in suffering.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: dge slong dag sdig pa dang 'dres pa dag gis ni le lo can sdug bsngal bar gnas so zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dge slong dag sdig pa dang 'dres pa dag gis ni le lo can sdug bsngal bar gnas so zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: ‚ÄúMonks, the lazy remain in suffering due to being mixed with evil.‚Äù

original: ma 'ongs pa'i sdug bsngal len pas de'i phyir sdug bsngal dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i sdug bsngal len pas de'i phyir sdug bsngal dang bcas pa'o //
translated: Because it takes on future suffering, therefore it is associated with suffering.

original: dge ba'i phyogs las ring du byed pas de'i phyir gnod pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i phyogs las ring du byed pas de'i phyir gnod pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: It is accompanied by harm because it is far removed from the side of virtue.

original: nyon mongs pa gzhan gyi rgyu yin pas de'i phyir 'tshe ba dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa gzhan gyi rgyu yin pas de'i phyir 'tshe ba dang bcas pa'o //
translated: It is accompanied by violence because it is the cause of other defilements.

original: 'gyod par byed pa'i phyir yongs su gdung ba dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: 'gyod par byed pa'i phyir yongs su gdung ba dang bcas pa'o //
translated: It is accompanied by remorse because it is the cause of regret.

original: yang smras pa /
analyzed: yang smras pa /
translated: Moreover, it is said:

original: sdug bsngal zhes bya ba ni bstan @46a * //
analyzed: sdug bsngal zhes bya ba ni bstan @46a * //
translated: Suffering is the teaching.

original: pa'o ; / sdug bsngal dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: pa'o ; / sdug bsngal dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba dang ldan pa'o //
translated: It is accompanied by suffering because it is associated with pain and mental anguish.

original: gnod pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni bde ba'i tshor ba rnam par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gnod pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni bde ba'i tshor ba rnam par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: It is accompanied by harm because it is the transformation of the feeling of pleasure.

original: 'tshe ba dang bcas pa ni bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba la de gnyi ga las ma thar pa'o //
analyzed: 'tshe ba dang bcas pa ni bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba la de gnyi ga las ma thar pa'o //
translated: It is accompanied by violence because it is not free from both of them in the feeling that is neither pleasant nor unpleasant.

original: yongs su gdung ba dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni bde ba la sogs pa dag la ci rigs par 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gi mes so //
analyzed: yongs su gdung ba dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni bde ba la sogs pa dag la ci rigs par 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gi mes so //
translated: It is accompanied by remorse because it is the fire of attachment, hatred and delusion with regard to pleasure, etc., as is appropriate.

original: yang 'das pa ni sdug bsngal dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: yang 'das pa ni sdug bsngal dang bcas pa'o //
translated: Moreover, the past is associated with suffering.

original: ma 'ongs pa la ni gnod pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa la ni gnod pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The future is associated with harm.

original: gsod par byed pa zhes bya ba ni cher 'khon du yongs su 'dzin pa ston par byed do //
analyzed: gsod par byed pa zhes bya ba ni cher 'khon du yongs su 'dzin pa ston par byed do //
translated: The expression ‚Äúto kill‚Äù shows a great hatred.

original: phyir rgol ba dang dgra bo zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: phyir rgol ba dang dgra bo zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The expressions ‚Äúenemy‚Äù and ‚Äúadversary‚Äù are as above.

original: pham pa ni skyes bu'i rtsal ma skyes pa skye ba dang 'gal bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: pham pa ni skyes bu'i rtsal ma skyes pa skye ba dang 'gal bar byed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTo defeat‚Äù is to prevent the arising of a man‚Äôs strength that has not yet arisen.

original: zhom pa ni skyes pa dang gnas pa dang 'gal bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: zhom pa ni skyes pa dang gnas pa dang 'gal bar byed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTo weaken‚Äù is to prevent the arising and the endurance of strength that has arisen.

original: 'jigs par byed pa ni yang dang yang du mngon du phyogs pa'o //üîΩgzhan rgyal ba ni rtsal ma skyes pa skye ba dang 'gal bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'jigs par byed pa ni yang dang yang du mngon du phyogs pa'o // gzhan rgyal ba ni rtsal ma skyes pa skye ba dang 'gal bar byed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTo terrify‚Äù is to cause one to turn away again and again.üîΩ‚ÄúTo conquer‚Äù is to prevent the arising of strength that has not yet arisen.

original: rgyab kyis bstan pa ni rtsal skyes pa gnas pa dang 'gal bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: rgyab kyis bstan pa ni rtsal skyes pa gnas pa dang 'gal bar byed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTo turn one‚Äôs back‚Äù is to prevent the endurance of strength that has arisen.

original: ngan par zhom pa dang / rnam par zhom pa dang / bye brag tu bcom pa dang / gnod pa dang / bsgyel ba zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di dag gi don ni tshig 'di dag gis rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ngan par zhom pa dang / rnam par zhom pa dang / bye brag tu bcom pa dang / gnod pa dang / bsgyel ba zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di dag gi don ni tshig 'di dag gis rig par bya'o //
translated: The meaning of the terms ‚Äúto be broken,‚Äù ‚Äúto be crushed,‚Äù ‚Äúto be destroyed,‚Äù ‚Äúto be harmed,‚Äù and ‚Äúto be overturned‚Äù should be understood according to the way these terms are used in ordinary language.

original: sngon gyi mtha' mi shes pa ni 'das pa'i 'du byed rnams la mi rtag pa nyid du mi shes pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' mi shes pa ni 'das pa'i 'du byed rnams la mi rtag pa nyid du mi shes pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Ignorance of the prior limit is the non-understanding of the impermanence of past formations.

original: phyi ma'i mtha' ni da ltar byung ba rnams la zad pa'i chos nyid du mi shes pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: phyi ma'i mtha' ni da ltar byung ba rnams la zad pa'i chos nyid du mi shes pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Ignorance of the later limit is the non-understanding of the nature of cessation in present formations.

original: sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' ni ma 'ongs pa rnams skye ba'i chos nyid dang skyes pa rnams zad pa'i chos nyid du mi shes pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' ni ma 'ongs pa rnams skye ba'i chos nyid dang skyes pa rnams zad pa'i chos nyid du mi shes pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Ignorance of both the prior and later limits is the non-understanding of the nature of the arising of future formations and the nature of the cessation of arisen formations.

original: de de ltar ma shes pas sngon gyi mtha' la sogs pa las brtsams nas ci bdag 'das pa'i dus nas byung bar gyur ram zhes bya ba rgyas par tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed de /
analyzed: de de ltar ma shes pas sngon gyi mtha' la sogs pa las brtsams nas ci bdag 'das pa'i dus nas byung bar gyur ram zhes bya ba rgyas par tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed de /
translated: Because of this non-understanding, one reflects improperly, beginning with the prior limit, ‚ÄúDid I exist in the past or did I not exist in the past?‚Äù and so on.

original: ji ltar 'dug / ji lta bur 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar 'dug / ji lta bur 'gyur /
translated: How do they exist? How do they come to be?

original: sems can 'di dag ga las 'ongs /
analyzed: sems can 'di dag ga las 'ongs /
translated: Where do these sentient beings come from?üîΩWhere will they go after they die?

original: 'di nas shi 'phos nas gang du 'gro bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba 'di ni sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' las brtsams nas tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'di nas shi 'phos nas gang du 'gro bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba 'di ni sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' las brtsams nas tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa'o //
translated: This is incorrect mental activity that begins with the prior limit and the later limit.

original: de de ltar mi rtag pa nyid la kun du rmongs pas 'du byed rnams la bdag tu lta ba'i rjes su 'brel cing nang dang phyi dang gnyi ga dag la chos tsam @46b du mi shes te /
analyzed: de de ltar mi rtag pa nyid la kun du rmongs pas 'du byed rnams la bdag tu lta ba'i rjes su 'brel cing nang dang phyi dang gnyi ga dag la chos tsam @46b du mi shes te /
translated: Thus, due to his delusion about impermanence, he is connected to the view of a real self in regard to the formative forces. He does not understand that the internal and external are mere phenomena.

original: nang ni nang gi skye mched rnams la'o //
analyzed: nang ni nang gi skye mched rnams la'o //
translated: The internal refers to the internal sense-fields.

original: phyi ni phyi'i lnga po dag la'o //üîΩphyi dang nang ni dbang po'i rten de dag nyid dang chos kyi skye mched la ste /
analyzed: phyi ni phyi'i lnga po dag la'o // phyi dang nang ni dbang po'i rten de dag nyid dang chos kyi skye mched la ste /
translated: The external refers to the five external sense-fields.üîΩThe internal and external refers to the sense-fields that are the basis of the faculties and also to the sense-field of the dharmas.

original: chos de dag ni nang gi yin par yang dmigs shing phyi'i skye mched dag gis bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: chos de dag ni nang gi yin par yang dmigs shing phyi'i skye mched dag gis bsdus pa yin no //
translated: These dharmas are apprehended as internal and are included in the external sense-fields.

original: las mi shes pa las 'du byed tsam du mi shes pa bdag dang byed pa por rtog par byed pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: las mi shes pa las 'du byed tsam du mi shes pa bdag dang byed pa por rtog par byed pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Ignorance of action is the imagination of a self and an agent in mere formations, which are not known.

original: rnam par smin pa mi shes pa ni sems can dang snod dag dang yul gzhan las kyi rgyu can rnams la dbang phyug dang byed pa po dang 'byin pa por rtog par byed pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa mi shes pa ni sems can dang snod dag dang yul gzhan las kyi rgyu can rnams la dbang phyug dang byed pa po dang 'byin pa por rtog par byed pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Ignorance of results is the imagination of a self and an agent and a creator in the world of sentient beings and inanimate things, which are the results of action.

original: las dang rnam par smin pa mi shes pa ni thams cad du rmongs pa las dang 'bras bu la skur pa 'debs par byed pa'i log par lta ba thob pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: las dang rnam par smin pa mi shes pa ni thams cad du rmongs pa las dang 'bras bu la skur pa 'debs par byed pa'i log par lta ba thob pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: Ignorance of action and results is the wrong view that denies action and results, which is produced by confusion about everything.

original: 'di ni 'di las phyi rol pa rnams kyi mi shes pa yin par bshad do //
analyzed: 'di ni 'di las phyi rol pa rnams kyi mi shes pa yin par bshad do //
translated: This is said to be the ignorance of those who are outside this teaching.

original: chos 'di la so so'i skye bo rnams sangs rgyas mi shes pa ni chos kyi sku'i rnam pa dag gi sgo nas so //
analyzed: chos 'di la so so'i skye bo rnams sangs rgyas mi shes pa ni chos kyi sku'i rnam pa dag gi sgo nas so //
translated: In this teaching, the ignorance of ordinary beings is the non-understanding of the Buddha, in terms of the aspects of the Dharma Body.

original: chos mi shes pa ni legs par gsungs pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: chos mi shes pa ni legs par gsungs pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i sgo nas so //
translated: The non-understanding of the Dharma is in terms of the aspects of the well-spoken, etc.

original: dge 'dun mi shes pa ni legs par zhugs pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i sgo nas so //üîΩsdug bsngal la sogs pa mi shes pa ni mdo sde dag las ji ltar rnam par phye ba'am /
analyzed: dge 'dun mi shes pa ni legs par zhugs pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i sgo nas so // sdug bsngal la sogs pa mi shes pa ni mdo sde dag las ji ltar rnam par phye ba'am /
translated: Ignorance of the Community is in regard to the aspects of the Community as being those who have entered well, etc.

original: rnam pa bcu drug gi sgo nas so //
analyzed: rnam pa bcu drug gi sgo nas so //
translated: Ignorance of suffering, etc. is in regard to the divisions of the Truths as they are presented in the Sutras, or in regard to the sixteen aspects of the Truths.

original: rgyu dag mi shes pa ni ma rig pa la sogs pa srid pa'i yan lag rnams 'du byed la sogs pa'i rgyu nyid du mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu dag mi shes pa ni ma rig pa la sogs pa srid pa'i yan lag rnams 'du byed la sogs pa'i rgyu nyid du mi shes pa'o //
translated: Ignorance of the causes is in regard to the fact that ignorance, etc. are the causes of the members of existence, such as the formative forces, etc.

original: rgyu las byung ba zhes bya ba ni 'du byed la sogs pa ma rig pa la sogs pa'i rgyu las byung ba nyid du mi shes so //
analyzed: rgyu las byung ba zhes bya ba ni 'du byed la sogs pa ma rig pa la sogs pa'i rgyu las byung ba nyid du mi shes so //
translated: Ignorance of the origination is in regard to the fact that the formative forces, etc. originate from the causes of ignorance, etc.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i phyogs kyi chos ni mi dge ba rnams dang dge ba rnams so //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i phyogs kyi chos ni mi dge ba rnams dang dge ba rnams so //
translated: The dharmas that pertain to the side of defilement and purification are the unwholesome and wholesome dharmas respectively.

original: kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa dang kha na ma tho ba med pa ni nyes dmigs dang phan yon dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa dang kha na ma tho ba med pa ni nyes dmigs dang phan yon dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Those that are censured and not censured are those that are associated with disadvantage and advantage respectively.

original: nag po dang dkar po rnams ni ma rig pa dang rig pa'i cha dang mthun pa'o //
analyzed: nag po dang dkar po rnams ni ma rig pa dang rig pa'i cha dang mthun pa'o //
translated: The black and white are in conformity with the aspects of ignorance and knowledge.

original: gnag cing rnam par smin pa gnag pa rnams dang dkar zhing rnam par smin pa dkar ba rnams so sor dbye ba dang bcas pa rnams ni dkar ba dang / gnag pa gang dag rnam par smin pa dkar ba dang gnag pa de dag thams cad ni rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba'i phyir na rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya bar de dag mi shes pa'o //üîΩreg pa'i skye mched drug yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin ma rtogs pa'am zhes bya ba ni skye mched drug gi @47a * //
analyzed: gnag cing rnam par smin pa gnag pa rnams dang dkar zhing rnam par smin pa dkar ba rnams so sor dbye ba dang bcas pa rnams ni dkar ba dang / gnag pa gang dag rnam par smin pa dkar ba dang gnag pa de dag thams cad ni rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba'i phyir na rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya bar de dag mi shes pa'o // reg pa'i skye mched drug yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin ma rtogs pa'am zhes bya ba ni skye mched drug gi @47a * //
translated: The black and white, with their individual divisions, and the black and white with their black and white karmic maturation are all called dependent origination because they arise from causes and conditions.üîΩThe non-understanding of these is ignorance.üîΩThe non-understanding of the six sense bases as they are in reality means the non-understanding of the arising of the six sense bases, their cessation, their appeasement, and their embracing of nirvana.

original: sgo nas bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba la sogs pa'i reg pa skyes pa rnams dang de 'gags pa dang nye bar zhi ba rnams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: sgo nas bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba la sogs pa'i reg pa skyes pa rnams dang de 'gags pa dang nye bar zhi ba rnams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin mi shes pa'o //
translated: The non-understanding of the six sense contacts as they are in reality means the non-understanding of the arising of the six sense contacts that give rise to the experience of pleasure, etc., their cessation, their appeasement, and their embracing of nirvana.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin ma shes pas zhes bya ba'i sbyor ba 'di ni chos yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rtogs par bya zhing ye shes dang mthong ba dang rtogs par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin ma shes pas zhes bya ba'i sbyor ba 'di ni chos yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rtogs par bya zhing ye shes dang mthong ba dang rtogs par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúdue to not knowing reality as it is‚Äù is used because the Dharma is to be realized as it is, and because it is to be known, seen, and realized through wisdom.

original: gang de dang der zhes bya ba ni ji skad du bshad pa'am ma bshad par ro //
analyzed: gang de dang der zhes bya ba ni ji skad du bshad pa'am ma bshad par ro //
translated: ‚ÄúHere and there‚Äù refers to what has been explained and what has not been explained.

original: mi shes pa zhes bya ba ni lkog tu gyur pa'o //
analyzed: mi shes pa zhes bya ba ni lkog tu gyur pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNot knowing‚Äù means being in the dark about something.

original: ma mthong ba zhes bya ba ni mngon sum du mngon du ma gyur pa'o //
analyzed: ma mthong ba zhes bya ba ni mngon sum du mngon du ma gyur pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNot seeing‚Äù means not perceiving something directly.

original: mngon par ma rtogs pa ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs par bya ba gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog pa la'o //
analyzed: mngon par ma rtogs pa ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs par bya ba gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog pa la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNot realizing‚Äù means not realizing something as it is, and not relying on the words of others.

original: mun pa ni yang dag pa'i dngos po mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: mun pa ni yang dag pa'i dngos po mi shes pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúDarkness‚Äù means not knowing a real thing.

original: kun tu rmongs pa ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i dngos po sgro 'dogs pa'o //
analyzed: kun tu rmongs pa ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i dngos po sgro 'dogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúConfusion‚Äù means superimposing a non-existent thing.

original: ma rig pa ni shes bya'i dngos po la mi mkhas pa de dang de dag la ma byung ba ste /
analyzed: ma rig pa ni shes bya'i dngos po la mi mkhas pa de dang de dag la ma byung ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúIgnorance‚Äù means not being skilled with regard to the things that are to be known.

original: 'di ltar bshad pa de dang de'i don dang ming dang tshig dang yi ge'i tshogs mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar bshad pa de dang de'i don dang ming dang tshig dang yi ge'i tshogs mi shes pa'o //
translated: Thus, it is the non-understanding of the collections of names, words, and letters that signify the meaning of this and that.

original: mun pa ni thams cad la skur pa 'debs pa'i log par lta ba dang ldan pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: mun pa ni thams cad la skur pa 'debs pa'i log par lta ba dang ldan pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: Darkness is for those who have the wrong views that deny everything.

original: sgrib pa dang chod pa dang long bar byed pa zhes bya ba ni rgyas par 'di lta ste /
analyzed: sgrib pa dang chod pa dang long bar byed pa zhes bya ba ni rgyas par 'di lta ste /
translated: Obscuration, obstruction, and blindness are to be understood in detail as follows:

original: gzhi bsdu ba las rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhi bsdu ba las rtogs par bya'o //
translated: in the Compendium of Bases.

original: kun tu bsgribs pa dang chod pa dang mtho ba dang yongs su mtho ba zhes bya ba ni rgyas par 'di lta ste /
analyzed: kun tu bsgribs pa dang chod pa dang mtho ba dang yongs su mtho ba zhes bya ba ni rgyas par 'di lta ste /
translated: Complete obscuration, obstruction, elevation, and complete elevation are to be understood in detail as follows:

original: sred pa can gyi mdo las 'byung ba bzhin rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: sred pa can gyi mdo las 'byung ba bzhin rtogs par bya'o //
translated: in the S≈´tra on Craving.

original: zhe sa mi byed pa ni zhes mi byed par sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: zhe sa mi byed pa ni zhes mi byed par sbyor ba'o //
translated: Lack of respect is to be applied as lack of reverence.

original: bla mar mi byed pa ni yon tan la yid mi ches pas so //üîΩmnyes par mi byed pa ni 'dod pas phongs par sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: bla mar mi byed pa ni yon tan la yid mi ches pas so // mnyes par mi byed pa ni 'dod pas phongs par sbyor ba'o //
translated: Lack of esteem is due to lack of confidence in good qualities.üîΩLack of service is to apply oneself with desire for gain.

original: mchod par mi byed pa ni thob pa med par sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: mchod par mi byed pa ni thob pa med par sbyor ba'o //
translated: Lack of worship is to apply oneself without obtaining.

original: yang zhe sa mi byed ces bya ba nas mchod par mi byed ces bya ba'i bar ni tshig 'og ma 'og ma bshad pa yin no //üîΩgus par ma byas pas chos nyan bla mar ma byas yid ches par ma byas par zhes bya ni rgyas par 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yang zhe sa mi byed ces bya ba nas mchod par mi byed ces bya ba'i bar ni tshig 'og ma 'og ma bshad pa yin no // gus par ma byas pas chos nyan bla mar ma byas yid ches par ma byas par zhes bya ni rgyas par 'di lta ste /
translated: The phrase does not honor is explained by the phrase does not revere, and so on.

original: rnam par gtan la dbab pa bsdu ba las rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par gtan la dbab pa bsdu ba las rig par bya'o //
translated: The phrase does not listen to the Dharma with devotion, does not listen with reverence, does not listen with eagerness is explained in detail in the Compendium of Ascertainments.

original: gus par mi nyan pa ni nyan par mi 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: gus par mi nyan pa ni nyan par mi 'dod pa'o //
translated: Not listening with devotion means not wanting to listen.

original: rna mi gtod pa ni sems rnam par g-yengs pa'o //
analyzed: rna mi gtod pa ni sems rnam par g-yengs pa'o //
translated: Not listening with ears means being distracted.

original: kun shes par 'dod pa'i sems nye bar 'jog par mi byed pa ni sgrub par mi 'dod pa nyid do //
analyzed: kun shes par 'dod pa'i sems nye bar 'jog par mi byed pa ni sgrub par mi 'dod pa nyid do //
translated: Not setting the mind on the desire to understand means not wanting to practice.

original: sgrub par mi byed pa ni chos dang mthun pa'i chos la bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin yang dag par mi rtag @47b pa'o ;
analyzed: sgrub par mi byed pa ni chos dang mthun pa'i chos la bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin yang dag par mi rtag @47b pa'o ;
translated: Not practicing means not correctly practicing the Dharma in accordance with the Dharma.

original: / yang dag par blang ste mi gnas pa ni ston pa'i bstan pa khong du ma chud pa'o //
analyzed: / yang dag par blang ste mi gnas pa ni ston pa'i bstan pa khong du ma chud pa'o //
translated: Not abiding in the precepts means not understanding the Teacher's teachings.

original: gson po rnams kyi nang na gnyid log pa ni don med pa'o zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: gson po rnams kyi nang na gnyid log pa ni don med pa'o zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'i tshig go //
translated: Among the living, sleep is useless. This is the statement of the teaching.

original: 'bras bu med pa zhes bya ba ni bde 'gror 'gro bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu bslu ba'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu med pa zhes bya ba ni bde 'gror 'gro bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu bslu ba'o //
translated: Fruitless means deceiving the cause of going to a happy rebirth.

original: 'bras bu ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni de'i 'bras bu bslu ba'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni de'i 'bras bu bslu ba'o //
translated: Not the fruit means deceiving the result of that.

original: don med pa ni mya ngan las 'da' ba 'thob pa'i rgyu bslu ba'o //
analyzed: don med pa ni mya ngan las 'da' ba 'thob pa'i rgyu bslu ba'o //
translated: Useless means deceiving the cause of attaining nirvana.

original: phan yon med pa ni de'i 'bras bu 'thob pa bslu ba'o //
analyzed: phan yon med pa ni de'i 'bras bu 'thob pa bslu ba'o //
translated: Not beneficial means deceiving the attainment of its result.

original: gnod pa chung ngam zhes dri ba ni khams ma snyoms pa la brten nas so //
analyzed: gnod pa chung ngam zhes dri ba ni khams ma snyoms pa la brten nas so //
translated: Are you bothered by any illness? This is based on an imbalance of the elements.

original: nyam nga ba chung ngam zhes bya ba ni las kyi mtha'i sbyor ba mi mnyam pa med pa la brten nas so //
analyzed: nyam nga ba chung ngam zhes bya ba ni las kyi mtha'i sbyor ba mi mnyam pa med pa la brten nas so //
translated: Are you troubled by any pain? This is based on the absence of uneven application in the performance of actions.

original: bskyod pa yang ngam zhes bya ba ni zas yi gar 'ong ba dang zos pa bde blag tu 'ju ba la brten nas so //
analyzed: bskyod pa yang ngam zhes bya ba ni zas yi gar 'ong ba dang zos pa bde blag tu 'ju ba la brten nas so //
translated: Are you strong? This is based on pleasant food and the easy digestion of what is eaten.

original: 'tsho ba dang / stobs dang / bde ba dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa rnams ni 'di ltar nyan thos kyi sa'i nang du kha zas kyi tshod rig pa las shes par bya'o //üîΩrnam par mi 'byed so sor rnam par mi 'byed pa zhes bya ba ni rgyas par 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'tsho ba dang / stobs dang / bde ba dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa rnams ni 'di ltar nyan thos kyi sa'i nang du kha zas kyi tshod rig pa las shes par bya'o // rnam par mi 'byed so sor rnam par mi 'byed pa zhes bya ba ni rgyas par 'di lta ste /
translated: Life, strength, happiness, and freedom from sickness should be understood as they are explained in the Sravakabhumi in the section on moderation in eating.

original: nyan thos kyi sa las rig par bya'o //üîΩsems par mi byed 'jal bar mi byed ces bya ba ni rgyas par 'di lta ste /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi sa las rig par bya'o // sems par mi byed 'jal bar mi byed ces bya ba ni rgyas par 'di lta ste /
translated: Not discriminating, not fully discriminating should be understood in detail as they are explained in the Sravakabhumi.

original: nyan thos kyi sa las rig par bya'o //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi sa las rig par bya'o //
translated: Not reflecting, not pondering should be understood in detail as they are explained in the Sravakabhumi.

original: nyung ba ni rab tsam zhig med pa'o //
analyzed: nyung ba ni rab tsam zhig med pa'o //
translated: Little means not even a little.

original: chung ngu ni dman pa tsam zhig dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: chung ngu ni dman pa tsam zhig dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Small means having only a little.

original: nyung shes ni tha snyad du bya ba tsam zhig yongs su bzung ba'o //
analyzed: nyung shes ni tha snyad du bya ba tsam zhig yongs su bzung ba'o //
translated: Little learning means having only a little conventional knowledge.

original: khyad par ram zhes bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyi khyad par ro //
analyzed: khyad par ram zhes bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyi khyad par ro //
translated: Distinction means the distinction of intrinsic identity.

original: bsam pa'am / zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob kyi mtshan nyid kyi bye brag go //
analyzed: bsam pa'am / zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob kyi mtshan nyid kyi bye brag go //
translated: Thinking means the distinction of conventional identity.

original: tha dad du bya ba'am //
analyzed: tha dad du bya ba'am //
translated: Or as a different thing.

original: zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i mtshan nyid kyi khyad par te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i mtshan nyid kyi khyad par te /
translated: This is the defining characteristic of a cause.

original: 'di ni rnam grangs bsdu ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rnam grangs bsdu ba zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the collection of synonyms.

original: 'di dag ni bdag gi tha snyad mang po gdags pa'i rnam grangs che long mdo sde las btus nas /
analyzed: 'di dag ni bdag gi tha snyad mang po gdags pa'i rnam grangs che long mdo sde las btus nas /
translated: These are the main synonyms of the conventional designation of self, extracted from the sutras.

original: don gyi sgo nas yang yongs su bstan pa yin gyi /
analyzed: don gyi sgo nas yang yongs su bstan pa yin gyi /
translated: They are presented here in terms of their meaning.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis rnam grangs ston pa ni tshad med do /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis rnam grangs ston pa ni tshad med do /
translated: The Blessed Buddhas have taught synonyms in an immeasurable way.

original: phyogs 'di dang bslab pa 'di dang bstan pa 'dis kyang 'di dag dang rnam grangs gzhan rnams dang don gyi rnams grangs gzhan dag la yang brtag cing yongs su bstan par bya /
analyzed: phyogs 'di dang bslab pa 'di dang bstan pa 'dis kyang 'di dag dang rnam grangs gzhan rnams dang don gyi rnams grangs gzhan dag la yang brtag cing yongs su bstan par bya /
translated: Through this approach, this training, and this teaching, you should investigate and present these and other synonyms and other meanings of these terms.

original: rnam par gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par gzhag par bya'o //
translated: You should establish them.

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las rnam grangs bsdu ba rdzogs so /
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las rnam grangs bsdu ba rdzogs so /
translated: This concludes the collection of synonyms from the Levels of Yogic Deeds.

original: // /'di la shlo ka bdun brgya nyi shu rtsa lnga yod do//
analyzed: // /'di la shlo ka bdun brgya nyi shu rtsa lnga yod do//
translated: It has 725 ≈õlokas.
